SdNi8T7g3yoUgaCosp3WxQ.text: Great place to sit out on the heated deck and have delicious food with great friends.   If you want dessert - tiramisu I suggest you tell your server to hold you a piece or you might not get get a slice.  When it was time for dessert for or table another server gave the last piece so I didn't get to enjoy what looked like a heavenly piece.

0N3YCQkfnsObL_nm4VnqLQ.text: This place has the most delicious food but after three visits I am not sure I will go back. The wait staff and the owner are astonishingly rude. Among other things, The waiter we had expressed his dismay when I wanted to add vegetables to my order.  The food took forever to arrive at our table.  When we made reservations they asked if it was a special occasion. We were celebrating a birthday so she asked which complimentary dessert I'd like.  When we got there the owner said there would be no free dessert. I didn't want dessert but she was so rude about it. I am sorry to say delicious food can't compensate for an unfriendly staff.  So long Uncle Sal's.

4rBH06mU6_GfT4Zui5z49A.text: Waited almost half an hour to be seated though we had a reservation .. we asked for calamari they were out of it .. food was below average .. service was bad ..

OFoHlTM3F8t75UlAgoT9vw.text: I had an interesting experience here after going to dinner for my birthday the other night. In response to other negative reviews, I had no issues with keeping our table for a long time (Granted it was a weekday) and the crowd at the restaurant was fairly diverse. I did not see any roaches  The food we ordered was great. My tortellini (admittedly super simple and hard to mess up) was perfect, the other people at the table said their food was great as well, although I unfortunately do not know what they got. I do know my tablemate only had 2 or 3 scallops and 3 shrimp with her meal. We also got the escargot, which was good and BURNING hot. The waiter warned us it would take a long time, which we said was fine, and I actually think I saw a busboy carrying our food out at one point and then turning around once he realized we didn't have our appetizers yet. I guess our food sat under a heat lamp after that, although it didn't seem to affect the quality.   The only part of the food my table didn't like was the brownie. I've honestly had better brownies from Pizza Hut. It was dry, tastless and boring. It looked like something made from a box. But to be fair you don't go to a restaurant like this for a brownie. The creme brulee was some of the BEST I HAVE EVER HAD, although not the most authentic flavor, and if it wasn't for the rest of the experience it would be my reason to return.  They didn't sing me happy birthday, although they did for the table on the opposite end of the restaurant. No complaints here though, I hate when they do that to me, although my tablemates thought it was strange since it had been mentioned several times (including when making the reservation AND while we were at the table). My brownie had a candle, which was sufficient for me but different than my other experiences.  We had filled up on appetizers so we asked for some to go containers for our entrees. They took our food into the back (they had brought the container out to the table earlier when we boxed up our soup) and came back with several containers, which I didn't look at until the next day. That's when I discovered that I was somehow missing half my pasta. The bowl they gave me at the restaurant was the size of my head, but the styrofoam container barely had enough pasta to cover the bottom! Did somebody at the restaurant eat my food? Did I get someone else's leftovers? Who knows. Kind of a gross mystery, huh?  I didn't bother contacting the restaurant. I live 45 minutes away so I decided it wouldn't be worth it to drive back for a $15 plate of pasta, and I won't be coming back. I'm teetering between 2 and 3 stars. The food was 5-star worthy, but taking home 1/3 of the food I paid for was pretty disappointing the next day when I wanted leftovers.  EDIT- My tablemates just mentioned a weird situation that happened at the beginning of dinner. We ordered X bottle of wine and they brought out Y bottle. My tablemate argued that it was a different bottle, and eventually the waiter came out and apologized, said it was the wrong bottle, and that they were out of stock of the bottle we ordered. I feel like they should have mentioned that instead of trying to sneakily get us to pay Bottle X prices for the cheaper Bottle Y.  Also, the waiter never told us the specials, which was sad because my tablemate would have loved to order one of them. And I found my water glass empty more often than not.  Overall, it was a good experience (until the next day). I had a great time the day of, and would have given at least 4 stars if it wasn't for my missing food.

IU1MfkV2EtpcXUKh_4dbBQ.text: Quality food served here at a reasonable price.   Make reservations as this place gets packed for dinner.

GWCkv5zygPJ0Y8kJ4IYhAw.text: Come here if you want to be verbally accosted by older regulars. This restaurant is discriminatory of anyone who is under the age of 40. When I come with family I get great service. When I come with friends I get ok service. I have been here around 15 times and it is so hit or miss. I am always polite and tip well but it feels as though the second I walk in with other people my age I am looked at as a nuisance. I heard an old man call a young woman "bitch" after he made a comment to her about her age. I was in absolute shock. The old man continued to flip off the woman and act like a nut job. I am sure the staff knows who that person was since the older customers are commonly usuals. Absolutely toxic environment.

_cMv3k47dCBEm928uxsyJA.text: You really cant beat this place. Its great for a nice meal with good table service or a late drink and small meal from the Bar menu. I don't think you could ever have bad service here either. Honestly if you gave it less than 5 stars for any reason, it was you....not Sal's. I recommend this place to all of my friends and family that visit from out of town. The spare ribs are probably may favorite dish so far. If I ever manage to order anything else I will be sure to update my review.  The food here is amazing.

685gYZsYPPdpDGbB8jOY1g.text: Dined here on a Friday night.  The restaurant was 3/4 full, so not an extremely busy night.  However, we saw our server, probably twice. And I gotta say, the food was mediocre.  Nothing that wowed any of us.

q_9zH2YujLQ31OhapvI-qQ.text: My husband and I really enjoy Uncle Sals for lunch. We ate on the patio. The wait staff is attentive and helpful with menu choices. As I am gluten free, I rarely have pasta. The GF baked ziti was excellent! What a treat! My husband had the meat ravioli, which he really enjoyed.  Thank you!

u9kLZgu6m1H6SJCtrG4B7A.text: The salads we ordered were mediocre at best. The entree, decent. Their bar selection is tiny. The speed of service was the real issue; it was glacial. It took us 1:45 to get fed. Save yourself the irritation and eat somewhere else. If you have enough time to eat dinner here, you might as well just fly to Italy.

oTz0X3gZ2WSfhsu-k0_D1g.text: Stumbled onto this place during the Thanksgiving weekend when we were looking for Italian food in the Scottsdale area. We made a reservation and when we arrived, the place was quite full. The first sign this may be a new favorite dinner location: reasonably priced, good wines. Although they were out of the calamari appetizer, each of us was wow-ed by our meals. I had the scallop piccata. The scallops were cooked perfectly and the made-to-order sauce was to die for. Usually I don't take the last bit of pasta home, but I did because it was that good. My two friends has the blue cheese tenderloin (OH MY GOSH) and the shrimp scampi (fantastic sauce). We are already talking about doing dinner again. This place is a gem.

SdfmFLeSuKw7Zpule1eFdQ.text: Tip of the Day: MAKE RESERVATIONS  I brought David here to have him sample a few items on the menu that I thought was outstanding. We didn't make reservations so we ended up having to sit in the bar area. Turned out fine, excellent service from the waitress. (Poor girl was running her tail off as she had to take care of all the patrons by herself) I ordered my favorite appetizers in which I wanted David to try, Escargot and the Gorgonzola Portobello Mushrooms. We also ordered a glass of Pinot Noir to compliment the Escargot. He was amazed on the flavor of each appetizer. I believe his favorite was the mushroom. We have lived nearby for nearly 9 years and have never frequented this establishment. I finally stopped in for a quick lunch with my mother last month and found the atmosphere quaint & comfortable and the food absolutely delicious.

bZLY4IRd2llPNkfXtlbYfQ.text: Really,  really good Italian food. Good portions and service is really good! Would definitely go back again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cod with pasta...super yummy!!

fI9SWHfwbZuSXiVTAKSGWA.text: The dining experience was disappointing.  The sound level was so loud and uncomfortable due to squeezing too many tables in a small area.  The garlic bread was cold and stale but a warmer serving was provided on request. The shrimp scampi was over seasoned, the pasta soggy and the shrimp over-cooked.  I found it very hard too find a positive in any of the food served except the desert which was excellent.  This was my second visit here and I don't plan on returning.

J2GMBRFC6r26gusrUVTJUw.text: Wow, I'm so disappointed after wanting to try this place for so long! I've been going to The Blind Pig for years now, and have always wanted to try its sister restaurants but never got around to it.   We stopped in for dinner and there were lots of open tables. The hostess asks us if we have a reservation, we say no, and she acts like this is not going to be okay at all. She then asks us if we were okay sitting on the covered patio, which was our preference anyway. All I can say is, the first impression that we were given by the hostess was not a good start and she did not have a good attitude or pleasant demeanor at all.   Once we sat down, this was actually quite a nice and cozy spot for dinner. The wait staff brought really good garlic toast, but only gave us one at a time. I love bread so obviously this didn't make me the happiest. Our waitress was obviously very busy, as the table next to us ordered as we were ready to order but we didn't get to order for another 15-20 minutes. The waitress did communicate that she needed to visit other tables and take their order because they got there before us, but this was kind of ridiculous and I felt wasn't done efficiently. Eventually, we were able to place our order for penne alla vodka and veal milanese.   We waited SO LONG for our food. Uncle Sal's menu does say "good food takes time", but this took excessively long. The table next to us that ordered when we were ready to order literally ate their whole meal, chatted, and left before our food came out. When the veal finally came out after nearly an hour, it was not even lukewarm. The veal milanese was actually tasty and by that time I was so hungry that I ate it all. Then our waitress informed us that they couldn't find the penne alla vodka and it needed to be "tracked down" because someone else may have wrongfully taken it. After I finished eating my veal (about another 20-30 minutes), the waitress comes back with a new penne alla vodka, which did not taste right at all.   When we let her know, the waitress proceeded to apologize and offer dessert on the house. When my boyfriend asked her to comp his dish because he didn't even want to eat the terrible pasta he waited so long for, the waitress said she couldn't do that and she would have to get a manager in a very dissuasive way. The waitress then started acting quite rude in my opinion, going to other tables and saying very loudly that they were really busy and that their PATIENCE was greatly appreciated. I felt that we were more than patient, but I also don't feel like we should pay for a dish that we are dissatisfied with. Furthermore, we did not want to wait much longer since we had been there for over 2 hours and didn't expect dinner to take so long. When the manager finally came, we explained this to her. I felt that this manager did not do her job well at all. Her apology was insincere to say the least and she did not give us direct or definitive responses. After she left our table, we were expecting a bill that didn't come for 20 minutes and so we just decided to leave at that point. The manager didn't tell us she was comp'ing our entire meal, as we just wanted the penne alla vodka to be taken off our bill. However, because I told her about my cold meal she probably just comp'ed the whole thing.  Needless to say, I will not be returning here ever again and don't advise anyone to go here. There are MUCH better places, with MUCH better service.

4WYbHMA10l68qcaD73zreg.text: A good neighborhood spot, Uncle Sal's is tucked quietly away next to Staples and a UPS Store. Ha! Inside, you've got your basic Italian restaurant requirements; homey decor with green and white checkered tablecloths and tongue-in-cheek mafia paraphernalia.  Beware of Friday and Saturday nights - they can get quite busy with the local crowd. With a small party, you can sometimes bypass long wait times by sneaking into the bar, where it's open seating.  I've found the food to be quite delicious and the service is usually good, maybe a bit on the slower side when they're busy. And yes, many of the diners are snowbirds and "active adults," but that's part of the fun.  If you live in Scottsdale and want a good Italian meal that's as good as Maggiano's but close-to Olive Garden pricing, this is your spot.

iyOGsJa_k3z7LbFtotdMDQ.text: It cannot get better than this! My boyfriend and I come here about once a week and sit up at the bar. Our bartender Johnny already has our drink prepared before we sit down. Yes, we are regulars... And so are many other customers who come here. Johnny is the most amazing bartender and best customer service there is. Thank you uncle sals and Johnny for making our dining experience feel like home every time.

UC4E8UY2AD_cZywxFQmG4A.text: Love this place. Great prices. Mellow vibe. Bartenders are nice. The food is great. It's like $10 for a sub and it's a great sandwich.

qFq5XpTHhrq2nGil7ENKbQ.text: Our favorite Italian restaurant in Scottsdale. Come early and enjoy the bar. Although this is a neighborhood restaurant reservations are a good idea because the place attracts a crowd - mainly because of the tasty food. Chicken or veal tops my list.

rFvqOtHoc_gk-PNtCu2Lvw.text: I tried this restaurant tonight based on the recommendation of a friend. What a fabulous place. My friend and I came here after a round of golf, got there at 5pm on a Friday. The place was already packed. I had the veal piccata with gluten free noodles. The breading is rice flour so it met my criteria to eat as I am gluten intolerant. The food was so good that I wanted to lick the plate when I was done. I have been vacationing here in Scottsdale for the past two months and I have to say that this was the best place that I have eaten at during this time. It is now going to be a part of my rotation.

L0cr2lVoySsp_BdKbJ2AJQ.text: This place is awesome! The wife and I went here on our date night. We arrived a little later than we were hoping (around 9pm), but the staff was still friendly and accommodating. We each had a salad. I had the Zuppa de Pesce and the wife had the Chicken Piccata.  We shared a little bit of each other's meal and I can't complain aout either. My dish was one of the best I've had at an American-Italian restaurant. My wife's meal was pretty spectacular, as well. The chicken was moist, juicy and full of flavor. My dish was full of seafood. Typically, you get like 4 pieces of shrimp, a couple oysters and maybe a couple of other proteins; but, this dish was full of big shrimp, scallops, mussles and clams. Everything was perfectly cooked!  After dinner, we decided to share a tiramisu. Once again, perfection. Great way to end a great evening.  I will definitely be coming back...

aGo0FRI1OnX2oVUPhiaeJA.text: I cannot believe I haven't reviewed this.  One of my favorite restaurants in all of Phoenix.  The casual atmosphere, helpful attentive wait staff and the wonderful bartenders make this a location which really reminds me of many of the restaurants I used to frequent back in New York.  The owner, Bobby is very personable, and takes an active interest in his customers.  I've had most of the dishes on the menu, and never would rate any of them less than a five out of five.  On the appetizers, some of my favorites are the mussels, the frito misto and the stuffed mushrooms.  On the entrees, I've had chicken there every way they have on the menu, from Cilantro to Ste. Marie; all four veals; both steaks, and every seafood dish.  All are delicious.  There pasta dishes are to die for, as are their calzones and strombolis.  Their cold sandwiches are delicious, but I've only had 2 of their hot subs:  philly and meatballs, both of which were delicious.  I would be remiss if I didn't give a special shout out to their bar menu.  Wow.  I haven't had everything on it, but most of them.  The strip steak is delicious, the open faced ground round is huge and perfectly done.  The butterfly shrimp, grilled chicken breast, scallops, and Italian sausage are all fantastic.  I go there a 3-4 times a month (only Jade Palace gets more visits per month as Uncle Sal's - and I eat out A LOT).  But when I first started going there, I had been there about 3 times for lunch, and as I walked in, the bartender, Mary Anne, remembered me, my name, and what I drank.  Love that in a bartender.  I've been there for lunch, for dinner; with my son, with a group; for business meetings; for special occasions; I've sat inside, at the bar and outside.  NEVER been disappointed.

COStRSG91RzBWfpRR6KAOg.text: We had dinner with friends here 12/22/15 and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Appetizers were excellent and very large so would need to  plan the meal accordingly. I had their Chianti with dinner and thought it to be superb. Will surely go back again.

pOSs0MnLvjK0Uo5eApvNrw.text: I refuse to eat in chains and Sal's is one of the reasons why.  The food is very good, about as authentic as you can get in the Valley (which is a sad place to eat in general).  The portions are large, the red sauces have some kick and they pour you a generous drink.  Plus the place is a real value.  Best of all real people eat there, the botox level is very low.

L0ozr-lJ97s_odZuHRo5vA.text: Its my favor Italian rest is casual with good fresh food and friendly staff ... Its a great spot to wach some sports have a glass of wine and have some good pasta.

NA-B6cr97csmWatMd8obGw.text: Been  5-6 times this always great.  Chicken salad great.  Mussels great.  Neighborhood feel.  Going this Friday again.  You can hold a good conversation without raising your voice.  The waitress  seems to remember my name. a Favorite

NpSYtPiYf4ydF0_EkhqCIw.text: Best Italian food in Arizona! The rich decor and perfect entrees make a spectacular backdrop for a romantic, intimate evening. The shrimp cocktail, extra dirty martini, veal piccata and tiramisu are sure to have you playing among the stars!

vhRz3haxm7a71kFVxbCvRw.text: I had been to Uncle Sal's numerous times about 10 years ago.  The return visit recently was top notch.  My companion and I were greeted and seated immediately. The waiter was friendly, attentive, professional, and explained the specials of the day.  He kept us totally happy, and you really felt like he cared.   The bus staff did a great job also.  The food was absolutely delicious.  A great evening out.  Totally enjoyed it.  Even commented later how nice it was to experience a restaurant that knows what good ambiance, food, and service means.  Seems you seldom find the entire package anywhere anymore.  These people do it right.  We will be going to this restaurant more often.  Can't wait to take friends there.

o_vekUXcHFyfthap6LsI6Q.text: Update: The first 5 or 6 times I ate at Uncle Sal's it was amazing. However, it has gotten worse and worse since then. On our most recent visit (on a Tuesday night) it was pretty busy. After being ignored at the hostess stand for what felt like 5 minutes, I was finally told it would be "about 15 minutes" for a table for two. After 45 minutes to an hour, and after every other group of people who came in after us were seated, we were finally seated in that "oh, shit, I forgot to seat these people who have been waiting way too long that even though I wrote their name down on the list I seemed to keep skipping over them for no apparent reason". It was uncomfortable. We were finally sat in the back section of the restaurant where there were a good 5 or 6 open tables around us. After waiting 10 minutes for our flustered waitress (who never apologized for the wait or introduced herself) to finally come over, she asked if we were ready to order our food yet. Didn't tell us any specials, didn't ask if we have any questions, didn't even give us a chance to order a bottle of wine... We saw her one more time the rest of the night when she brought our check with out even thanking us.  Oh, and the food was disgusting on that night. My pene vodka tasted like frozen Michelana's, and my boyfriends shrimp fettucini alfredo was inedible. The shrimp were so over cooked they were hard and crunchy, and the alfredo sauce was so tastless and heavy it gave us both a stomach ache. At this point I was so annoyed I didn't even have the energy to complain to the arrogant host/manager that forgot about us for an hour.  Hopefully in the summer time it will have slowed down a bit and they will get their shit together. They obviously don't operate well when they're busy. It was like being on Gordon Ramsey's Kitchen Nightmares

zm0jUgyHxtJSIUq0QStDXw.text: The ultimate food for a broken heart/spirit. I was so wowed by tonight's service and cuisine, I would have to claim it an almost near religious experience.   They totally catered to our off the menu request of an Alfredo, Spinach and creamy penne combo. Gave all the best bread, both garlic coated and plain, with olive oil and balsamic a girl or girls could ever ask for. I was going to add on wine to my dining experience, but figured I need to cut back on the alcohol, obviously its starting to do something to my psyche...   Not impossible to find, despite my iPhone's horribly given directions. Quiet and quaint, and def worth every penny, I will be back to Sal's in the near future. Just on happier terms I hope!

eCzP2mqiad42L41AsD9lcA.text: I'm Confused and Sad...Yelp you lead me astray for the first time in a while!! Why does this place have such great reviews? Do people really think this is good Italian food?? The Calamari was BORING and PLAIN and just disappointing. The house salad was BORING and PLAIN and well...nothing special! The Shrimp & Scallop Antiontte, was okay, the sauce was good. The Shrimp were way over cooked, which just ruined the dish! The only highlight of the meal was the garlic bread that came with the meal. Oh and don't forget the Tiramisu...what the heck...Just Terrible! Not even worth describing.... What a disappointing meal!!!!!

h__MyyiZWOQgtyvUsezXkg.text: For my appetizer I had the escargot, which were luscious. For my main course, the lobster ravioli. My husband had the clams for an appetizer and veal parmigiana for his main course. We were both very happy with our entire overall experience and the waitstaff was outstanding. What a great night out!

CeDpuVGkmRe6qo8wprsdmw.text: Not sure if they were off their game, but we went for dinner on my birthday and it was underwhelming. I've lived nearby for 10 yrs, my wife has been there, but now I know why we don't go there regularly.  First, we were seated pretty quickly, ordered Starters, and our entrees. Starters came out reasonably fast and nice and hot (Escargot). Then 15 min after we were served our starters, a 5-top was seated next to us. They got their salads rather quickly, and we still didn't get ours. After being there for about 55 Min, I asked the busboy (The server hadn't been around for a while) about our salads, and he got them right away. Must have been sitting...waiting... After another long wait, our entrees came out. Scallops and Shrimp were cold inside. Were they now rushed because they were late? (It was about 1:15 at this point). We also both ordered the same dish, and one had noticeably larger scallops than the other.   Stuff happens, But  the first excuse was that they were busy with a 65 person party, OK, I get that, they're busy for a sunday, but then I asked why the 5-top who was seated about 20 min after us had their entrees already and we just got our salads, we were told, "well escargot does take a long time." I guess OUR escargot took longer than the one at that table. I don't like being lied to. Just tell the truth. Now I won't be back. Lots of great places to eat in Old Town.  There were a lot of "regulars" and tourists that the servers spent a lot of time chatting with. I certainly won't be either at this place. A shame, as it's just around the corner.

3MYWfbNY6cP13exeMRS-cg.text: Delicious and authentic food. Great service. Reasonable prices. Can't beat it!

d05cD90GU6lcPqjcinlJTg.text: The food here was OK- the service was OK, but the atmosphere was a little uncomfortable. I can't really put my finger on it, but we will try again.

cDoe5rKxu97y36OcVhlFdw.text: Went there specifically to try the eggplant that I had seen some good reviews on; it was good but not great status; the 3 star is given due to service and the Italian dressing was great.  The garlic bread is dry and not as good as some reviews testify.

9pfh6ox9oPdHDvmxAHBvww.text: I love the food here. It can get super packed on Friday nights though. We had to sit in the bar because it was filled with reservations. However, I have gone plenty of other times before the rush and it was never that packed. The service here is excellent even at the bar. The food here is even better. The best Italian food so far I've ate in Scottsdale!

GVDQY9illThCCM0Vfwid_Q.text: This restaurant is ok. The house salad was a handful of romaine lettuce with some shredded cheese in the middle. No tomatoes, no onions nothing. Weird. The bread is not bad  It's thick slices of  french bread lightly toasted with garlic and butter.  I ordered chicken Marsala as I do nearly everywhere we eat Italian food. This one was nothing to write home about. I would say it's above average but not worth it for the price. My kids ordered Fettuccine Alfredo and it was phenomenal, but then, how hard is it to make that dish? My husband ordered the special they were having that night and was disappointed when it came out. The server had obviously not fully understood what went into the dish and therefor was not able to convey that to the customer (us).  I think this place is way way too expensive especially for being in a rundown strip mall. Some of the reviews spoke about a long wait etc... call ahead and make reservations. You will get right in.

ft_-EGnOPZyX-_P3cExFjg.text: You can go and have a drink or meal at the bar any or every day of the week. It reminds me of the bar in Cheers. The bar food is delicious and reasonable, the drinks are delicious, and the staff quickly become friends!

w342fl8FLAh_3V98UPt2AQ.text: Been here many times and always enjoy myself.    Good wine, and there always quick with the fresh bread to start the meal.  Chicken Piccata is sooooooo tasty.  I would like to try more items but usually stick to this one.    I had the LINGUINI ALLA CARBONARA with alfredo cheese, bacon, onions & peas and although a bit heavy, was the second best. The best version of this dish I had when I was in Rome, go figure, they know how to make Italian food.  Like 95% of other restaurants, it's in a strip mall, welcome to Arizona!

-9UScWs5edef1ZqHHaKuYA.text: I'm so happy that have revisited one of my old favorite haunts when I lived in Scottsdale!! I live in Glendale now and we decided to head to Scottsdale for a Date Night! I insisted we go there to have The Best Pasta in Town!! My family is avid pasta lovers and Nobody Beats my Mom's....except Uncle Sals!! The linguine Carbonara is Better than my Mom's....shhh don't tell her!! And The Tiramisu is Amazing!!!! It was a Wonderful as I remembered!! It's always busy so make reservations!! You're Welcome!!! Kudos Uncle Sals
