FFhBCatvLFuXOqJCJDO3UQ.text: This place is just ahhhhhhh. Shout out to the bartender Johnny, takes care of you well and on time.

PMOTw4bpnjMKsn64RxJCzA.text: I was traveling from out of town, wanted to get a good local place.  Someone said Uncle Sals. Jen was our watress, very attenative, very good.  She suggested dishes that I normally wouldn't have orderded but she was spot on. Our drinks were always replaced and full, our plates were quickly swapped out. The service was fantastic, the food was good too. Walt

Z3t854WQpLCaytAMVOkiKg.text: I  have heard many great reviews about Uncle.Sals  It was ok  nothing great or exciting   The bartender was super slow and bitchy

wZss8ZAJImDXGfDkGmpAuA.text: Great happy hour!  Love the pasta combo! Ambiance is really Italian. Waitresses know all the regulars. That is a really good sign!

BC12odW0cV4biI3RNBs2Fg.text: Been here many times and it's a wonderful place for real Italian food. Amazing seafood, tasty veal, pastas and deserts. The bar area is large and generally if you sit down you will make a few friends quickly.   The management is very nice and the staff seems well informed and trained.   Great place to go with a group or on a date night!

5pn1oQapt4CoRgZNPVwomQ.text: RUDEST hostess ever! The hostess is the first connection between the customer and the resturant. We did not want to sit outside so she sat us at a table across from the kitchen doors. Why they would even have a table here is beyond me. It was the worst dining experience I have ever had! There were numerous tables in the resturant that stayed empty the entire time we were there. We ended up moving to the bar area. Food was just ok. This resturant needs to work on customer service! There are tons of Italian resturant pick a different place to go! I am going to email the management

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

7-K10GLIB7Zt_CF1N4EWJQ.text: This place is amazing. we sat outside during the winter with the heat lamps and it was very comfortable. the lobster ravioli and cheese raviolli are to die for. the lobster came with the most decadent butter/alfredo sauce. after dinner we ordered extra bread just to eat up the rest of the sauce! i ordered the cheese raviolli with the vodka sauce which i highly suggest. delicious salads brought out with your entree and great wine selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ZD6NBufOQX78rra-fFSt4g.text: We went to Uncle Sals for the first time yesterday. Greeted and seated immediately. Very friendly staff and good service. Hubby had the baked ziti with a side of meatballs.  Large portion and piping hot just how it should be served. I had the cannelloni which came out hot and bubbly ( it is one of my favs in Italian food) this was good but odd. I'm accustomed to it being made with a light pillowy crepe, this version was with pasta so a little chewier and not as lush as I like. If that change was made it would be hands down my favorite Italian by far. Well I must say if not still the best Italian we have had in the 3+ years we have lived here and we have been to some really high end ones in the valley. We will definitely return and highly recommend to others.

Qmjziitph-UIjSDy3rPgew.text: Just going to say... Lobster Ravioli. Order it, You will not be disappointed. Been here many times.. bring a flashlight . I love dining in the dark.. but it is dark in the pm and a bit difficult to read the menu. I can't believe I said that because I like dining in the dark.

WcXdFjs0aLkgzzz4QEXWjQ.text: This is a hidden gem!  Love the cozy experience there.  We came here for lunch and it was no wait, but it had steady stream of customer flowing in and out.  It is cute inside with the warm staff.  I ordered the Chicken Milianese (chicken breast pounded thin,lightly breaded, finished in white wine & lemon).  It was so good served over pasta.  The french onion soup came with the meal too.  It was very good too, a tad but on the salty side for me.  The service was just a tad slow for refills.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Milianese
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. French onion soup

IQ1Hwnrwt9R7Y7-8EjuOXA.text: After my failed attempt at the Blind Pig I jumped over to Sal's. After all, it looked like they were being attended to... and eating. Something that wasn't being done at the Pig.  When we walked in I thought we had walked in the back door - kind of, not really a normal hostess table. As it turns out this place was reservation only at least on the night we went. Even so, they checked their availability and sat us anyways. This took about 2 minutes to be seated despite our lack of reservations.  Within 5 minutes I had an adult beverage in my hand. If this was the Blind Pig then at this time I was still waiting on the sidewalk wondering if anyone was going to seat me. Night and day my friends.  So the service was good. And not just because the Blind Pig was terrible (read my review for that). They were good at seating us and the server was awesome.  The atmosphere was nice too. I'd call it casual romantic. Lights down, but families were there. Checkered table cloths instead of starched white.  Food was awesome too. Date and I shared a blanco pizza and each had a Caesar salad. I also got crab cakes as an appetizer. The Caesar was amazing, BTW. This sounds odd but I go out and searching for good Caesar salad. I've even went all the way to Vegas to try a salad someone suggested (OK I didn't make a special trip, but I did put it on my list of places to try when I went a few weeks later). This place's Caesar is for sure in my top three. If it tells you anything my other two are in Vegas and Prescott.  Anyways. The table bread was good. The crab cakes were great (wonderful sauce to compliment it). The salads were on point. And the pizza was demolished. The staff was accommodating and gracious. The patio was warm. Win. Win. Win.  Thanks Sal. Next time I promise to bypass the Blind Pig and just make a reservation with you!

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Front entrance, just to left of UPS Store.

XLiI9HfFVDKggWyDo8YkCA.text: Food is good. Drinks are good. Bartender - Johnny - has a bad attitude. We watched him almost throw a chair off to the side and throw a towel because he was so upset we borrowed a chair from the bar and put it at our bar table. The hostess actually came by and said we couldn't have an extra chair at a table in the bar. It made no sense.  We spent $50 on drinks and shouldn't have to deal with a bartender's bad mood and a hostess who is less than honest.

fEePiOpmhHQIuw3iN2_cSw.text: The food was great. I ordered the chicken Parmesan. The service not so much. The gentleman picking up the plate asked me twice if I was done with my food. When It came to paying the bill the hostess slid the bill halfway across the table as she walked by. The place was empty so I do not understand why they were rushing us out.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

t28U6xGEo1ggo0X-3UBv3w.text: Amazing service - they know how to take care of you here. You sit down and get water and one piping hot, crispy piece of garlic bread for each of you. If you had plans not to eat bread those will be completely annihilated with this stuff.  If you want a quieter part of the restaurant, which can be hard to get sometimes, ask for the back part of room right after the last door to the patio. It is a nice area with three tables that are very quiet.   The Gorgonzola Portabella mushrooms appetizer was a bit too soupy but delicious. One suggestion would be to have the grilled portabella mushrooms drizzled with the reduced balsamic and then offer the Gorgonzola cheese sauce in a little pot on the side. It came out looking like a big plate of slop - not an appetizing appearance.  Our server suggested an off menu item - Grilled Chicken Antoinette - the type of preparation offered for veal and it was great. Two chicken breasts with a highly flavored and chunky sauce of red peppers, artichoke hearts and olives on a small bed of pasta. Highly recommended!  The special bass with white wine, butter and basil sauce on fettuccine was light, yet flavorful.  There are reasonably priced wines but no cocktail menu, just standard drinks I guess, no hipsters here!  Food is always consistently good and you can't really go wrong here with any menu item.

49MjDzruJ4f3LIxF1Gx8rg.text: Wow one of the worst Italian  Restaurants  I have ever been to. There bread was a joke ! I can tell you they can't  possibly  make there own bread I think it must be bread from a grocery  store. There Calamari  was tuff and thete red sauce  they serve  was horrible,  that's  as far as we got with our dinner . Paid our bill and left !

aa05NAO7EO9jtFa2_3JvAQ.text: This just became my favorite Italian restaurant when in Scottsdale. We came for a late lunch at 3:00 and sat in the bar. The bartender, Mary, had 17 customers and was taking care of everyone like they were the only ones there.  I had chicken piccata with salad and bread. The husband had chicken and broccoli pasta in Alfredo sauce. Both were delicious. My piccata was so tender it nearly melted in my mouth. The salads were just ice cold lettuce, one cherry tomato and grated mozzarella with a house Italian dressing. But that's all it needed to be. Perfect.   Great service, great food.

ptfahKbdT8U2-R66-l_QoA.text: Great prices, great food, generous drink pours and best waitress ever!!!  We ate in the bar area

tNHQhl9_cQP10zcC_LOKcQ.text: Looking through other reviews, it seems the word "cozy" pops up a few times and I would have to agree with that! I first tried this place a couple months ago, and I enjoyed it!  So I went here with the most picky person I have ever met so you know it is probably pretty good if he likes it haha. When I went it wasn't too busy, the crowd is definitely older people, or at least it was at the time I went haha, but that is not a problem to me! We started off with garlic bread that was amazing, it was so extremely garlicky. I liked that though! Then came the salad which was good, but too much cheese on it, a problem that I don't think many would complain about but here I am. I ordered my go-to whenever I am out for Italian: eggplant Parmesan! It was tasty and filling, I left in a food coma for sure. Price isn't terrible and service was good, I would come back.

SLO-8yV5slGf7naNRszGqw.text: This place is popular! Even at 730 there was a pretty decent wait time for both the bar and the restaurant. We ended up in the bar, where you can order from either the regular menu or a bar menu. I ordered chicken piccata. The food was good, the sauce was a little more "wine" flavored than usual but it's still good. It's very dark in the bar so I only half knew was I was eating each bite. The server was pleasant but service was slow, probably because it was bursting with people. I would order something else next time, but would be willing to come again since the food was obviously made with quality ingredients.

DIaevXHPVeI07LbOoIGPTw.text: First off, I have to agree with other posters that if you are not that hungry or just looking for a smaller portion, ordering from the bar menu is the way to go.  But when I go to Sal's I usually come hungry.  I love the veal here, I have had it most of the ways they prepare it.  My favorite is the veal saltimbocca.  The prosciutto, spinach and mushrooms are a great combination.  The salty flavors and the sage seasoning make an excellent dish.  Hearty dinner salads with lots of little extras.  With the good portion sizes we never seem to have room for the dessert menu.

c-QJqpW1wpxuYDxa_ga2ig.text: What made this restaurant lovely was the incredible and friendly service.  Everyone here tries to make sure that the customer feels valued.  The sweet drinks girl never missed a beat in terms of re-filling drinks glasses.  Our waiter was fast, friendly and efficient.  The stand-out is the ambience.  Even though located in a strip mall, the inside is a lovely wooden decor that is cool, dark and beautiful.  Our dinner salad was just ok.  Especially the cheese sprinkled on top seemed like costco shredded mozzarella.  After that the food got a lot better.  My daughter and I really liked their marinara sauce.  It was light, tangy and delicious.  My daughter's baked zitti was very good but the pasta was a bit overcooked.  My chicken parmigian was delicious.  Afterwards we had an incredible tiramisu which was large enough for 3.  The other amazing thing about this place is the price.  The food was so delicious--especially for the $26 we were charged for two.  The restaurant has a great vibe.  It was packed yesterday and everyone seemed to be having fun.  Keep in mind this is NY style Italian--not real Italian like Andreoli or Trattoria Veneto.  There are days when I only want NY style Italian and this fits the bill perfectly.  We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Savory baked zitti.  Only suggestion to chef is leave the zitti a tad more al dente--it was a bit mushy--still, it was very good
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Really good chicken parmigian.  The sauce was lovely.
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dinner salad was the worst part of the meal.  The rest was very good.

BIMjVWy1vy7kxKDuFA1PBA.text: Uncle Sal's is a great local spot just beyond the chaos of Old Town.  If you are looking for a place the locals go with great food at a fair price, this is the spot.  Portions are generous, garlic bread is garlicky!  It does tend to be a little dark inside, but there is also an option for bar and patio seating.  I imagine it is extremely crowded during Giants home games in March.  I'm not sure if they take reservations, but it might be good idea to ask!

GATXdLHJl1J5A140mWy__Q.text: This was a great food experience. Staff was very friendly and courteous. The food was excellent and well priced. Everyone should try Uncle Sal's.

uMbdp3dZnLjdtQJ6837Pkw.text: I am not a big fan of Italian food, but after eating here I am obsessed!! Too bad I live in California. The short rib was yummy so were the mushrooms and the vodka pasta. Can't wait to come back to this place!

UEAcVpdibFE-1KMr_2AmQQ.text: Loved my experience at Uncle Sal's. I had the veal saltimbocca and it was delicious. Dinning is not as pirate with the limited space but the booths are very cozy and comfy.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Seafood Gumbo
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Veal Saltimbocca

1NvezyZLmwN6eI1zhLII0A.text: Mid price excellent service and atmosphere. Excellent food we had a sea food pasta and a steak. Both were excellent. The filet was very tender and the pasta dish was perfectly prepared. Sea food pasta often has over done pasta but this was perfect.

BsRUSbJEBeemc3-PPqwMBQ.text: I have been going here for twenty-five years and it keeps getting better and better.  The Tiramisu is outstanding, the Escargot is magnificent and the service and owners just treat us wonderfully.

eaTBhGS4KiwBy17_H4TQew.text: The bar and bar menu are one of my favorite places to eat! This hidden gem is absolutely delicious! I guarantee you - when you sit at the bar and listen to the authentic Italian accents from Chicago and New York all around you - you start to understand, you are where the people who "know" ~ go  When I learned about Italian food from a delightful chef in New Orleans - he taught me to always go for the Chicken Marsala to define if the restaurant was worth returning to. My first time to Uncle Sals I had the Marsala -- and I almost cried. I have been gong back ever since.  Since my appetite runs a lil smaller - I love to eat off the bar menu. Everything is $11 and under. Comes with side - may I highly suggest the green beans. I love the scallops or the steak, sometime I get the shrimp sauteed as well!  A lil wine, sitting at the bar, chatting with all the interesting people who love to conversation, watching a baseball game. That's my idea of a great Scottsdale dinner.

7BVz5mwrD0WDKJKHkEmlaQ.text: Table reservations for 7:30 pm. A few minutes to get seated. Service started out slow but picked up. Peppers and sausage were outstanding. Garlic toast top notch. Price extremely reasonable.

o3wNEkf4vAU7PqbSxnglkA.text: Have eaten here about 5 times.  Food is very Americanized Italian.  Nothing really stood out.  Clientele mostly consists of older Scottsdale people who want basics.  In a pinch this will satisfy craving for pasta but there are better places in Scottsdale.

wzWitr15TxEHV42sPNP-3A.text: Used to be one of my favorite restaurants .  Took the family there last November to celebrate my 60th Birthday, the food was awful.  Dry bread served with cold garlic butter, my Osso Buco was so bad I sent it back.  Server did not seem to be too concerned.  We will never go back.

Z9UdAxolCQCskDsCXTW-RA.text: I've eaten at Uncle Sal last year on my visit  and the food was fantastic, SAD To say my experience tonight was the total opposite, my wife ordered capellini pomodoro that was absolutely disgusting, it was loaded with oregano, my mom ordered Zappa de mar over linguine again loaded with Oregano, never had a seafood dish with that much oregano if any, my mother Inlaw had shrimp fradiavlo over pasta and again loaded with Oregano, maybe there was a sale on oregano this week but no need to load all the food with it. I had Chicken Scapariello  which was ok on a a scale 1-5 my dish was a 2, sad to say I might not come back, even though the ambiance was lovely like a neighborhood place from the neighborhood. Leaving disappointed

N-mkB9X6zzDPBteqK-BTiQ.text: Classic Italian foods, nice atmosphere and great service made for a great evening at Uncle Sal's. We choose the bar area seating and the bartender, Mike was very attentive to our eating and drinking needs. We had a bottle of Coppola Chardonnay that was good. We started with the traditional antipasto salad. It was well stocked with meats, cheeses, olives, pimentos and greens.  The bread was toasted garlic bread that was tasty. We eventually picked the sausage, onions and peppers with a side of pasta from the bar menu. It was terrific. Felt like we were at an Italian Church festival back home without the roll. Prices are reasonable, the restaurant is immaculate and the food is great...we will be back. Thanks Uncle Sal and of course, Mike, who was there when we needed him.

2OVLf2cpB_yrX7HmHQO1eA.text: I lived two blocks away at Hayden Park for six months and ate at Uncle Sal's at least thirty times. My preference was to sit in the well staffed and friendly sports bar area, even though many of the folks there were older in age. The bar menu was excellent and very reasonably priced. Most nights I had a good meal, a glass of wine and spent less than $16.00 plus tip. Sometimes I ordered from the entire menu. Although I'm fussy about Italian food, I quickly became one of the regulars. Very highly recommended.

_SuGqGmesO6JJ1y1fgFx-w.text: We went here for my birthday dinner; it was a great experience overall.  The restaurant has a homestyle Italian vibe, it's almost quaint (I say almost because there are spacious booths and large tables, but it still has the feel of an intimate restaurant).  We were seated promptly.      The waiter remembered my fellow diner and was very welcoming.  He had a good grasp of the diverse wine list and helped us decide on a carafe of Chianti (it was my birthday, afterall).  As we decided what to order from their expansive menu of specialties, chicken, veal, steak, pasta and seafood dishes we enjoyed a basket of complimentary warm garlic bread.  The Parmesan cheese (in a jar on every table) looked tempting so we sprinkled some on our bread...delicious.    After much debating between the Chicken Champagne and the Chicken Diablo I decided on the latter, with whole wheat spaghetti and green beans and sauteed onions on the side.  My friend had the Chicken Cilantro.  A soup or salad comes with each entree; I had the soup of the day (eggplant bisque), which had just the right amount of body and richness--I'll admit, I wasn't sure what to expect.  I got to try a few bites of the house salad with bleu cheese dressing--it was heavily dressed, but it was oh so good (I almost wish I had gotten that instead!).  Both chicken dishes were wonderful.  I asked for a side of the spicy marinara to satiate my desire for some tangy spicyness.    To conclude the meal I had the chocolate brownie.  It was drizzled with fudge and topped with blue bunny vanilla ice cream.  And of course, there was a lit birthday candle on top.  The brownie was divine; it tasted more like chocolate cake than a brownie, but it was the best damn cake I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

59Q2yRCQ1pWTqe-sw7ZRCQ.text: I met friends here for an impromptu lunch one afternoon. I was completely blown away! First off, this place has a 'real' Italian feel to it from the moment you walk through the door. The tableclothes on the cute little square tables even feel Italian! This cute little restaurant is housed in a strip mall area in Scottsdale. It's small , a little dark and quaint once you step inside. I met my three airline crew  friends there for an afternoon of catching up over lunch. Two of us wanted wine and two of us wanted dirty martinis. Let me begin by saying the wine was a healthy pour of vino! I am NOT complaining ! Our waitress was so sweet and she was Italian too! We just loved her! She was knowledgeable about the menu; she recommended dishes based on our likes and wants. She let us chat and take our time on ordering and that is important because in my group of friends and foodies, dining is a social thing and we have the gift of gab. We ordered a variety of dishes: I had the Crab Louie, priced at $10??? This Crab Louie had THE best louie dressing I've tasted outside of SF! It had the right dose of 'kick' to it to add to the flavor of the overall salad. Amazing! So much food and fresh, FRESH crab!!! My friend had the Chicken Milanese, we all tried it and it was divine! My other two comrades had the Chicken Piccata; I am always a fan of this dish, but I haven't found one here in the valley that I LOVE. This piccata, I loved! Those main pasta entrees all came with a starter of soup or salad; all generous portions. All very tasty! Get this, all the menu items are under $10 for the lunch menu. For dinner it seemed the menu was decently priced under $20 on average. Each of us had take home bags, if we wanted. But we all had stops to make and opted to leave our morsels of goodness behind. The freshly made garlic toasted bread that accompanies the meal is also a good way to blow some hard earned workouts. I ordered two calzones to take home for dinner that night. The Mediterranean Calzone (I minus'd the feta cheese it comes with), is stuffed with mozzerella, ricotta cheese, artichoke hearts, spinach, and olives; and the Special Calzone comes with mozzerella cheese, Italian sausage, and green peppers (I added a dose of pepperoni and took off the green peppers). Our wonderful waitress told me I could do whatever I wanted with the calzones; ANY combination at all! So, my dinner that night cost me less than $15 . I love when I find a gem of a restaurant to hang and be a foodie in the valley! This will now be my new 'go to' Italian place. This place has real Italian charm and taste and the price is right !

cJ0e6mwOMEWHlqye5EbO_Q.text: Awful food and even worse service. I am not sure if our waiter was having a bad day or for some reason he just didn't like us but he didn't smile at us even once the whole time we were there. He was very abrupt and looked at me like I was an idiot for asking him what kind of meat is in the lasagna. I could live with that crappy service if the food was any better but the veal was by far the worst veal I've ever had in my life. My wife had the Fettuccine Alfredo and she didn't like it either. What a waste of $50 + tip for that grumpy host. Never coming back again.

KD2Q2_K5EoqEn0LFPlUptw.text: NY strip steak for lunch.  Hot tip - eat in the bar area.  Same food; lower prices.   The place is just a great value for All American food.  When I'm in downtown Scottsdale I'll drive over here to have an excellent lunch.  My engineer-customers love it too.

Y-OTdSa2QzaILir1IpE3Iw.text: You absolutely have got to check this place out!!! I got the shrimp broccoli fettuccine and a Caesar salad(fantastic dressing by the way) Hands down the most amazing Italian food I have ever eaten and I work at an Italian restaurant in Georgia! Great attentive service. Make sure you try out some of the local drafts!

5QcjFgI6IWVYyrB_4zi7ow.text: Some close friends invited us to dinner and took us to Sal's. First time there and won't be the last. Service was impeccable and the food wondrous and generously portioned. I had the Chicken Francese  which was served bathed in a delicious white wine lemon and butter sauce over angel hair pasta. Oh yeah! Had pizza as an appetizer. Best I have ever tasted! Five stars on my yumbo jumbo chart!

Ut1IaKT3euIjg5NZLXQQuA.text: Great find, located in a strip mall, not much from the outside, but great atmosphere on the inside. There's an awesome bar area that's elevated and separated from the regular dining area.  It has a wraparound bar with high top tables on either side. The mood is fun and the wait staff is awesome. The bar area has a separate menu with lots of great specials, but you can also order from the regular dinner menu if you'd like.  There is also a separate dining room that's quieter and has seating for larger groups.  However, in the dining room you can only order from the dinner menu.    The food is great, lots of selection and they bring as much garlic bread as you want.  The wait staff is friendly, helpful and very attentive.  They even package up the leftovers for you, in our case there was enough for another meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bar area

CGrCC3-gTAy8L-AiVT3khg.text: This is a great place for Italian food.  The quality is outstanding and the service is great.  Even the atmosphere is great, don't let the fact that it is in a strip mall fool you.

070EDVoSfzozVLmuotLmBw.text: I've always loved Uncle Sal's. It's a family favorite. Just celebrated our Dad's 85th birthday there, and as always...the service was impeccable, and the food was great. Best pastas around. I had the tortellini, and it was amazing. Not a bad word to say about the place! Always a great experience.

SLBkqnacYoRd7gsJRvpD2Q.text: Always 5 stars!!! Best chicken parm and vile parm around! The pork chops where amazing also! You can't go wrong.

VgL3WcfvIMzBaoheaA9KCA.text: So a little background before I give my review. I'm very finicky when it comes to Italian restaurants.  Being from Chicago and going to New York and Boston many many times I have dined at some amazing authentic Italian places.    With that being said I think this place is a True hidden gem in Scottsdale.  It may not have the most ideal location but wow, they really bring it with the amazing food, wine, service and ambience.    I went there on a Tuesday and place was packed. Not overly packed but lively in a good way.  that's a good sign given usually Tuesdays are a restaurants deadest day.    Ambience: When you walk in you'll notice it's a dimly lit restaurant with dark wood.  The bar is a "U" shape with 2 tvs and its setup nice so you can chat with new friends you may find yourself meeting there.  The Old school pix on the wall are always in my opinion a good sign of an authentic Italian place.  In my opinion it makes you feel a part nostalgic.    Food: I had the shrimp and scallop dish w vodka cream sauce.  Healthy portion of shrimp and scallops and the pasta paired with it was delicious! I paired it with the Super Tuscan (they have many bottles or wines to choose from by the glass) followed by a limoncello aperitif that was sublime.   They offer steaks, chicken, veal, fish/seafood and pasta entrees so there's much to choose from which is why I can't wait to go back.    Service: I sat at bar and they had 2 bartenders on a Tuesday so service was prompt.  I asked to try a few of wines before settling on Super Tuscan and they were very accommodating.    Overall I highly recommend this establishment if you are looking for amazing authentic Italian and a cozy welcoming environment.  Prices are very reasonable as well!   Enjoy!

g9Wk4Le8yUJoUlpFUd974w.text: Great Italian food!  The appetizers are super!  Have been there twice in s week.  We come to Az every year about this time and will definitely be back next year. We also enjoyed the wine selection

f1IBijVGq47ywncN9TP8Ew.text: I had the classic stromboli. Need I say more?! It was very delicious and we all know that it's not the healthiest but it was very tasty (inside and out).  Atmosphere was cool (maybe a little dated) but very cool because it has that Italy/European feel to it.  It felt (in my opinion) the food took a tad too long ((even during the week, along with it being at lunch time)) and the wait staff needed an "uplift". Buuuttt this won't deter me from trying it again or giving a lower rating than this place clearly deserves.   Hats off to the owner and cooks. Job well done. Keep up the good work.

oFOs6no_eYofLiu5En5gng.text: I want to love this place. The food was pretty decent, tons of leftover cioppino! They should offer half portions. I met a fellow solo diner at the bar to chat with.   BUT the roach on the bar at the beginning of my meal kinda ruined it for me. The bartender killed it with a napkin from a pile it had been crawling around in.. Then used another napkin from the same pile to put my drinks on!! Yuck

rMsrnzQZnoXLGCBa5ofbnQ.text: Uncle Sal's like the american italian uncle you wish you had.   The atmosphere... is a little "older generation" home vibe-y but the food here is good.  Never ever order the half bottled wines. taste like crap out of the cardboard box, because it is.  I always get the same thing so I can't really speak for a lot of things on the menu but if you want a really good white wine sauce pasta.. this is the place to come.  Zuppa de Pesce is soooooooo bomb here.

RudyfohsmIhIBk8rI_1IJw.text: This place was recommended to me while I in town for business. The veal franese and I damn near inhaled it. My special lady friend was actually worried I was going to choke or die from not breathing, I inhaled it THAT fast! My only complaint would be that while I was trying to lick the plate clean, the waitress came to clear the plate from the table. Don't worry I growled at her and she backed off so I could go about tonguing the sauce from my plate. I only had one piece of bread because I'm watching my girlish figure, even though I wanted more because it was amazing. Currently I am still sitting here babysitting my bottle of wine. Yes, I said bottle, because I'm a lush and I wonder if drinking one glass is even a thing. THE END

u9RjizBWG9bdgugNtOyVSA.text: This didn't go so well...YIKES!  Let me start from the beginning. . .  I made a reservation for 8 girls. It was a very special night for us--one of our very best friends just found out the sex of her baby, and wanted to reveal it to all of us together.   Things started off pretty slow, and by slow I mean I had to SHARE MY WATER with my neighbor (not big in the sharing game). Secondly, it took about 10 more minutes before I got to order my glass of wine. (This girl is thirsty)! Thank God for the big stack of bread they brought out--that cooled me down. Time to order...Since I had a work function before dinner, I wasn't that hungry so I asked my water buddy to share a meal with me. Lo and behold the menu says it's an extra $5 to share. WTF, but why? Needless to say, we decided to order separately- I got a small side Caesar and she really wanted the tortellini but right before we ordered they ran out. DARN. They had cheese ravioli though so she just asked for that but with the tortellini sauce-pretty close! Ravioli was $13 and the tort was $15, so we assumed she would just be charged the $15. Stay tuned for how that turned out. Salads came out and mine is a dinner size (not what i was expecting clearly) but the server then tells me that there is only one size. (I would have just not ordered one if I would have known). Then our entrees came out. I tasted her ravioli and it was great, no complaint on the quality or taste of the food. It was legit DELISH! But this is where things go downhill. . When the bill comes out - (by the way they don't have a POS and there is absolutely NO SPLIT CHECKS, real cool) - we look it over and see that her ravioli is $21, so we ask the server how this happened (it's about the price of the 2 entrees together)! She replies, "Well since you switched the sauce its an up-charge of $5, and since you got the caesar thats another $3." Jesus, Mary, and Joseph -- yea I was beyond shocked and ticked off--and this was not even including my "Caesar" that just so happened to be full sized.   Basically, I think it's safe to say that I won't be back which is a shame because I have been coming here for years and have never had a bad experience. :( This was not only the absolute worst service I have ever had, but never in my life have I experienced being up-charged with out being notified first.   Oh yeah, and then the server auto-grated herself 19%...I normally give 20% (even for bad service) but I think she maybe deserved 5 or 10% -- it was the service that ruined this experience in its entirety.   The one good thing that came out of this is ... It's a GIRL! and I got to spend time with my friends.  Bye Felica, xoxo  Allison

tdpMZue2zZblmFzwqPzoog.text: We went to this restaurant for the first time for a birthday dinner. This place is tucked away in a shopping center right by our house so we never even knew it was there. The atmosphere was great and the smells were delicious as soon as we walked in. The food was to die for!!! 2 of the people in our party of 4 ordered the Filet Gorgonzola. The steak was cooked to perfection and just melted in our mouths.  The sauce was creamy, smooth and rich.  This dish was wonderful!! We also splurged and went for the creme brulee as this is our favorite dessert.  The texture was different than any we have had before...it was slightly gritty but turned out to be one of the best we have ever had!! This is now a favorite restaurant for us and will remain on our radar.  It is the perfect local date night spot.

9qf6L-XOMWPCmxR2UyZy8w.text: I stopped by with a few friends whom all enjoyed their meals. The Fettuccine Alfredo had a strange, bland taste to it. However, the service was absolutely fantastic. It completely made up for the meal. We were serviced by Nancy. Alex kept our drinks topped the entire dinner and provided warm conversation.  The atmosphere is extremely cozy. The seating is a bit crowded, but it is a smaller area. All in all, I would definitely return.

zn49AwTEZU9gqVCQiSKbqQ.text: Great atmosphere and service.  We thought we had to wait an hour and a half for a table but we were accommodated right away.  We were seated within five minutes.  Thank you Uncle Sal's for making Father's Day for my dad worry free! Thank you for the amazing food!

6t-4vxSN29MNEYvpsDxP3w.text: As good as it gets...Here for Spring Training, a must visit !! Great food, and staff...Maryann is my secret girlfriend,  and of course ask for Johnny the HUGE Red Sox fan !! You won't regret it.....

7D43GXu1oDdk6wL2C1LGmA.text: This is an intervention.  I rarely get myself involved in what I consider to be unfounded Yelp ratings, but this is necessary.  It is time.  Rock-bottom has been reached.  Uncle Sal, we care about you, but the first step is to admit....   Four stars with almost a hundred reviews?  Really?  There is NO WAY this place even comes NEAR other establishments in Scottsdale including Pig & Pickle and Citizen Public House - WITH THE SAME STAR RATINGS!!  Each to his/her own, yes, but for my money I'd avoid this "4 star" restaurant.  Let me tell you why:  As I often do, I checked Yelp for nearby eateries in Scottsdale.  Fine.  Cozy Italian-American seemed a nice stray from the usual for me.  APPS:  fried calamari and stuffed clams.  Clams:  way too heavy on the Progresso bread crumbs, hardly any clams, and the bread crumbs weren't even baked or cooked.  Dry and loose.  Yuk.  The marinara is passable but the calamari and shrimp were dry, rubbery, and bland.  Straight from freezer to cooker (and way too much cooking at that).  Chicken Diablo:  Swimming in oil, and not high-quality EVOO.  Just oil and chicken fat.  Pasta:  NOT homemade.  C'mon guys.  Where is Uncle Sal?  Halibut with lemon/caper over pasta:  Overcooked, dry fish.  Boxed, dried pasta.  Meh.  For $20?  RIght.  The House Salad?  Old lettuce with large chunks of grated cheese.  That's it.  Give me iceberg, shaved carrots, and bottled Hidden Valley any day.  (Snark?  What?  Moi?).  I also think too many reviews are skewed by what some consider to be bad service.  In this case, they were right:  The other review about service is NOT a gripe.  They lack organization and training.  Lots of running around but nothing accomplished.   It took almost 30 minutes and several please to get a drink order.  At the same time, other tables were getting VIP treatment, even from the older gentleman (Manager?  Uncle Sal?) running around "running' things.  There were only 4 tables that night.  And at least 5 runners/servers/staff (not including bartenders, etc).  WTF?  Was it a racial issue?  Because we weren't regulars?  Couldn't say, but definitely noticed.  Sorry, Uncle Sal, I won't be back.  Unless the intervention works.  Call Gordon Ramsey or that other dude...I feel a Food Network episode germinating...

wmpdYNk39mC_frustdOVSg.text: My husband and I tried Uncle Sal's for the first time.  We have heard a lot of good things about Sal's but for some reason never got around to trying it.  Well ....we will now be regulars! First they bring you garlic bread that is delish!!  I had the NY steak and it was cooked perfect and my husband had a scallop dish over angel hair pasta that was very good. Oh ...and before your main course they bring you a house salad that is very good and nice portion. To top the meal off we had Tiramisu and I have to say it was the best I have ever had!!! Uncle Sal's has good food, friendly service, homey atmosphere, and reasonable prices....can't ask for much more!

cC9Nbi0df-stGb09bczD6g.text: One of my favorite Italian places to eat in Scottsdale. Food is great...and it's a favorite place for the locals. I like to eat in the bar area, but there is also plenty of space in the dining area. Love their tomato basil soup, baked ziti, chopped salad, veal...I don't think you'll have a problem finding a variety of good Italian food...recommended by another Italian BTW.

j3mZK3vsGsaXVKcQz8G2jQ.text: I am a very sad man. Certain things in life make me want to keep living. Primarily the hope that the Cosby Show is rebooted but with the primary character being Theo this time around and he's an ex Iraqi war vet with PTSD or the hope Build A Bear gives its customers a better selection of stuffed animals to build. The other thing that gets me through the days...Uncle Sal's.   When I first went to lunch here I did not expect culinary nirvana. When I received my sausage and peppers lunch special that day though I received far more than that. Instead I was given a new outlook on my life. I felt awakened. Before that sausage and peppers dish my soul was dead inside. Now I wanted to live.   Their lunch specials are nothing short of incredible. Ground round, scallops, sausage and peppers, etc. I've asked myself while enjoying my lunch special pork chop that only costs $7 what is more incredible? This or the fact gamma rays made Bruce Banner into a green unstoppable monster? I thought for a moment then realized the obvious answer was the pork chop.   Not only is the food amazing so is the atmosphere. Upon opening the door you will feel like you have not only entered Rome but also a senior citizens home for aging Italians. Which is weird because this is the same exact feeling one would get when walking into my own apartment. Maybe that's never why I get second dates.   The wait staff is more awesome than Bane's army in Dark Knight Rises. They always know my order, what drink I always get which is either a Mello Yello spiked with Jager or a Capri Sun, and what my favorite Lionel Ritchie song is - Dancin on the Ceiling.   If Uncle Sal's had to reincarnate itself into a man it would be a combination of Brad Pitt, Bill Gates, John Stamos, and the Daili Lama. Now that's an impressive restaurant.

5qSfnzKqTKYWSi5Cn9qNuw.text: Uncle Sal's is an amazing restaurant with top notch food, service, and ambience. I always eat in the bar area which has a special menu (along with the full menu) and is a completely different atmosphere compared to the restaurant area.  The bar area, which includes several 2-3 seat tables along with the bar and one large table, is cozy and usually is packed.  You feel like you're in an old Italian neighborhood establishment.   When it comes to the food- Everything is delicious- I've never had an average meal here.  The bread, salads, soup, meals, desserts, etc. are all superb. Eggplant rolatini or eggplant parm are outstanding!  The scallops are delicious and affordable. Everything is delicious- that sums it up.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cheese pizza with spicy vodka sauce
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Eggplant Rolatini
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Scallops

pzzgxemQ9bNBEE-30Na0lA.text: I came to Uncle Sal's to celebrate a birthday and is not what it used to be.  We had a reservation for the patio at 6 p.m.  It was already busy both inside and outside when we arrived at 5:45 p.m.  We sat on the end of the porch and after being seated I noticed a large fly trapped in the parmesan cheese container.  I handed it to the server and it was replaced.  I also had to hand the busser a irty bread and butter dish and two spoons.  We ordered and the salads arrived, but no pepper was offered to us so I had to get it myself from the nearby cart.  As we were awaiting our meal, I kept smelling cigarette smoke.  I look over and there are staff members taking a break near the porch.  The waitress was finished smoking, popped some mints into her mouth and off she goes back to her section at the other end of the porch.  Didn't wash her hands before returning.  Food violation??   If I saw the fly in the cheese jar and the dirty dishes, why didn't the person who set the table? The new management appears aloof and does not notice the deails.  If they are negligent on setting tables it makes you wonder where else they are negligent.

PBWS_HkU_e4W4vnyTQB_Aw.text: Excellent, and I mean, excellent food!!!  Servers were outstanding, atmosphere wonderful, quaint setting.  Love it.

hvVFZYI1CjuPyRkMI09fTA.text: After seeing ratings & reviews, i was looking forward to visiting a family owned Italian restaurant. I was thoroughly disappointed.  Greeting was too long in coming and lacked any warmth when it did arrive.  Explanation for two different menus was never offered but we figured it out after hearing it explained to another couple (after we had ordered).  Food was ok but smaller portions and not 'authentic' Italian - a very American version.  Lastly, we noticed desserts on the menu but weren't even asked if we were interested in dessert.  One would think that was normal level of service from staff until you saw the interactions with some of the regulars.  If you're not a regular, save your time and go to Olive Garden - it will be a better experience and unfortunately, better food.

-qu9rLGySnPqAYBz3eDqHA.text: If I could give zero stars I would. Server was slow, no candle on the birthday dessert because they ran out, lasagne noodles were hard and they didn't take anything off the bill to make up for it.. even the dessert wasn't free on my birthday. I barely ate there.. making it a terrible birthday. I will never go here again and suggest you shouldn't either. Bill was way to high for that kind of quantity of service.

_c_8ksz5rQOraeqMVbP0Ew.text: Uncle Sal's never disappoints, frequent here for date night. Food is always amazing and wine is delicious. Staff is always on point and service is fast and excellent. I believe David was our sever the other night and he did a fantastic job as well as everyone else. Highly recommend if your looking for great Italian food, or a romantic date night.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken parmigiana
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Filet

MI-affEgZW8-a3f61Tb-nQ.text: Second visit to Uncle Sals. This place is always busy which is a good sign. Today I had the Mediterranean Calzone. The dough is perfectly done and stuffed with fresh spinach, artichokes and cheese. The garlic bread is deliciously soaked in garlic and butter. Service was average and the prices very reasonable. Maggiano is still my favorite Italian restaurant but this place is good.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mediterranean Calzone

sXcn5n-ROi5shsoNc4aXiw.text: Finally an authentic Italian restaurant.  Friendly atmosphere and differently a locals best kept secret.

Ob4COj4w49alrdhyhy9T6A.text: Wow it's good. So imagine my surprise when I saw this place was in a strip mall?? Next to some taco bar and a supermarket. Well once you enter the door that states proudly, here since 1988, well our attitude changed. Dimly lit with nice bar area and a good dinner vibe. I looked in Yelp ahead of time and spied a Lobster Ravioli. Well I ordered that and I did much more than spy, I ate. Wow it's amazing. Get that dish!! All 4 of us enjoyed our food and dessert and this is absolutely a 5 star place. Free parking next to the donut shop (jk) :)

031avZNXvBPFu_zil9BmIg.text: We ate outside, overlooking the fountain nearby.  A beautiful evening.  Excellent food, excellent service.

u9_r4l1PEC3Bn14C14VcjQ.text: We were looking for a nice place to celebrate our anniversary and this was perfect.  The waiter and other staff were friendly and helpful and the food tasted fabulous.  We shared a chicken scarpariello  entree so we could have dessert and I'm so glad we did because both the warm apple crisp and the tiramisu were wonderful and the whole meal blended quite nicely with our bottle of wine.  Cheers to Uncle Sal and we will definitely be back to check out other food items and that inviting bar area we walked pass to get to our table.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

7m6C81OMHpRNeJdfGGDpyQ.text: We tried alfredo based pasta and also pesto based- both were delicious. Their free garlic bread is so good too.

Ek89lJWQd8UmTl6zslFmyw.text: We were a party of four. Reservation a must for any good restaurants in Scottsdale. We were seated outside patio with heaters which were blasting the heat. A little to hot for me and I'm usually the one who is always freezing when I dine out. We ordered the house white zinfandel which was excellent. Very flavorful. I ordered some crab cakes as an appetizer which we delicious. My wife had the Penne Pesto. A rich dish with sliced potatoes and green beans with a pesto sauce that tied the dish together. I had the Veal Saltimbocca. The classic white wine sauce with   prosciutto, spinach, mushrooms & sage. The veal was tender and the sauce makes this dish a star. The other 2 people in our party had the familiar Veal and Chicken Parmigiana dishes. The marinara sauce was "oh so good". As you can tell Uncle Sal's has great food. My only pet peeve was the amount of time to get our food. We waited an hour for the main course. I know, Sat. night. Packed house. If they could pick up the pace this establishment would get that extra (5 star) rating.

4E7sIkNutZzya-wzovA4zg.text: I give this dining experience a 2 star. The food was not good, but the service was. It was my sisters first time trying a tiramisu cake. We ordered it to split with a cappuccino. The tiramisu that came out was over sized and the cake was dry. It was horrible to the taste, and I sent it back. We then received our cappuccino and it was saturated with foam. There were coffee stains running down the cup, and I had to take the foam out of the cup with a spoon. Needless to say the food seemed to be cheap, and gross. The service was good, but the food was not worth the bill.

wCpZ50_EVNgfDk-iVgo2ag.text: What a find so glad our friend suggested this location. Atmosphere and service was great. The food was awesome. Our friend and I chose chicken dishes and my husband got veal - so good there was not a extra bite to take home. Definitely will visit again on next visit to area.

PhasNlOhl_BFgh_dWoZDbg.text: We've been here a few times now and each time it gets better and better. Great food, friendly staff and  always a positive experience. Chicken Marsala and tiramisu are must haves.

-lF-gnBb79bvyULGWifbRQ.text: I stopped by here last night as part of a party of 6.  We had made reservations for Uncle Sals at 6 PM earlier in the day and arrived at 5 minutes past the hour to a ready table.  The inside of the restaurant is quite large with a huge bar up a few steps to the right and then a good amount of seating.  There is also some seating outside on the patio.  We ended up getting sat in a large circular booth near the back of the restaurant.  From what I could tell back there Uncle Sals reminded me of an old school Italian restaurant with lots of dark woods, dim lighting and pictures on the wall.  Our table decided to start off the evening by splitting the frito misto.  Since there were 6 of us it didn't go very far but I was able to have some calamari and shrimp.  While some of the calamari was good, others had a little more of a fishy taste than I liked.  It was the shrimp which was excellent though being fried to a perfect golden brown and tasting nice and sweet.  Then for my entree I ordered the chicken piccata which came with a starter of salad or soup for which I chose salad and a side of green beans.  Whenever it came to the table I saw it was maybe a single chicken breast covered in piccata sauce with a large helping of green beans on the side.  If I had been hungrier on this evening I probably would complain about the sizing but for me this was perfect.  The chicken was cooked nicely and the sauce was really quite good.  It had a somewhat thick consistency and the lemon and white wine brought the acidity while the capers brought the saltiness.  It was good enough that I ended up dipping my greens into the sauce after I had finished the chicken.  As for the green beans themselves, they were  just ok.  The reason that I say that is that they were cooked a little softer than the al dente that I like (it's a personal preference so I am not complaining.)  The bottom line for me is that I would head back here again in the future.  I thought that the food was pretty good, especially my piccata sauce, and that it was fairly priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Piccata

3wsK5AJJExdy4aGltzJgHQ.text: The food was very good and the service was acceptable. More of a family setting and the salads were very fresh and crisp. The ambience was very dim, and made your very comfortable among chatting with friends and family. It's the perfect place to come on a date as well.

CCtujMjUVweO4FSlgQ2wbQ.text: Normally, I don't give five stars on my first visit, but this place was exceptional. I had thought my wife like Veal Parmigiana, oops, it was Veal Scallopini. Our server said that even tho' it's not on the menu, they could make it for her. WHEW!! We had a choice of soup or house salad and we both took the salad which was refreshing, but I only had 1 tomato and lots of shredded mazzorilla cheese on top. The Italian garlic bread was very good with a little bit of heat. I ordered the Fettucine Alfredo with Shrimp, both dishes came out piping hot which I hadn't experienced in any other Italian restaurant. My wife enjoyed her veal scallopini and I loved the creamy Fettucini Alfredo. We will definitely be returning.

3Yn2AB9Z421cRFXJwpZeCg.text: We come for the escargot! The best I've ever had. Also ordered the caesar salad and carbonara. Everything was excellent and came out fast! Staff was friendly and helpful. Very dark environment, but a good break from a hot day in Scottsdale! Will be returning soon!

_RfBeAuHyMbbA5a6p7bvgg.text: Not trendy!  Not hip!  Not noisy!  Just delicious plentiful food, very pleasant attentive service and reasonable prices.    Can't remember what I ate but I do know that we'll be going back.  All four of our group had different dinners and all were happy.  When it warms up, their outdoor area looked very appealing.

AURiUykauJT9cvPXQp27Wg.text: I don't  get it. I kept hearing how good this place was so we went a couple weeks ago on a sunday evening around 6 pm. They were busy the place is small, our choice was wait, patio or bar area.  We decided to eat at the bar, although now I wish we had not.  The Bartender who became our waiter- was rude, and took a attitude when I asked if there were any house wines or specials in the bar. He immediately gave that look like- great cheap people.  We aren't -but we have a definite problem ordering without asking- Chianti's can range from $5 bucks to $8..a glass which is a joke considering you can buy a bottle of it for around 8 or 9. We went ahead and ordered but the waiter  was about as pleasant as well he wasn't.  Just a irritation of mine-but this is a business where people should be NICE. Always.  When he brought our our bread and salads he ran into the chair at the high we were at - the one my left leg was balanced on, and it hit my knee. I think he knew he did it- as it made a noise but he just ignored the look on my face-and kept walking away. As for the dinner it was really just okay. Chicken Parm- honestly I have had many better versions elsewhere.  And after telling the hostess about my concerns of the lack of attention and rudeness of the waiter... she replied I'm just the Hostess you can call the owner if you want.  Perfect- One overworked underpaid hostess, and one rude waiter =2 stars, no more.  Won't ever go there again ....simply not that good for the price. My husband agreed that it was just "okay" although we tipped the normal 20%  -He asked me if he should adjust the tip and leave less- I told him  since i had ab bump on my knee not to ask me- as i would be tempted not to leave a dang dime.  And that is not normal  We leave 18 to 20% almost always.

JI-j9XLQbh0msT_3jUSEPw.text: Wow what a great place! It was busy when we went Saturday night but well worth the wait. Food was amazing from the house salad to the entrees! There was four of us in my party and our bill came to $104. Not bad at all for the quality of food we got. The waiter was attentive and surrounding enjoyable. The lighting was a little low but still manageable. The hot fresh garlic bread to the table was a nice touch as well!

OdCxrp-sLbaM8LIYrlyR-Q.text: uncle sals is nothing special. in fact it's unspecial as in retarded in their customer service. the food is average but service is horrible. we have eaten there twice take out too actually. this evening. my girlfriend picked up the food and was told by the cashier that the salmon bruschetta would not be available so the kitchen left out the salmon and mamagement subtracted one dollar off the bill. complained right then and there. Nothing was offered. This is the 2nd time our order was prepared with errors and not the tasty food we were anticipating.  My girlfriends seven year old daughter with the rest of her school mates could do a better job of preparing a take out meal.  When my girlfriend called Sal's again to complain the man identifying himself as the manager hung up on her.   i just read previous reviews where there is a cockroach infestion?

Nf7bM7rkBAjvYb1WYjIRhQ.text: In keeping with my practice of "One Visit for a NOT so good Review" and "Multiple visits for a GOOD Review,"  I wish I could give this well appointed Restaurant a better Review. The service was terrific, with a knowledgeable Server,  but unfortunately the food left a lot to be desired. My salad was well dressed, although it could have had a few more ingredients (Romaine Lettuce and a single lonely cherry tomato) and my Shrimp Pasta had only three, relatively small forlorn shrimp atop some very nicely done Pasta, with an unremarkable sauce. VERY disappointing.

xPvhMT8wBPWaO1hFE3lshQ.text: I work around the corner from Uncle Sal's and was introduced to this gem by my boss. Since that fateful first encounter, I have been enjoying lunch here every other month or so for over three years. The atmosphere is cozy and relaxed. The service in the bar (where I usually eat) is excellent... my cup is never less than half-full and the food comes out within 15-20 minutes of ordering.   What I've had here:  - Grilled Italian Sausage with Green & Red Bell Peppers (only available in the bar) - delicious! This is a lot of food for only $7.95.  - Chicken Marsala (entree) - one of my favorites! This is a full chicken breast in an abundance of Marsala with loads of tender mushrooms.  - Chicken Francese (sandwich and entree) - PERFECTION. This is my all time favorite at Uncle Sal's. Chicken breast with a white wine and lemon sauce.  - Chicken Parmigiana - Tasty.  - Eggplant Parmigiana (sandwich) - Yummy for those days when I don't want meat. Get this with the sweet potato fries!   I've also had one of their pizzas. Pretty good, but I've never ordered it again because they have so many other things that are better.   I highly recommend Uncle Sal's!   Side Note: To be fair, I took my husband here once and he wasn't blown away. There might be something wrong with him though... :)

nmjsmhds8TPd11gfy8bo5w.text: I do love this place. I have been going here for for New Year's even dinner as a tradition since moving to the Valley. My most recent visit did not disappoint. When I called for reservations they were already booked, so we tried our luck in the bar. Our perseverance paid off and we found a spot.  The bar area is great and they have a bar menu that offers great food at a fairly cheap price. I had the NY strip and added the gorgonzola sauce that they serve on the pricier filet in the dining room. It was fantastic, the steak was cooked perfectly and the gorgonzola sauce is creamy and has just a little bite from the gorgonzola cheese. Our table also split the frito misto appetizer, the shrimp and calamari were very fresh and cooked perfectly.I have never had a bad meal here, the cioppino should not be missed. The service in the bar was friendly and very attentive, they make a heck of an old fashioned as well.

z2TIz_7OVCacydAU70NhjQ.text: Our new family favorite restaurant! Great service and let's start on the food.......AMAZING! Lobster ravioli, seafood, pasta, oh my! Great environment for a date night or family dinner. Serving sizes are big. A good glass of wine always goes a long way with a great meal!

gOo3Kjg7fs6vFYX0aIS3Rw.text: My boyfriend and I stopped here for lunch on a whim. It was small, quaint. A few tables of older (Italian) men and couples (ALWAYS a good sign at an Italian restaurant!). The decor was dated, but gave the feeling like I really was sitting down to dinner with an Italian family. I was surprised there was no lunch menu, just full priced dinner dishes. Our side salad (which at least was included with the meal) was nothing more than lettuce with dressing and 1 cherry tomato on the side. I covered my salad in pepper just for some type of taste.  However my main entree was delish. I ordered a Scallop & Shrimp Antoinette dish. The taste was unexpected. Every bite literally had a different taste because of the different ingredients and every bite was good. My boyfriend enjoyed his Chicken Alfredo, that is until he tasted my dish and then "his wasn't good anymore" LOL. I tasted his & I personally felt it was bland and there was no taste to the chicken. But again, mine was great. Our service was good. My boyfriend actually loved it more than the few other Italian places Ive taken him too so we will be back Im sure

YjeE1k6Y7qKhggrhJGlR-Q.text: Wonderful food and service in a lovely casual setting.  We will be back.  Had veal saltimbocca, chicken francese and chicken Milanese for under $40.  Great value.

RaAGGEDhwLUeIYjzuPFyYQ.text: Good food, very friendly service. I ate dinner here last night for the first time and enjoyed it so much that I decided to come back for a quick lunch. From the moment you walk in you're treated like a regular. The food is good, the portions aren't small by any means, and the menu has a wide variety of appetizing options. The restaurant has a classic, almost nostalgic feel to it and is filled with a warm presence. Not only are the servers kind and friendly, but so are the other customers. Great overall atmosphere, and could very likely become a regular spot.

L8PxlMzUohfO2H4U_UMZgg.text: Best service  & food in town, friendly neighborhood bar, go early, hard to get a seat in the winter months.. Great food, service and prices.. Where the locals go. That says it all. Love the place, can't say enough good things about it.  Eat in the bar, amazing affordable bar menu!!!

cHyMa8moJSMLxEIeXZlg1A.text: I am a New Yorker and was pleasantly surprised to discover New York style cooking in Scottsdale. They are ALWAYS on the money. Very reasonable prices for SUPERIOR quality. +++++++++++++++++++++

G6O3PalDUuPZoHG8gTW3CA.text: Great atmosphere. Delicious choices. Perfect pricing for the quality & quantity. Our waiter was super attentive & friendly. Minus one star for the vegetables being a bit cafeteria style.

yyJ01mm-uubfrBlMwOwArA.text: I am hoping we have another opportunity so I can decide if the poor service/bad attitude are par for the course or an anomaly. My friends and family were in the bar area and another couple and my husband and I sat at another bar table. While both of our husbands were either in the restroom or visiting the rest of our party in the bar, the waitress asked if it was just the two of us in this way:  "Are there going to be four here? Because if it's just the two of you, I'm going to have to bump you." Nice. We assured her there were four of us. I inquired about Happy Hour and she quickly dismissed that, almost patronizingly, like why would I think there would be happy hour in the bar on an early Sunday evening. After that, and upon learning how the rest of our group in another area were treated by this same waitress, we decided to leave. The other people in our party left as well. My husband and I loved Uncle Sal's and appreciate its history and longevity in the Valley, but we were so disappointed after last night that I felt compelled to post this. Maybe the server was overwhelmed as it was crowded, but we were encouraged to contact someone at Uncle Sal's to inform them of our bad experience which I plan to do immediately.

s2C1OlgJrVmNSzF7Kdk2mw.text: Uncle Sals was one of the worst dining experiences ever! I went in with s date at 9:20pm. Kitchen closes at 10pm. I asked if they were still serving. The hostess said yes. They proceed to rush us thru our salads. After every bite "can I take that for you?"!rushed us thru or entree and in the middle of dinner turn up the house lights full power and began closing! I said loudly we would eat faster so that the crew could get down to Old Town and get their drink on! They nodded and smiled or just ignored me. Real class place. The food was ok. Nothing my mom didn't make for 20 years for her family. But the whole staff should be fired.

QP85G4sLRVqrWmWM0cfMsg.text: I  have been coming to Uncle Sal's since the late 1990's.  The food is amazing, I have not been able to find a better Italian restaurant in Arizona.  I can honestly say I have had everything on the menu before, and you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  The service is one of the best I have ever seen in a restaurant.  Many of the employees have been there for a very long time which shows how well they like it and are treated.  The atmosphere is also amazing.

f0VnFiTaWYx3y2ZdIp1BeQ.text: I have dined here many times. Everything is always great, the food is amazing. This evening was exceptional however as our server Scott was right on ball with everything . Greeted us immediately, drinks arrived very fast, every time a glass was emptied he was right there with more beverage. He even saved us the last piece of tiramisu when  we said we were looking forward to it. All in all he was wonderful and we will request him when we return. The buss service was wonderful as well (Adolfo I think). Take it from a person who has 20 years restaurant experience. Dine here and REQUEST SCOTT!!

s2GzGb3v-3K8EQrMytA1kA.text: Good food at good prices. Large menu plus daily specials. Large salads. Good neighborhood eating and drinking establishment. Everybody seems to know everybody.

aC98xSvHEaL5TKoeUqgWtg.text: The food was delicious and the waiter was very nice.  The pasta was cooked well and didn't taste like commercial stuff from a box (not sure if it's homemade or not but it was good).  The sauces on our dishes were very tasty and plenty of it (a plus for me).  Their menu has plenty of choices for everyone including seafood, veal, chicken, and pasta selections.  It was hard to decide because they all sounded so good.    Then, just after we started eating one person in our party had a small cockroach crawl up the rim of his plate and into his food.  It then proceeded to crawl across the entire table as we all scrambled to get up.  As I was standing there backing away from the table, I looked down at an empty table behind me and there was another one!  A gentleman came out and killed the two that we saw, then the manager came over and apologized.  He offered for us to leave at no charge for the meal, or he would remake our meals and switch us to another table.  Our party was trying to decide what to do as we had not really eaten yet, but weren't sure if we wanted the food remade.  The manager said he would remake the food and take care of us, so we went to sit at our new table.  They were all very apologetic about it and said they had recently sprayed so that's probably why the roaches were out.  At the end of our meal the waiter offered to buy us a dessert, so we got a cannoli (also delicious).    Then they brought us the check... They charged us full price for everything (except the dessert the waiter offered).  I would have expected that they would have AT LEAST taken off the meal of the person who had the cockroach crawling in it (one of the cheaper pasta meals at that!) or even comp the appetizer, something to make up for cockroaches crawling on our food other than just re-cooking the meals.  The food would get 4-5 stars, but paying over $100 to dine with cockroaches crawling across your table is just unacceptable.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Scallops Piccatta.

Knj8RgIY3Pc-eTgX8aS7PA.text: Uncle sal's, WoW! What a disappointment! With all the good reviews . Prosperity must have gone to Sal's head. There were six of us dining but I will only review my experience. I ordered fettuccine with shrimp and red sauce, the dish had an Italian name that I don't remember, and don't want to remember.  The fettuccine was actually good, but the sauce killed it. The sauce was way over seasoned. It made my eyes water because it was soo spicy. Very Hot! I really like spicy food, Thai, Mexican and Middle East, but this dish was way over the top. Now for the shrimp, simply disgusting. The shrimp was tough, rubbery and had an odd texture. Non edible. My thought is that Uncle Sal's use of spices had to do with the low quality shrimp. Also at Uncle Sals, they don't use computers or calculators. They told us it was up to us to figure out how much to pay. What a mess and soo embarrassing. Never again, ever. Life is to short to eat bad food.

eo5Wdi5t1hsXG0Z9peCaDg.text: Extremely popular and busy restaurant in a prime location. We had salads and apps. They were good. Service was busy. We arrived just before the rush started. I will return to try some of their specialty items.

6_wFiQxBmOCCz_ic6m9Rjg.text: Outstanding! Everything tried was delicious. Pleasantly surprised. From appetizers of stuffed mushrooms and soup with bacon..to main course of rack of lamb marsala

bUHj8D9h_21ursMo-JYi5A.text: What a great meal!  The place was crazy-busy, but it ran like a well-oiled machine!  The hostess never seemed overwhelmed; she just smiled, and took care of guests.  The place was completely filled, but the whole staff was perfectly on point.  We're only in the Scottsdale area for a week, but we'll be back at Uncle Sal's before we go home!

4b5qKOa4Kf3-biv16RGT5A.text: Came in last night about 9:00 PM.  Looks like a lot of "locals" frequent this place! Friendly / Family Atmosphere!! Many were just finishing dinner and filtering out, so we were able to get a nice roomy booth. BUT: our hostess didn't come across as how I described the feel of this place. Our table unfortunately; still seemed to be a little dirty with bread crumbs that were left behind and a used utensil . It was a place setting for 5 (we were a party of 3) so we just took the clean items from the other dinner set(s). Our server was David. He greeted us nicely and told us of two seafood specials they were offering for the evening. He brought us ice cold waters & took are bar drink orders. As he was walking away he made mention that bread should be arriving. This was also directed to the servers assistant; but we didn't receive our bread for a good 20 minutes or so, it came out " just before our food arrive".. Our girl (13) has the Caesar salad: it was average & she also had the Mussels AND clams which she thoroughly enjoyed. She ate the entire appetizer & soaked up that seafood, garlicky wine broth with toasty garlic bread..  My husband had the Veal Parmigiana with melted mozzarella & their spicy marinara sauce. This was a great dish. It was accompanied with pasta ( underneath) & some really delicious green beans!  I started with a dinner salad with blue cheese dressing. I didn't enjoy this "at all" ? In Fact, I ended up giving it to my husband. It was the dark romaine tops ; chopped and piled high on the plate with a standard blue cheese dressing, no croutons, lots of shredded mozzarella & one tiny cherry tomato. My main course: I had the Spaghetti ( instead of Penne) Pasta Alla Vodka, amazing creamy tomato sauce with a bright punch of flavor.  Added with that- some fresh julienned basil on top! Perfect!! Started off a little rocky, but got back on track with the main courses.  David was very pleasant and engaged with us during our dinning experience, we will give him a "pass" for the delayed bread issue! LOL From our conversation with our server, the owners have a few other locations in the Scottsdale area. The Side Door, The Blind Pig and a Mexican Restaurant very near to here called : Carlsbad. We plan to try them all..

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Daytime Menu &amp; Lunch Specials
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spaghetti Pasta Alla Vodka= Amazing!!
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steamed Claims AND Mussels- Devine

pjALb6t-owawT_KIckziSA.text: Pretty good food. This place gets really packed. Most of the clientele is on the older side. I thought my meal was good, but it wasn't the most amazing Italian food I've ever had. The crab cakes were large with mostly meat. My pasta dish was good. The service was very slow because they were busy. I wish they would have brought out the bread basket sooner since I was starving. It took 20 minutes to get any bread.

jDoWIukf8d8JIv2r2RfxUg.text: Wow. Just wow. Some of the best Italian food I've ever had. I ordered the eggplant parmigiana and my sister ordered the lobster ravioli. The meals exceeded our expectations!! The food came out quickly and our waitress checked on us the perfect amount of times. I will definitely come back here again!!-

9Zu9eyJBh1yAiOrisPsMmQ.text: We haven't been in Scottsdale for a many rears. We have always love the place . Tonight we went there with no reservations. I asked how long we would have to wait for a table . The hostest told us that if we didn't mind sitting by the kitchen we could be seated right away. The service was outstanding . They were busy as hell but we were taken care . The food was great as usual.  We wife told the manager the place ran like a well oiled machine . She thanked us. She must have told the staff because some thanked us . Before we go back to Chicago we will go back.

cQj5k-8Sx12okejyGO4BIw.text: I have eaten at Uncle Sals over 100 times now and the food is the best, service the best and prices are better then that!. But please don't go there as to many people are finding out how outstanding it is and it gets to busy for us regulars, thanks. Oh and good luck trying to find some place better, HA!

VzhEWYcKxJnQqUBe3nKysg.text: I will start this off by saying that I do not like pasta.   My mom and dad were in town for the holidays and my mom, however, was craving some spaghetti and meatballs. To my dismay I literally knew of no Italian places to take them because I never eat it. I also refuse to eat at chains so Olive Garden was a big NO in my book.   I stumbled upon Uncle Sals from Yelp and it quickly gained the spot in my mom and dad's heart as their favorite restaurant in Arizona. My dad had ordered the supreme pizza, my mom the sausage and spaghetti and myself the chicken picatta. We all loved our meals.   We sat outside on the patio despite it being quite chilly because they were in town from Indiana and they thought it was too cool to eat outside in December. The patio had dim lighting and nice heaters that made it a really nice family dinner.   The bread was delicious as we waited for our food and the stuffed mushrooms were to die for. I seriously have no idea what were in them but I couldn't stop eating them with the bread.   Our server was the best part of our dinner. I wish I could remember her name; she had blond hair and was maybe in her early 30s.  She was by far the best server I've ever had; more than attentive, friendly and just a nice person. She was happy to assist my mom who can be picky and was always there when we needed her, especially when we were the only ones on the patio.   Definitely check this place out, even if you don't like Italian. The portions are huge and it is an incredibly reasonable price compared to chains like Olive Garden. Better quality, better ambiance same price.

LkerAvbLcl39FaH6oXIPkg.text: Food was fine, service was awful. Party of 6 that turned into 7 at 5:30 on a Friday night, celebrating a birthday. Bussers took plates before we were finished, coffee was never refilled, server was running around like a chicken with her head cut off with my credit card for at least 15 minutes, had to ask both Bussers and hostess for help. Can't help to think service was poor due to the 19% auto gratuity on parties of 6 or more. I'm a 20%+ tipper usually, would have left more if service was good+. Bummer of an experience. We're very low maintenance, having restaurant businesses in the family. Not impressed.

inpB4k4OLnBwhN-1UHjnKQ.text: Came here last night to have dinner with family in the area. We started with drinks and they a hot plate of garlic bread while we all caught up.   For an appetizer we had the Frito Misto which was calamari and shrimp delicately fried and served with marinara.   I asked a family member for a recommendation for dinner.  His response to coin a phrase from a certain movie was " Try the Veal, it is the best in the city". So I had the Veal Francese,  I was not disappointed.  The wife had the Chicken Fiorintina which was chicken sauteed in a white wine lemon sauce topped with cheese and spinach served over pasta. We actually had this for lunch today and was still delicious.   The service was excellent. They did not try to rush us so we were all able to enjoy our meals and be with family.   # 250 & counting. Of course it is about an Italian Restaurant. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Veal Francese.
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Fiorintina.
