jEVD2sSP16hnvYCh67OEEA.text: If you like old-school Italian fare at a good price point, you should try Uncle Sal's. The menu is extensive, the food is dependable, the pours are generous and the service is consistently good. I've become a regular and can recommend it for lunch, happy hour or dinner. It's very popular with both locals and visitors during the season, so make a reservation if you don't want to wait.

I706Yj_ir_lHjU5HmtGpBA.text: Used to be good.... Prices are very fair and the bar is busy.  Service is sloppy and with an attitude.

O8dpHJyY3xBOukQZdhbgmQ.text: Food was delicious. Liz was an amazing server. This is a neighborhood charmer. Don't miss!

8YPCJraBL3METX6wLAks3A.text: Uncle Sal's is a guaranteed perfect place for any occasion.  The food was unbeatable and the service was top notch!  Will be a regular!

kDqrL3B6FZpjnQNlGVoWAQ.text: TERRIBLE SERVICE! The waiter Sheldon... Shelly? Don't remember his name, is the worst waiter I have ever had misfortune of coming across. Initially the service wasn't bad as we got there early, around 5PM. He immediately got us our wine and everything went well. Then he asked us if we wanted to place our orders, and we told to give us a few minutes as we were still settling down and haven't had the chance to peruse the menu yet. After 20 MINUTES waiting, I practically had to throw myself into his eye line to flag him down.  Then, he snarkily replied, "Oh, are you ready to order now?" Well yeah, you freaking ding dong! So, that was already the first red flag. Our meal finally arrives, and the food was good. THEN in the middle of our meal, the staff kept coming to our table asked if they can pack up our meals. DUDE, WTF?? That happened a few times, so strike number two. Then the waiter came up to us and asked about desert, and there was one person at our table still working on their meal. So, out of frustration, we said no and he took offense to that, and ran to the owner to complain. The next part shocked me as the owner took his side, and didn't even bother to do anything to make the situation better. After that he didn't even bother coming back to our table to check up on us, unless we flag him down. It's very disappointing because the food is actually good. Literally the worst experience ever, and from what I can tell there are quite a few peeps with similar experiences. You would think they'd change...

wqG_eB7m6fzjMmk02UVeaA.text: Just had the best Lunch / wine with my sister and niece. Mary Ann is the best along with the patrons....Thank you All~!!

xbjtzWtBWqom4MeUO5rfuQ.text: Excellent, authentic Italian food with great service! Delicious garlic bread, pasta, sauces, and chicken dishes! Highly recommended!

VoVfMckyYn5KqV9kY_pJpw.text: The food was top quality. However I would have to say are last two servers where not, that was appalling for say. I guess you now what they say it's difficult to get great help these days.

SwlyriaptgwjImNmlbczzw.text: I so wish this restaurant was in Southern California!  We came to Scottsdale with our gymnastics team and had our team dinner here for 50 people.  Sally, the owner, and Nick, our waiter, were so friendly, professional and classy.  The food was outstanding, the service exceptional, and it was a perfect event.  Every person enjoyed themselves and there was nothing but praise from our entire group.  Sally went above and beyond to make sure our entire group was satisfied, and we were!

qnO8Z2vKuqoWozrnGZ2xDw.text: Good Italian food at a good price.  Great place for lunch.  It's not fancy but it is consistently good.  I haven't been here for dinner but lunch has always been a winner with great service.

rnzuHSFVIF4q4KnEaTVwJA.text: I was dismayed, and heartbroken that this Yelp reviewed establishment was not cracked up to be. I'm saddened that in comparison to the Italian Grotto in old town's main drag this place fails miserably. *tear*  Went out to dinner with friends Sara V. and Lauren D., we were looking forward to enjoying some good ol' Italian goodness, just like our experience last Friday at the Grotto, this experience was sorely disappointing.   Our server was plain bad, she lied or she was lacking the know how and didn't take the time to find out. What am I talking about? Well it's Fridays and it's Lent so for Catholics, it's a day to abstain from red meat. Seafood and veg can be eaten. So when she took our orders, the ladies went for the house salad, while I chose the soup of the day which was seafood gumbo. I had asked if there was meat in the seafood gumbo in which our server rattled off without making sure, that there was no meat in the gumbo and it was all seafood. So if you've eaten gumbo, altho it may have seafood there's usually some andouille sausage. So I believed her. Salads and soup came, and lo and behold, what was in the soup? seafood yes. yuckiness yes. and drum roll pls.... a meatball. last time i checked that's meat not seafood... so the soup was a fail, and the server failed. The ladies were telling me to start a ruckus but I made the decision to myself that there would be no next time with this place.  We ordered their Frito Misto for an appetizer a mix of calamari and three shrimp. Notice the discrepancy here, 3 small breaded shrimp and a plate of calamari... with non-flavorful marinara. two stars.  seafood gumbo. zero stars.  I ordered the Pesce Alla Vodka, it was shrimp and calamari in a vodka cream sauce. three shrimp, and three scallops. it wasn't jumbo shrimp but that's ok. it was alright nothing wow. nothing that i would forget about the soup incident, silently forgive the messup and come back... no it was meh. so two stars.  unlimited garlic bread... ok. three stars.  and tiramisu for dessert... ok... let's state my favorite places for tiramisu are the Parlor and the Grotto... both are ridiculously orgasmic this one... heavy on the powder on top and lady fingers were kinda dry... if those two place are orgasmic ummm this one is more like satisfying but not good. so two and half stars.  Overall dining experience, one and a half, had to round up to two. not impressed.... seriously disappointed and for all of you who haven't been here, there's seriously better places, totally not worth it.

ivJihrBrSfjvJ4s9Zk2UXg.text: classic Italian food and a great service!

AFS5MMMb-Jfw0DQQhc8SbA.text: I love this place...it's like going to dinner with family only better. It's a great neighborhood place---just wish it was in MY neighborhood!!! The very best rack of lamb and Walleye Pike! But eat in the bar --it's always a fun, fun place and the bar menu is great! Try the pork chop, the hamburger steak, scallops---whatever! It's all great and everyone who works there has been there forever!! They recently remodeled and it looks great!!!

Ep1xSBmUl4QN0Szpizw4Dg.text: I was just there this past Saturday night on a first date. She suggested Uncle Sal's and I had never heard of it before and was game for a great Italian restaurant. Being new to the area, I look forward to getting to know as many places as possible. Although the restaurant is in a strip mall, Uncle Sal's sits back off the road a little which is good because you don't get a lot of car noise if you're sitting on the patio. There are fountains outside with dim lights for a very casual dining experience. When my date arrived, we walked in and were greeted by a very nice hostess. I told her we had reservations for the patio and I asked her if smoking was allowed there and she said yes. So we opted for the bar which was open seating. The bar area is filled with tables along the wall and a horse shoe bar. We were greeted immediately by Johnny, a NY yankee fan whose service was impeccable. He was fast, courteous, and had a lot of personality.   The menu was filled with every type of Italian dish you could hope for. Although I was looking for some pasta, I tried the filet mignon with gorganzola sauce. Johnnie brought out lightly toasted garlic bread with either olive oil or butter on it. I don't remember but it was gooooood. The salads came fast and were very good.   My date ordered pasta with sausage and peppers and there was enough food to feed two people. My dinner came out and I was surprised with the portion as well. It was almost the length of a NY Strip, but thick like a filet. And folks....it was one of the best filets I've had in a long time. I usually order my meat medium and this melted in my mouth it was so tender. I also had it on a bed of bowtie pasta. The only thing that I would have liked differently, was that there was too much sauce and it was poured on my steak. It took a little away from the flavor of steak but it was to die for. It was that good!   Great service, great food, nice ambiance for a small place. I'll be back soon to try their pizzas and pasta dishes!

-5L8lkvcI6L4VMihOuUtdA.text: Their 'shrimp & scallops Antoinette' (with white wine & artichoke hearts) was delicious!

Y3nBoKT-qWoVpQovqWYIeQ.text: We had pizza in the bar, and it was pretty good, but we were really impressed with the service.  Even though we were a bit concerned that we had walked in 20 minutes prior to closing time, the waitress (and even the busboy) was so friendly.  What we also noticed was that people were picking up carryout orders left and right.  Next time, we'll try that!

1fMNyt_-0ZUhFgMJqe6KTg.text: DELICIOUS!!! While I love to dine here, I find that I order take out more often. Uncle Sal's is my preferred place for Pizza! Wonderful vegetables that are not usually available elsewhere - grilled eggplant and squash.  The pizza is pricier than many places but worth every penny.

KZ40KklzXQoUhHL6Lb79Xw.text: Went to Uncle Sals last night for dinner with a bunch of friends.  We had a great time.  Friendly, gracious and efficient service.  The food was outstanding and the prices were very reasonable.  We had everything from seafood to chicken.  Everyone raved about their entree.

lbFq3iJKuvaHa4JlDhFDhA.text: The food was good but the wait staff drop tomato sauce on 4 of my guests and not one sorry or let me get you a free drink or offer to get their clothes cleaned. Nice restaurant, good food, but the service and attention to details leave some to be desired.

McxAyniANYDv34IYd5IrNg.text: Uncle Sal's is now smokefree which is great including the interior bar.  The Italian food is generous if not too generous but very good.  The brushetta appertizer is excellent with fresh tomatoes and needs to be shared.  The chicken marsala at lunch is adequate but needs sharing at dinner.  If shared each gets the salad or soup plus a side pasta dish with a single chicken breast with mushrooms, pasta and marsala sauce.  The wine selection is good plus the glass is filled more than at other restaurants.  By the time one finishes desert is nearly out of the question but you do get a cookie.  The staff is very attentive and friendly.

v0xFMNb2tJhZXVOCijTYkQ.text: I love the food, but the service is hit or miss. Sometimes, they are friendly, other times they just drop you water, take your order and never see them again until you wave them down to get your bill. I always get the chicken focatta which is amazing. The mix of capers, lemon and artichoke hearts. YUMMMM. But i would not going there for dinner, way over priced. Best bet is to do lunch which is basically the same menu and portions but half the price. If you go there just for the food, it's great.

mYBBWuaFbuwRb5eKS72QPA.text: You can't go wrong at Uncle Sal's.  We have never had a bad meal.  The atmosphere is relaxing and cozy and the service is great.  Pick anything on the menu because you will be pleased

BObj-Xid8dBP5q1LQrE3NQ.text: The atmosphere is great, the service is fast and friendly and the food is very good.  I got a chicken entree which came with garlic bread, a salad, a side of pasta with marinara and a vegetable.  They have a large selection on the menu for dinner and a bar/lunch menu featuring cold and hot sandwiches, calzones, and pizza.  I went on a Saturday at 6pm and there was no wait.

ivrug-dcSFuReUzrfAAZRg.text: Love this place... can you veal me people!  Can you veal the love in the air?  Best bar menu in Scottsdale, no veal, but all great.  Very good meatballs, best egg plant parm on the west coast, and did I mention veal?  Eat here 2x/year and these guys can handle groups.... get there early or make a reservation as the word on the value is out to the medicare crew....great outdoor space too, but I am more focused on the food and corktailz..... need a lunch fix of this joint?  They have a side restaurant that is awesome.   Wish this was near my home.   Uncle Sal, you rock!

4SnlDUtnzYdeTj8qDPtSKg.text: My boyfriend and I went here for dinner on a Sunday night and I have to say the food is outstanding.  We started with drinks and appetizers at the bar. The drinks were affordable and a good pour. We then sat in the dinning area for our meal. The servers were attentive and we knew right away we were going to split both the fillet mingon gorgonzola and baked ziti.  The garlic bread definitely lived up to the reviews and the salads were fresh and delicious.  Both entrees kept us ranting and raving for the rest of the night. Fine dining quality food in a non-fine dining atmosphere.  Mom & pop type ambiance. Overall...5 star experience

lbM4IEEAqw3InVqYPkGoVg.text: We go to Uncle Sal's every other week for lunch.  Great atmosphere and great food.  Not the "best" food, but it's always an enjoyable experience.

DuHCFG92QHI9U6H_z200cQ.text: My wife and I have been coming to this neighborhood Italian restaurant since before we were married (over 3 years ago). It is a quaint little authentic Italian place hidden in a strip mall. We are both bartenders, so we gravitated towards the bar. We were immediately entertained by Johnny and Mary Ann. They were attentive, fun and great at what they do. The drinks were made right (and my wife is very picky about her dirty Martini's) and the wine kept flowing for me. The food was delicious and very affordable. We have made this our date night spot and stop in as much as possible. In the 3 years we have been coming here, we have yet to have a bad experience or a bad meal. Make sure you get there earlier, since they close at 9pm most nights. The crowd is a great mix of older locals and younger people who are just discovering this spot. It is great for a quick meal or a date night. We love this place!

VhG7FgMPwc0_Y-sgddMSyg.text: Every single time I come here, my food is 5-star with extremely reasonable prices!  MaryAnn is the best bartender ever and have always loved this place!  I will be returning as often as I can!

A16FG9JP41UbjBvCUpj0PA.text: Finally, a True Italian restaurant in Phoenix. Eaten there at least a dozen times and always had a great dinner and great dining experience.   Meals all come with garlic bread (unlimited) and a salad or soup included.   The salad is a very large portion with real Parmesan cheese shavings on top. Delicious.   All chicken dishes are $17. All veal dishes are $24. Everything we've ordered or our friends have ordered has always been fresh, hot, well prepared and beyond delicious.   The owners are from the East Coast and really know how to prepare Italian food.   Absolute winner in Phoenix, our "go to" Italian restaurant and one of the few places we take guests and friends for dinner.

ilTRyoPYuS8amh5h-rZUAw.text: Uncle Sal's lives up to the hype, people!!! This may be my new favorite neighborhood Italian restaurant! I could go on and on because everything was absolutely perfect! Not sure exactly what their policy is on reservations, but I would recommend making one just to be safe. Since we didn't have one, we sat at the high tops in the bar area. No problem for us, it was still a great vibe and speedy / awesome service!   I ordered the penne alla vodka and it.was.delicious. There's a reason it's on their house specials portion of the menu! AZ is lucky to have this local gem. Can't wait to come back very very soon!

DH4KYfXSabgJYWa6IKqvZA.text: Hidden gem right next to old town Scottsdale. Moody dark vibe. Casual yet somewhat formal. Very clean and staff is helpful.  I had the pesce all's vodka. And It was AMAZING!! I would add some more spice too it (don't forget to ask for red pepper flakes) Definitely recommend to any who haven't been here yet.

PJAoZBgkbwc_zwknJwZgmg.text: The only reason I gave this place a 4 instead of a 5 was because the food took along time to come to the table. What came out was fantastic. We sat outside on the patio on a beautiful day. One gal had her pizza come long after ours as the kitchen had missed it on the ticket but they gave it and s dessert to her free and were very apologetic.serving sizes were huge and we had a meal for later. Recommend going for the lunch meal as dinner prices are quite a bit more expensive.

EQodVlbBtIZOakG_Hx-VbQ.text: Great place with great service. Now I know where to go for NY style Italian Food. I had the Veal Parmigiana and was able to cut it with a butter knife. My wife had Chicken Francese, which is hard to find out here, it was fantastic. Had to have dessert to go. The cheesecake rivaled my wife's & the cannoli was outstanding. Will definitely return.

ZNDCkerQfeTACjUmC80M8Q.text: The service was wonderful.  The food taste great. A appetizer and entree are to much food for us. The wine choice with advise from server was good. Sat on the patio . It was good

2XsFtN61Pv9pMmrJ9DulhA.text: Favorite restaurant. Today I had New York Steak with Gorgonzola Sauce with vegetables. Ordered rare and that's how it was cooked. The salad with blue cheese dressing was delicious. The best lunch ever for $15.00! I'll be back. (I love the happy hour as well.)

JDicJ1juoIg3PjlH_7Vzlg.text: I've eaten in the restaurant about a year ago. And it was exellent. We ordered a steak and a pizza and it was both very good. But recently I went to their side door section around the corner of the building. And we ordered a pizza by phone. The pizza wasn't as good as the first time, it seems like they skimped on the cheese and ingredients. But it was a very good price for the large. So if you order a pizza by phone at the side door just mentioned that your last pizza didn't have much cheese or ingredients on it and if they could put a little more on it.

wR79z6f0RUEtZWM8SvY0bw.text: I am still in shock.. I am not one to write negative reviews, however my family and I have never felt more uncomfortable and/or unwanted dining at an establishment before. My wife and I wanted to take my younger sister, who is visiting Phoenix for the weekend on summer break, to a nice dinner. We decided to come here because of the great Yelp Reviews and photos.   My wife and I already knew what we wanted to order because we were drooling over the yelp photos prior to coming. When our server, Jennifer (middle aged blonde woman), came to take our order my younger sister asked her to start with me because she was still indecisive about what she wanted. We were all taken back when Jennifer said, "No I'm going to start with you first." My sweet sister, feeling frazzled, ordered something out of pressure because she didn't want to make us wait.   My wife then ordered the Pesce Alla Vodka and asked to sub spinach instead of pasta. Jennifer gave her an annoyed look, but begrudgingly agreed to the substitution.   10 minutes later, when we thought our orders were being prepared, our server came out and told my wife she will only substitute the pasta for spinach with an up-charge of $7.00. $7?! Are you out of your mind? It felt like a passive aggressive "fuck you". So my wife politely declined and cancelled her order sticking with the salad she ordered as a starter dish. To make the uncomfortable situation even more uncomfortable Jennifer then said, "okay that's fine, but now it's gonna take longer for everyones food to come out". As if she was trying to punish my wife for canceling her order after refusing to pay $7 for spinach.   We continued to receive a snarky attitude from Jennifer throughout our whole dining experience and could not wait to leave! Needless to say we will not return. And we will not recommend this place to our family and friends.

54K0ro-Rr9Q0Uyc1qCDUOg.text: Chicken saltabocco and veal Marsala. Yummy!!!    This place was recommended to me by a work colleague and it did not disappoint! Atmosphere was authentic and aroma filled. Service was friendly and efficient. Our meal over all was lovely.   We started with the Frito Misto. This was a very generous sized portion (enough for 4-5 people). Next our entree salads arrived, the salad was nicely sized as well and the Italian dressing was great. The entrees arrived shortly after we had finished our salads. They were both delicious and tender.   The only disappointment of the evening was dessert and that is only because they were out of the tiramisu  ( which is what I really wanted) but I save myself some calories ... I will definitely return and hopefully they will have the tiramisu waiting

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Veal Marsala

hY0RiSqm9X-jeYJQ_9cxWw.text: What a lovely place! The service was excellent (thank you David!), and the food was delicious. Hubby didn't leave even half a haricot vert on his plate of Veal Parmesan. Very good wine list, and it was clear our server did his homework on the selections. His help with both the wine and vegetarian options was spot-on! (The Eggplant Parmesan was yummy!) If you're here for Spring Training, skip the crowded burger bars downtown one night and treat yourself to Uncle Sal's.

8Fl1oBJJYNKBF8fyek4ObQ.text: Uncle Sal's has so many classic Italian options that it can by hard to decide what to pick! I ordered the chicken piccata entree. It comes with either a soup or salad and a side of veggies. They only have one soup option, the soup of the day. It was a chicken veggie soup on the day I visited. The flavors in the soup where very complex and impressive! It had the perfect amount of spice to it! My chicken piccata was good! It was a good amount of chicken and pasta. But the lemon sauce was too thick and sticky. I prefer a lighter sauce on chicken piccata. It also came with a side of French green beans which were delicious!

0BiuaNIz4Oh8rDCER8oO8w.text: Hey, this is easy......live here, eat here, and once lived in close to Little Italy, NYC. The food is a consistent 5star, service a consistent 2-3 star....so a blended 4 star review. In the end, the cuisine +++ overshines the service---

ne1GRddKPEVSmIIABA0TTA.text: This is the last time I visit Sal's. I stopped coming here a few months ago because the bartenders like to substitute patron drink preferences with inferior cheap liquor. They do it hiding behind the cash register. They forget - some people watch what bottles are used to make a drink. My bartender was caught before, and again tonight.   If I ask for grey goose - I expect grey goose! Same goes for wine! If I want Meiomi, don't give me Banfi or some cheap Italian version.  The last time (3+ months ago) I was at Uncle Sal's I learned my bartender substituted my wine request with an inferior brand. They didn't tell me and it tasted like shit. So I sent it back and asked for a new bottle to be opened and poured in front of me. Toni's excuse - they didn't have an open bottle when I ordered it. Keep an eye on your drinks being made. I've seen it happen with other patrons who are too drunk to notice or not observant to care  Would have liked to stay - but with ignorance and substitutions - not worth my time.

n9AnWUoqS1c8hm2ut0FRrQ.text: Off to a good start with the garlic bread.  Wife likes the salad.  Good personal service, so far.  Ordered the Chicken Parm with meat sauce.  Probably should stick with the marinara.  My mistake.  Light on the spaghetti.  Very tender and tasty, though. Lots of food.

cZF-Ox73oSEIVYMZ20Z3EA.text: Worst service ever. Sally seemed not to want to serve us. Was it because we were Only Mexicans besides the help. Food was ok not even that good.  When she sat us she placed menus on table and walked away.  But everyone else got to hear about the specials.  I could go on but rather not.

EAkiPpsDn48_Evd938mcSg.text: As a transplanted northeaster who has spent 15 years in ATX and just recently arrived in PHX I'm a tad particular when it comes to Italian cuisine. I'm always on the prowl for peasant Italian food you know where the red sauce is called gravy.  Uncle Sal's was recommended by a few locals as the place for what I craved. On a very busy Saturday night Sal's got a great table on the patio.  Our martinis were shaken and delivered with blue cheese stuffed olives. Memories of the perfect Ketel One martinis served at the Paul R Pub in Austin danced in my head as we toasted and sipped.   We started with their baked clams and plus one who would never ever think about eating a clam loved them. My Caesar salad arrive with extra anchovies as requested, perfecto! Our pasta entrees were cooked to perfection, el dente. Loved the gravy. As a nit the cannoli desert was OK not great, but it did not take away from our wonderful dining experience. Lastly, service is wonderful from host desk through the service.

_pbczYP0Whw9Pfbg4QkXhQ.text: The food is great and authentic Italian food. The service is even better! Waiters are very attentive and do a great job. I looked at many Italian places to eat at while in Scottsdale and so glad I chose this one. Food is simple, authentic and crazy good

SrY25jkoYjzSQhGcQOFwXw.text: I so wanted to like this restaurant as we've heard about it for years.  We finally made it there for lunch on May 17, 2019.  While my wife enjoyed her tortellini dish, my chicken piccata was a major disappointment.  This is one of my favorite dishes and I often order it at a new Italian restaurant to get a sense of their selections.  "Piccata" itself means thin slices of meat, dusted with flour, sauteed in oil/butter, then served over pasta with a lemon/white wine sauce and capers.  I make it home often, too.  Uncle Sal's dish is a chicken breast, not pounded thin, and apparently boiled, because it had no color indicating browning in oil/butter.  The sauce was the consistency and taste of Campbell's cream of chicken soup with lemon juice added.  A few capers were tossed on to the plate.  I've never had a piccata that was not thinly sliced meat or that was not browned in butter/oil.  How this is Italian is beyond me. One of our guests has severe dietary restrictions and when she asked for scallops to be cooked a certain way (just seared in olive oil, no pasta or sauce, but grean beans on the side) our server gave her a hard time, stating that he'll ask the cook if he can prepare the scallops that way and no guarantee and she'd have to take what the chef sent out - No Returns!!!  That's good customer service. She did get the scallops the way she wanted but the server seemed sullen for the rest of the meal and returned only once to see how we were doing. Our other guest ordered eggplant parmigiano and it arrived looking more like lasagne, but he said it was good. Lunch for 4 at lunch was $85, with no alcohol and before tip. If you're looking for authentic Italian cuisine, I think you can do better than Uncle Sal's.  Its not on our return list.

ycqYrkfPA4rjN96klBDJKA.text: We are in town for a conference & drove about 20 minutes out of our area to search this place out because of all the great reviews. We make it a point to seek out family owned restaurants and avoid chains whenever possible. The dinner menu had an excellent selection so everyone got to order something different. The flavor of the food was fantastic. The portion size left a lot to be desired, the side salad is maybe a handful of lettuce served with one cherry tomato & shredded cheese. Considering how inexpensive pasta is I find Italian restaurants in general seem to overcharge, but their saving grace is usually that the portion sizes are usually family style or simple very healthy in size. I ordered the chicken piccata (which as I said was delicious) but it literally had about 4 bites of spaghetti with it. My husband asked for a side of spaghetti which was again about a handful & we were charged $5.00 over & about the $17.00 for the meal in the first place. The bus guy literally seemed to be hounding us for our plates, if anyone took a moment to pause & visit during the course of our meal he's come over & ask if he could take the plate. It was not relaxing. The waitress was nice enough, but scarce & seemed irritated that we asked for the spaghetti then never came back once she placed the check, which she kind of slid onto the table in passing as if she didn't have the time to stop in an almost empty dining room. Ultimately, the three stars are for the flavor of the food.

RFncvCAMVaQb0uju5gkaUw.text: We found this wonderful place while searching for a dinner spot during Superbowl weekend.  Great service, great selection of entrees and awesome atmosphere.  With the trip.  Look for the Goodfellas table in the bar...

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Goodfellas table in the bar!

bZk1RjkMbxdA83NW585EMA.text: My birthday is on the 18th and my moms in on the 19th. My grandma takes us both here to celebrate out birthdays each year. I have always had a very pleasant experience here. The food is superb, service is good and atmosphere is cozy. I recently ordered the pesce alla vodka, with spinach instead of pasta. It was amazing! The chicken parmesan, garlic bread and eggplant parmesan are also very good. This has always been a special place for me and I would definitely recommend it.

B66mqN44DBubOkd7WHvUDw.text: Solid little Italian food in this Scottsdale strip mall.  You wouldn't think much of it from the outside (nestled into a strip mall anchored by an Office Depot with patio views of a Carl's Jr), but the inside makes you forget you're in a suburban strip mall and the ambiance, service, and food are excellent.  My server was great.  Five stars all the way.  I let her choose what I was eating (after eliminating a few items I wasn't interested in) and she brought me an order of chicken parmesan.  It was great.  No complaints whatsoever.    My glass of the house cab wasn't spectacular but, whatever.  That's on me (kind of).  Unless I missed something, they have a fine selection of wine by the bottle but the selection of individual glasses was very limited.  Overall, my experience at Uncle Sal's was enjoyable and it is a place I'll be back to.

YIjzOJN1yHG2Qh-kyK6hAQ.text: The best consistent Italian Food in the Valley! LOVE this place! Have visited this restaurant with friends and family for years! It is just YUM!

VkEh328W38o7LSqYI94WHg.text: What a great neighborhood find!  My daughter and I had such a great time!  They were very accommodating for us.  I hope my hubby and I get to return for happy hour or some time at the bar.  Very nice, casual environment (and clean)!!  I hesitate to give it 5 stars because the service wasn't totally spot on... I am open to upgrade my rating upon a favorable return.  We will be back.  I will recommend.  :)

Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This is how you eat psgetti!

_ckjTY9sQPAcVw4AIm4-QA.text: I've been looking and longing for an incredible Italian restaurant for over six years of living off and on in the valley.  This is it.  I'll repeat, this is it.    The linguine with clams is nothing short of amazing.  The sauce is light and not overpowering.  I got the white sauce.  The only way clams should be served in my humble opinion.    Caprese salad.  Let's just back up a second and talk about the components. What makes a good caprese?  I'll tell you what.  The balsamic vinegar.  I could bathe in that sweet syrupy delight of what most Americans will never know unless they go abroad to Italy and do a tasting or they happen to work in the restaurant industry.  Absolutely incredible.  The cheese was and is incredible.  There is a creaminess to this mozzarella that possess just the right hint of salt.  No pucker like you find in some rushed mozzarellas.  My only suggestion would be heartier tomatoes.  As this is the season for good Romas and beefsteaks.  I will be back.  And I'm coming for the veal.  Be warned and thank you.  I'm shaking my head with a tear in my eye.

Do3G76lwxVtBrB9XjFxa_A.text: This place is in a strip mall, but do not judge a book by its cover, it is cute inside.   My gf had wine and I had the Chicken Parmigiana. She enjoyed her glass of wine and my plate was HUGE! Two big pieces of chicken, and it was very good. The bread was also delicious and loaded with butter and garlic. Service was on key too.   I would definitely go back.

B2OiMRfbTPcf55LOxT4vQg.text: Uncle Sal's is absolutely the best service and food in Arizona (except one small Latin American restaurant in Tucson).  I have been dining at Uncle Sal's for many years (at least 10) and find the wine, the meal, and the service to always, always be exceptional.   Elizabeth

DVpoeR8y1IV8K44XD42NWA.text: I used to love this restaurant, but it seems the food has changed recently. The ravioli used to be delicious, but now it appears they are using some generic frozen ones that they reheat and pour sauce over. The lasagna was pretty tasteless too. It is now wonder the food came so quickly after we put in our order.   On the positive side, the service is great, the bread and salad are still very good, and they have some reasonably priced glasses of wine. Unfortunately, these positives can not overcome the disappointing, mediocre food.

htiIniNE0VmJg-inAJl15w.text: Once I tried this place for the first time I knew it was an instant favorite.The best part about Sal's is that you can go there and have 3 different experiences. Let me explain, there is the restaurant part - great atmosphere, dimmed lights, with conversations as the background noise. There is also the bar area, which has a limited menu, all which is excellent. With TV's and high top tables. Lastly, "The Side Door." It is connected only through the kitchen and is almost a sub-restaurant to Sal's. Same menu but again, a different atmosphere. As far as food goes, we get the stuffed mushrooms every time. UNBELIEVABLE with the garlic bread. Must have - I don't even like mushrooms. The bianco pizza is fantastic. It is a white pizza which my gf is addicted too. If I would give it another star, the service would have to be better. Not saying the people aren't nice, but you really have to plan on being there for an hour or more. I might be a really picky person though. I would recommend to anyone who appreciates italian food. nate.phxestates.com

Ot5G1znU9oQHhgI21f_wDQ.text: We hit Uncle Sal's every time we are in town. Great atmosphere excellent service. And fantastic food. If you sit in the bar, the bar menu is great: a good variety of selections at very reasonable prices. If you sit in the main dining room, you get the full menu. Either way, you will have an outstanding experience!

9XrXIGSdh_c_tMlW5jaNIw.text: Food was mediocre, but at least it took them 70 minutes to bring it once we ordered. Waitress talked to two customers for 10 minutes while we waited for her to run our check. Pretty unbelievable.

0xQU6v_XW7RuxuJC4E5e9A.text: Sat on the patio for lunch with my hubby! For under $20 plus tip we ate like kings! Dinner is more $ but the homemade quality is well worth it! Lunch by far was the best bang for the buck with included soup or salad and garlic bread which was delicious!!! Juicy chicken parm was luscious and the tortellini alla pana was divinely decadent! The bar menu all day includes steaks and pork chops for around $10..., this is going to be a new go to place for us for sure! One week later: Went back a week later for lunch and had the fish special for lunch $13 pan seared Halibut (6-8oz) over linguini with a tomato basil and caper sauce... To die for! Perfectly cooked... Best fish I have had and for the price it cannot be beat... Salad and delish bead... Unbelievable!

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lunch: Tortellini alla Panna was only $7.95 for lunch and came with a salad and garlic bread .... Amazing!!!
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lunch portion chicken Parmesan ... Huge and delicious!

wA1VGWfSXcovYDJKcJqGMA.text: Best homemade Italian food!  Fresh and homemade pasta.  Had  the fettuccine Alfredo w chicken and broccoli, best I ever had.  Bruschetta was awesome too.  Quick and friendly service.

LK7pcYcCAGgP8A_rbJ7sYg.text: I know everyone loves this place but it wasn't for us. My husband is Italian and knows his food. We rarely go out for Italian so when we do we are extra critical, I suppose. They start with garlic bread which was just okay. Seemed a little stale. We had salads with our meals and it was literally romaine lettuce with some shredded mozzarella. I had the spaghetti and meatballs for my entree and I literally poured out a small bowl of watery sauce. The pasta was over cooked and meatballs flavorless. The apps were in the same categories. It honestly felt like cheap wedding food cooked in abundance. I also asked the waiter for recommendations but he said he was new and not sure what was good. He was very nice but you think he would of sent someone over to help. Unfortunately we just didn't have a good experience.

K7DAgoLwboAD_D2w0Eij6A.text: A little pricey but the food is good so it was worth the price. The service was good as well.  The complimentary garlic bread is a plus (great to dip in sauces!). We ordered the steamed mussels as an appetizer which was pretty good. For entrees, we ordered two different seafood pastas and a fish. Everything was good.

1dzBv_7tUlfrjUxhlaz8kA.text: The food here was amazing, unfortunately only three stars as a result it is due to horrible/rude service my date and I had last Sunday by a waiter named SCOTT.  I had the spicy shrimp and my date had the chicken parm.  We had salads to start... Scott came by to take our plates and I was not completely finished with my salad.  He informed us our entrees were ready to be served.  Interesting so this salad must be taken?  I thought.  As he was so hastily ready to whisk away our salads, I realized he had taken away my knife with.  I asked, "excuse me when you have a chance, may I please get a fresh knife?"  He proceeded to bring back my half eaten salad and placed the plate in front of my face as if to say here, you can have this one.    As we were nearly half way through our main dishes he had asked if either of us would want desert?  Now both my date and I are staring at each other and thinking, ok are we wasting this guys time or what?  We felt so rushed, so hurried to get out of there and just treated rudely.  My date, being the kind man he is said, you know what place a desert menu down and we will take a look at it when we are DONE with our entrees.    Entree dishes are taken, and do not get me wrong the food was delicious!  We are still finishing our wine and enjoying conversation... Scott had to have been back and forth at least 3 different times asking if we had made a decision.  At this point it is almost frustrating we just placed an order so this fellow would 1) leave us alone and 2) stop us feel as though we were wasting his time.   If you go here, I strongly encourage not sitting in Scott's section.  Great food but HORRIBLE service.

zNVgouN_j7BPvHtiDGkG3g.text: They do not do separate checks they want to divide the bill among the guests. Won't return.

LXXtGd7jiS8pCMzYHOQwlA.text: Service very good.  Cute place. Chianti not what I expected, probably my fault. Asked for a Chianti and server said ok and left.  I didn't check wine list. I probably got the house Chianti and it was bitter. The Caesar salad with my main dish was wonderful. I had pesce alla vodka. Seafood was cooked almost perfect, sauce WAS perfect. My husband had chicken parmesan and he said it was very good. We didn't have any appetizers because we read reviews and I consider myself a tiramisu connoisseur. It was the only downfall-sickly sweet. I had one bite and it was too much. Next time we'll try app's instead! So many dishes looked appetizing.

vql4dX03UVA2qBuhhWsdmg.text: Warm and cozy Italian dining experience!   Note: if you having a burning desire to dine here around 7-8pm ish, make a reservation. Or, be okay with waiting in the *tiniest* entrance ever. Or, suck it up and try your luck at open seating in bar area.   I lucked out and snagged a table for 2 in bar. Was loud, but comfortable.  I tried their Cannelloni, as I'm strung out on cheese, and they nailed it. Was rather large portion, so I took extra home and squeezed out another meal. Was great cold in the morning too!  Server was attentive and friendly - no issues there.  I went to use the restroom after eating and the Hostess barricaded herself in front of door. She asked me to use the restroom at neighboring restaurant as they had an "incident". I assumed this involved human fluid of some sort or plumbing issue, but I really had to go. The guy cleaning busted out with a mop and sweat on his brow, and I was able to squeeze in. I didn't ask any questions- it was better that way...  I'll be back for sure!

iJd_fwL1K4hCNEBxjfqWFw.text: Good food, good service. It is time to replace the salt and pepper grinders! After three different sets I gave up. I think the staff thought I was being picky, I like pepper, what's wrong with that? The dinner was very good and tasted fresh, the salad was crisp and cold, tells me they cook and prepare to order.

II-brQ1ytUGK4fXJgwNvOQ.text: Every year I make a 40 minute journey to this restaurant for my birthday. The entire menu is amazing, and the staff treats everyone like family.

Gg49ZfxWNZvsxojTKgBNxg.text: This restaurant is the BOMB.  Great atmosphere, cozy bar, excellent food.    The garlic bread is crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, and truly garlicy!! YUM  Everything I've tried here is very delicious, I love this place.  My only warning is if you intend the slit the bill...you will have a challenge...they for some reason do not allow this.  Otherwise, thumbs-up, give this place a try. :-)

hjR4WnbQ4freMm34N0vgIQ.text: I wanted to give it higher scores. Food was good.....come with a huge appetite.   Service was painfully slow. Sat for 10 or 15 minutes after getting water And bread before server stopped by. Had to ask for her to come to the table.   After ordering drinks.....she said she would tell us about the specials.....but didn't come back for another 10 minutes (or more). Never told us the specials. Checked on us once after taking our order. Sat for quite a long time before coming to see if we wanted dessert. But of course they were out of tiramisu and cannoles.  She explained quite often over half of the deserts are reserved at the same time the reservations are made. If you know this....why not make more to begin with?   We are from out of town....so won't likely get to experience the location again. With all the food options in town...I will likely not think about returning next time I'm in Phoenix.

AEP-BV67RbE-H7GoSUMrAQ.text: 1. Great service. Really nice, knowledgeable waitress.   2. Soup of the day was yummy:) Some kind of delicious sausage and rice type soup. Kyle's appetizer salad was admittedly pathetic-looking, as it was literally pieces of lettuce with shredded cheese on top.     3. Cannelloni entree was almost good. It's chicken, veal, and spinach pureed together and wrapped in a crepe. Crepe and covering white sauce were great... But the filling wasn't doing it for me flavor or texture-wise (maybe I don't like cannelloni's?? It was my first one! Is anyone else bothered by veal and chicken being shoved in a blender together and pureed???)  4. The chocolate bonet dessert with pistachio biscotti is a MUST. The bonet is this decadent, silky, gorgeous cross between a fudge and a pudding, topped with house-made whipped cream. I could tell they put Reddi-whip on top of the housemade cream though, which, to me, may have cheapened an otherwise excellent dessert. Just excellent.

gki_F_p4P9ediJpZBtLVlw.text: When visiting Scottsdale, we come here because it's conveniently located, and the food and atmosphere is always good.  I'm a vegetarian, so the eggplant parmesan always does the trick, while my husband usually gets some kind of meat dish.  In this case, it was the chicken saltimbuco.  He said it was delicious..... It was my birthday, so we got a nice little treat at the end of our meal.   Great staff, and we'll be back!

-L8G1G5s-l2-LaHiniOPlQ.text: frankly i am disappointed. Service  was painfully  slow. She was very nice but i guess she was very busy.  Food was ok. Wife ordered eggplant rotini and the outside was hot inside was cold gnocchi was not good.  Shrimp scampi was  good.  Everything  else  was average

WJXHBUQRpwAmVo0wwyAGaw.text: Ate there  sat nite with my mother.  Very dissapointed!  Server acted like she was bored, food barely mediocre!  Ordered stuffed mushrooms  they came swimming in some sort of Alfredo  cheese sauce,  we expressed our dislike of the mushrooms and our server looked at us as though  something was wrong  with us! Instead of offering to remake  them to our liking or offering to bring us something different she just took them away. Main course was deep fried veal steak again smothered in tomato  sauce on a bed of spaghetti noodles not very appetizing. The server asked if I was done 5 min after I received  my food!  My mother had ravioli which she found  not to her liking.  I guess the one bright spot was desert, we had creme brule. And coffee it was pretty  good, but not enough to make up for an over all poor experience,  A waste of $68 , the server was lucky I left her $5  Do yourself a favor  and look for Italian  food elsewhere.   One star is too much

qCZrmShRGpEEnorE-dgpKQ.text: We were absolutely amazed by this cozy little restaurant. We arrived at about 6:30 on a freezing Tuesday night, and the place was packed.  We actually saw them turn people away, which seemed pretty wild for a weeknight.  The hostess seemed to know everyone who came in the door. Our server was also excellent, and had great food/drink recommendations.  The food was slow to arrive, but they are pretty clear that "good food takes time to prepare" right on the menu.    We'll definitely be back!

LvsKIOGeUEItAUyBKI3Mzw.text: This has a great atmosphere. A person can enjoy themselves with a nice fine dinning experience or sit at the bar (where all the locals are). It truly is a great friendly experience and the food doesn't disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Well crafted food! Uncle Sal&#39;s is a hidden gem. Amazing!! Check it out!
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The wings are fantastic! Simple recipe done right!

H5gi_olNHhGKrSEI_5SfKg.text: Great service. Knowledgeable, pleasant wait staff. Excellent food. No gripes whatsoever. The Gorgonzola steak was ridiculously good!

MRWXEijVas58j-yLEe3QBw.text: Amazing ! Waitress was fantastic ! Love the quint experience of the regulars around us. Never had such a hard time choosing from the menu but settled on the special calzone which was so cheesy and fully of flavor . Hubby had braised short ribs which were out of this world . Have to come back

Ax-eZZgNbZF8doPFr5pSpw.text: Food was good, server was amazing too.  I had the special of the day, stuffed shrimp.  One friend had chicken piccatta.  She said it was okay, nothing out of the ordinary.  My other friend had cappallini pomodoro and said it was very good.  Garlic bread was quite delicious.  House salad is a pile of lettuce with shredded cheese on top and a single tomato on the side.  The dressings were very good.     Hostess staff... not so much.  Pretty rude actually.  Likely won't be back because of the hostesses.

K5IQkBiuJvlB-Tf_deVz_w.text: I have eaten here for many years and just now realized that I've never reviewed it? WHAT? Ok, here's the deal. This place has great food, great management and even better service. I sit at the bar and have a great repoire with Johnny and Maryann. They have been there for years and know just about everyone who walks in that door. The owners Bob and Sally are usually present and working wherever they're needed and just the sweetest people.  I've introduced many friends to this establishment and everyone loves it. My tip is this...there's a separate menu for the bar and its awesome, the cilantro chicken on the regular menu cannot be beat and have their creme brulee. Best in Scottsdale! You're welcome.

QiCPJLNaayeuy4AY3eR_iQ.text: Best Italian food in the state!   I haven't lived in AZ for a year now, but I'm writing a review because I miss this spot. First of all the service is truly outstanding. It's like being at your friend's house whose family is happy to see you for a holiday or something.   Because of this they have a very loyal following. It's not an uptight militant 5 star restaurant type attitude, but more like a light hearted they're happy to be here there and happy you could come kind of a thing.   The atmosphere is very lady and the tramp. Hard to capture in a photograph but with the music, the soft lights, and the crowd it's a cozy little spot. I've brought lovers, friends, and family members here to see this place. The place has a lot of class.   The food is reflective of East Coast Americanized fine Italian dining. Wherever you've been in the US or Canada this will absolutely rank among the best Italian food you've ever consumed. I've taken a lot of people here and afterwards everyone's always remarked that it was one of the best meals they've ever eaten.   I'd recommend something but it's phenomenal so it just depends on what you're in the mood for.    For $$ out of $$$$ it's underpriced if anything.   With that in mind please be respectful when you go there. Be mindful of your audience and please don't dress like a hobo... Suits, dresses, slacks, nice sweaters, nice shoes, leave your ball cap in the car and flip flops at home!

HDDRbE7dNRDRfiVei47EKg.text: The ambiance is great, but I'm a little disappointed with the pizza.  Just your standard fare.  For an Italian restaurant, you would hope they would have kick butt pizza.  But sadly no.  It was good, but I surely wouldn't recommend it.  But I will be back to try some of their other offerings.  Plus they have Crab Louie, one of my favorites.  So that is next on my list.  Also they have no public wifi.  They need to get with the times if they want to stay current.  I know some of my friends won't go to places that do not offer it.

UPT5lEb64kV3LKPjG7dY6A.text: A surprising atmosphere for a small strip mall.     Excellent service.  Bread was placed before we had even opened our menus.  Staff friendly and smiling.  Food was decent, but a bit bland.

BHmsV3wzSuN19zPLnXarxA.text: Really good spot for Italian food in Scottsdale. Looks like a family owned spot and not one of those big chain restaurants. They serve authentic Italian food for a very good price.

Rf-ryoFLQ_31kNtBU_8GHg.text: We always enjoy this venue and the delicious fare! As usual, the chicken picatta was prepared par excellence!  Our server, Nick, was a disappointment though! We have dinner here countless times with other couples! We always ask for separate checks and have been accommodated each time. This evening Nick informed us he would ONLY split the check for us! We enjoy alcoholic beverages and others do not; hence, the request for separate checks! Accordingly, we did not order a bottle of wine with dinner! Our only recourse was to not utilize our normal tipping percentage! Customer service should always be foremost...!

U8A7C8uOzeh-8Mx1NiJuZQ.text: Tiramisu  Rack of Lamb Lobster Ravioli  The end. (No more needs to be said) Favorite restaurant in the valley! Def a hidden gem, but don't let the location fool you- food is always fresh and perfect!

Xsfi1m1w9lbp9ByeB8UD5Q.text: Omg! I am such a foodie and this place is absolutely AMAZING! It doesn't look like much on the outside but WAIT FOR IT! The food will blow your mind and the service is exceptional. Everything on the menu is extraordinary. Make sure to make reservations, every time we have tried to come in the past, it's all booked up.

aTruLFkBrfO6QcI3SgE64Q.text: A mixed bag here on a recent lunch visit. The prices have gone up since my last lunch, but at least one dish was worthy of the price. The $12 chicken parmesan was excellent served with pasta. It was a huge cutlet with top quality marinara sauce and very filling. The garlic bread that was served in individual pieces was hot and perfect. The salads have also improved with more lettuce, a tomato and some cheese as well. Both ranch and blue cheese dressings were solid.    The fettuccine alfredo was the big miss. The noodles used were wrong and the alfredo sauce was poorly executed. This was not a good version, so stick to the red sauce stuff and things should be fine.

DpO7ta8IGrdImxyFB64u9A.text: Great neighborhood place. Traditional Italian We always sit at the bar, love Toni, Johnny and crew. Good people, good food.

BmgRmMtALPubAxie05ZeEw.text: Three of us went for cocktails. The bar was half busy and there was a 4 person hightop table available in the bar area. But we were told that it was reserved only for 4 persons. The restaurant proceeded to sit us in the dining room at a table set for 6 persons. Does that make sense? We Will not be back....went for bar fun....ended up at a table so big that it was difficult to have an engaging conversation. PS- while we we there (cocktail hour) the 4 top in bar was never occupied. What a waste.

VU43_-zAOR1G126CXhT0Pw.text: Came here late last night for a gf's bday. They actually stayed open late for us. Laura was our server. She was amazing!!! It was my first time at this restaurant n I can say it is by far the BEST Italian I have eaten!!! The bday girl who is Italian recommended this place so...  We started off w several bottles of the house red blend n surprisingly for $26 a bottle, it was absolutely delicious!!!  The garlic bread was amazing. I never eat bread but tonight I ate three pieces!! I got the Gorgonzola mushroom as an appetizer. My god!! It melted in my mouth!! So much flavor!!  I got the lobster ravioli w a choice of soup or salad n I picked the soup which was cream of spinach. The soup was a perfect texture and absolutely delicious n I am not even a fan of cream of anything. The lobster ravioli came w baby shrimp!! To die for seriously!! Another friend at the table ordered this and agreed. I wish it was a bigger portion cuz I wanted to eat more of it!!! Haha! The best lobster ravioli by far. My husband got the veal Marsala. I had a bite n it was very tasty. My other gf got the chicken parmigiana n told me several times that this can't be chicken! It was so tender, juicy but at the same time w a slight crunch. It was the perfect combination of flavors in my mouth.   The only down side is that they don't do split tabs so if ur going w a large group, be sure to bring cash.   Other than this, n one of the busser guys giving us dirty looks (yes it was our fault... we stayed an hour past closing but they made the reservations for 830pm which was 30 min b4 they closed)...I will definitely come back here to try the short ribs and some other dishes that looked super appetizing~  Highly recommend this place if you want amazing Italian food!

qSmLjBOxZnLDCEBVHjfHxg.text: We found it difficult to chose a Veal dish among the ten or so offered. Both were truly Outstanding!  Couple this with a waitress who was truly wonderful.  We will be back again and again.

luUFjw254dVjlNUcVbIOwA.text: Wow!!! This place was recommended to my wife and I and have to say it was truly bad! I'm pretty much done with Italian food in Scottsdale or I should say what people consider good. I had a Scallop dish and it was truly bad. Scallops were like chewing on leather! My wife's dish was horrendous as well. If you don't want to throw your money away I would avoid this place. Wanted to like this place but what a disappointment!

yEk2nTbFBNQHkHujs4rlOQ.text: So we weren't originally going to go here, but as we walked by we noticed how busy Uncle Sals was and had to give it a try. Needless to say we found out what all the fuss was about. The atmosphere is candle lit with a bunch of round tables and an enclosed patio. We choose a high top in the bar (last one left) to avoid the 10 minute wait. We were wondering how fast service would be since they were so busy but our waitress didn't miss a beat. We were immediately greeted. Starting with the wine- I wasn't mad at the generous pours and the house cab got the job done. We started with side Caesar salads- the dressing was amazing, and homemade crotons for the win. Also! The complimentary bread they bring, is delicious garlic bread, is this heaven? My husband got the special pizza which was good but we were regretting not getting pasta. I had the breaded cod with sweet potato fries and loved it. We cannot wait to go back and try the pasta there.

WCLBhA6ejmymX_XFFwJd7w.text: We got seated right away , we had to wait   15 minutes for somebody to come by to take our drink order and the waitress & some of the staff was very rude they shouldn't be working in this field if they don't like what they do....  the marinated sauce reminded me of my grandmother's that was the only good thing that I enjoyed , the lobster raviolis was saturated in a lobster bisque and it was more like a soup the fried calamari could have used more breading it was gummy .... my friend had the chicken marsala it was very sweet they used really sweet Marsala wine ... I was really disappointed because everybody that I talked to spoke very highly of this restaurant ..

vbWXL6FU5Oo-hCdVkW8xJg.text: My husband and I have been here twice now. With a total of 6 different people and they all enjoyed their meals and left their plate clean. So delicious!! Bonus: I'm GLUTEN FREE and they had so many options including pasta and even most of their chicken is breaded with rice flour making it gluten free! Yum.

3Cloa1rMtXBNz0xePi5oNA.text: One of the few places where you can get veal palm in old town Scottsdale it's a little expensive  but it's veal.

-DnL1M19bMCFP9bJIQa8EA.text: The food was delicious but the service was definitely lacking.  The servers were too busy chatting with each other and specific patrons than taking care of all of their customers.

tq5Wq3ypk5vxza6UqHH6bg.text: Bar is always packed,they actually have better prices in the bar.Service is fine but long wait to get food.The place has a Taylor Street sign so I thought owner was from Chicago but he is actually from Detroit.Filet are good but NY strip steak is a little tough.I want to try the pizza. Busy place so either get there early or make a reservation.Patio dinning available.Prices are okay. They have old mobster photos on the wall and photos from movies like Casino They also own the Blind Pig and the bar behind it which has Chicago Hot dogs and beef sandwiches.

HLL_2CC2kn__SgI9s-RpFw.text: So I am from Chicago and have been looking for a cozy, neighborhood Italian restaurant to hold up to my expectations for almost 18 months now. Sal's did just that. My party and I arrived fifteen minutes before our scheduled reservation and we were promptly seated without hesitation. Killed the first impression.  Upon being seated, you are immediately drawn in by the comfortable decor and dining area. The best part? There is a wall which separates the bar from the dining room. How great is that? I have heard they have an amazing happy hour menu from many friends so I will be back to try that in the near future.  From start to finish, the meal and service were both very enjoyable. The waitress was not "too present" but we always had everything we needed. She gave great secondary service. The only thing I think that was subpar was the prebussing of our table. We had plates from previous courses sit for awhile as well as our entree plates taking awhile to be cleared.  The food was very delectable from out salmon bruschetta to the three entrees that were ordered- lobster ravioli (great flavor and just the right portion), shrimp and scallop Antoinette (just the right ratio of pasta/vegetables/seafood), and the rack of lamb (cooked to a perfect medium temperature). We also had potato pesto soup which was just thick and creamy enough to leave you wanting one more spoonful! All in all, the dining experience was a pleasant one and I would completely recommend Sal's to anyone looking for that special neighborhood Italian restaurant without all the extra pretentious fluff some Scottsdale establishments have. Enjoy!

SqeH-air88llzG6sKWvBoA.text: Stumbled on this place on accident. Actually intended on going to the Blind Pig but they were closed for some reason.   Great food, stellar service and good wine pairing. We will Be back !

jKJnJ9pRAcMnmOJLoDRyJw.text: Here for business again and decided to try this place out. Sat outside immediately by a fountain- very peaceful. Place was incredibly packed and everyone seemed to be having a nice time. Service was excellent. I started with the house Chianti and a Caesar salad- it was fresh and enormous and it comes with a generous portion of garlic bread. But I came specially for the veal which is always hit or miss. I ordered the veal Marsala and it was a hit. Tender, not salty, slightly sweet from the Marsala. Nicely done green beans and a bit of pasta. Amazing. Will definitely come back.

RqP-8G3MOmdzEt6SIcVg4Q.text: I'm an Italian guy from the East Coast. I have been searching the Valley for good to decent Italian food.  My mother has been asking about Linguine and Clams with Red Sauce.  I saw great reviews and placed a to go order.  It did not disappoint.  I screwed by not asking for the pasta al dente.  I will be back for sure!

oG8BpZsWW3A6KvCVa24P6A.text: Super cute, quaint traditional Italian restaurant in Scottsdale. We arrived pretty early so it wasn't busy yet so we were seated right away. Our server greets us and takes our drink order. I tried the fradiovila (sp?). It was really good and loved the spice flavor. Yum!!!  I love cute little spots that are hidden gems.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

8Iss8yhSOMFp3Z9l1GQtNg.text: Uncle Sal's has great food and great service. The staff was really prompt and the food came out at the perfect time. I will absolutely go back the next time I'm in town!  Highly recommend.

4NB9-rEtUt71OKcLurx3Tw.text: The food is good here and I liked the place until the hostess just about threw us out last night because she said we had been at the table "to long".  I otherwise would have given it a much better review.  I met my friend visiting from Florida at this restaurant at 4:30pm last night and we did stay till 6:15 - an hour and 45 minutes.  We had not seen each other in person in over 2 years so we had a lot to catch up on.  Our bill was $50 and we left a $10 tip.  Both of us are executives for medical device companies and not bad or unruly customers.  But the hostess came over after they put the bill down and said "you will have to pay and leave right now because we have someone for this table".  She said we could go to the (very crowed bar) and have some drinks and finish our conversation.  She did not offer to buy us a drink as she was basically throwing us out for taking too long to eat and talk.  Both my friend and I said we have never been treated like this in a restaurant - EVER - and we both travel extensively for a living. I realize an hour and 45 minutes is a longer dinner but I remember my waitress days in college and you always allow people to finish their meal, conversations and decide when to leave.  We also noticed no one was waiting for a table other than two women as we left and found out that those two women were "regulars" that always sat at our table so we had to go.   I'd not go back as I feel they were rude and do not respect customers.  We have many other excellent Italian restaurants in town where you don't have to rush through dinner so they can turn a table for better customers.  This is just bad customer service and not the message you want out for business......I'm very, very disappointed.

_UAW2fXqjF9sSxrDqO1VoA.text: Just tried Uncle Sal's out for the first time. Opted for take out. Pricing is perfect. Lasagna + Side Salad with Italian dressing and Chicken Francese Pasta + Potato Leek Soup. Both orders came with garlic bread. Each bite is a new taste and just as amazing, if not more scrumptious than the last. Found my new "Go-To" Italian spot. Love Delfalco's but Sal's may have them beat.

DnHZsJlvI8uAKuo97VNF1Q.text: This is become my favorite restaurant. They have excellent Italian cuisine, and very fresh seafood. I highly recommend it.

Atukdg68x4LKB2gWj7feHA.text: It is really nice quaint Italian restaurant in a strip mall.  If you are 50 years + then this is the place for you.   The Caprese salad was very good. The pasta and New York strip steak was average at best.  They don't tell you that the green beans as the side item come mixed with onion. And it is so overpowering and over seasoned with pepper it's difficult to eat them.  If you're looking for a place to take your mom and dad. Or your grandparents form an average Italian dinner this is the place to go. Staff is very friendly. Restaurant is clean.  The only reason I give it three stars is because the food was not as exceptional as I hoped it would be

Uasjjue8-gf4NZp8vWsW4w.text: I wish I could get this restaurant more than five stars. We were seated promptly after entering and I never found my glass of water to be empty. Excellent service paired with excellent food. The most exciting part of my experience was when the check was carried out alongside a plate of scrumptious vanilla wafers signaling the end of our dining.

F-Z30dbhLlHez7iv-J-OdQ.text: Had 6 ladies in from Texas for a business meeting. The waiter was not friendly and was never around when we need water refills (had to request the nice young man cleaning tables for more ice) The waiter didn't even ask how our meals were. The salad consisted of lettuce and 1 cherry tomatoes. My chicken Alfredo  was not hot when it came to the table and had NO flavor. The comments from the ladies at the table were not favorable about the food.   For sure the waiter was over tipped (19% of total bill for 8 people total)   We use to love Uncle Sal's  Would never recommend it again

z7v3OQTgAJjGkudUBcKotA.text: I literally could eat here every night of the week. Steamed mussels are fantastic. Seafood dishes never disappoint. Service is always, always good. Good wine selection. And long live their garlic bread!  Just go.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mmmm. Sausage and white bean soup. All gone!

0gBl-tcBoMvWLMx1gzC70g.text: Tried this local restaurant soon after moving into the neighborhood and was pleasantly surprised. Great service and very good food we all has the seafood pasta with Antoinette Sauce. Very tasty. Nice green salad comes with dinner. Not overly expensive. The atmosphere is relaxing and dark inside very similar to how I remember Italian restaurants back in New Jersey when I was a kid. Great tiramisu. We'll definitely return.

BqEQuZK3bmS5xM8RwW3GVA.text: I have a culinary background and an affinity for good Italian food! That said, I CANNOT understand how there are any negative reviews about the food, the staff or the atmosphere at Uncle Sals!  I have been here more times than I care to admit and I have NEVER walked out feeling anything other than very satisfied and impressed.  True classic Italian food! Everything is EXCELLENT...from the Lobster Ravioli to the Braised Beef...from the pizza's to the fresh fish with picata sauce (flown in daily)...from the crab cakes to the smoked salmon bruschetta...and of course tons of amazing classic pasta dishes - you will NOT be disappointed.  Only thing that doesn't "wow" me is their ceasar salad so I always opt for the soup...which is almost always wonderful (regardless of which one I get).  The tiramisu is absolutely heavenly!!!  The staff has never been anything other than professional and courteous. Most of their staff has been there for multiple years which is usually a very good sign for a restaurant. The atmosphere is a throwback to the classic East Coast, family owned Italian joint. The bar area has a seperate menu (smaller portions and smaller price tags) - good luck getting a seat in there lol  The place is almost always packed so call ahead for reservations.  Trust and believe, these folks know what they're doing.  Side note - the outside sitting area is EXCELLENT. If you choose to sit outside during mosquito season, you'll get bitten accordingly lol That goes for almost anywhere in AZ...not just Uncle Sals.  GO AND ENJOY!

IEVP_BthQfJN4OW_ITyLKg.text: Eater Beware!  Ate there Thurs.night...ordered Chicken Piccata.  Chicken is strange, ground patty that tastes like NOTHING.  Said it was 2 breasts pounded together.   What a joke!!!!!

C28fYV7Z2GRSenIHMNyR6w.text: Ended up coming here only after discovering that Carlsbad across the street had a 20 minute wait.  Boy was I pleasantly surprised!  It was a Sunday, and they still had happy hour rocking at the bar.  We pulled up a chair, had great conversation with the other patrons and then the food came...  I lived in Seattle for seven years - so to impress me with seafood in Arizona is few and far between.  That said, the scallops here may have been the best I've ever had.  We also got the wings, which were solid, as well as a couple other appetizers that I can't remember, but did not disappoint.  The service was awesome, and come to find out they share a kitchen with another joint in the same plaza.  Any time this happens I'm kind of impressed - especially when the speed of food coming out is exactly as expected.  I'll certainly be back, and look forward to hearing more stories about the origin story... I'm a sucker for tales of Italian fellas in witness protection!

Jk3NNQPsY_EpR5YHCNO14A.text: The food is ok. But nothing I'd rave about. The service is a bit sad. The staff has a tendency to make you feel as if you're putting them out. Not somewhere I'd go for a low stress, relaxing dinner.   Another issue is their outdoor seating is infested with Mosquitos. You get eaten alive while waiting for your food.

p9lyvHaeTZYN5gbAMb-PKw.text: The lobster ravioli was incredible. The shrimp and scallops in vodka sauce was pretty great as well, but very rich. The fried calamari was under seasoned but otherwise cooked properly. Really great go-to Italian restaurant in Scottsdale/Tempe area.

NDCHOMkwcNFBA3bYkT12xw.text: I can make better Italian food at home. Serious, what's so special about this place?  Enough left overs for two meals and we decided not to take a doggie bag... Hopefully that's self explanatory.  A bit on the rude side as well... Service wasn't that great.  Definitely wouldn't return

tlHJbZUCyb1Lso4ZsCao8g.text: Love this place - great food, friendly staff.  Only downside is that it's usually full!

qjmu2oGXEt7-ZMil-_IIug.text: My wife and I enjoyed uncle Sal's dinner with rack of lamb marsala and salmon linguine.  Our drinks were mixed perfectly and the wine suggested by the waitress was very good. In fact everything was so pleasing that we are returning to have dinner there tonight. We are calling this our favorite place in Phoenix and we will be back when we return.

xNgMIJ59KazGLlA29R4UCQ.text: While in Scottsdale come by uncle sals. The food is amazing. Try the stuff mushrooms what a surprise 3 meats in one mushroom. The service comes with a smile and a cookie. Dinner service will take around one hour from beginning to end. What a gem next time I com back to Scottsdale i will drop in again.

1TYZ_9Mkyz0b1GLtFb2-Pw.text: I think this restaurant deserves two different ratings- one for their in-restaurant experience and one for take-out.   Their staff is extremely friendly and nice...but mostly only to the patrons that are dining in. That makes perfect sense, as their service correlates to their tips. But still, I always  feel ignored when I'm there to pick up my food to-go.   The food is really good, but they recently surged their lunch menu prices so they no longer have great lunch specials. I'm also sick of feeling unwanted when I go pick up my lunch

u10erG2Uh3jQlwOT3hdqyA.text: Great spot! Food is delicious and the service is spectacular. Get there early, it fills up fast... if you're looking for a great meal in a friendly atmosphere you won't be disappointed.

POcK2OpOe38aHni5QJKyKA.text: We ate in the bar.  I had the Ciopino and thought it was very good.  Broth was delicious, plenty of seafood and I was surprised to find some spaghetti in it as well.  Overall a very tasty and satisfying meal.

qGqBjDpb4pdJcqSf3MrgDQ.text: A friend recommended getting lunch here while I was in town and they were right.  The food was rich, tasty and inexpensive (to Seattle prices at least). I definitely recommend it.  Also it earned bonus points for not even hesitating when they saw I was obviously transgender. Considering much of Phoenix is not accepting, I was doubly appreciative.

ui-bgrkna7kxULnRpKMfPA.text: Not sure why everyone raves about Uncle Sals. I made reservations for 4 for dinner on Sunday 8/25/19. We arrive a little early, hostess is on the phone FOREVER, finally acknowledges us , we r seated and the food server, DAVID, ask if we would like to order drinks, we ask for 2 separate checks and he says, no they do not do separate checks, which is ok but I got the vibe he was lying. One of the 2 friends we were dining with ordered the special, sol w/ pasta. He ended up not liking it but did not say anything until the bill came. He thought it was $22.00 not 32.00. We could not find our food server , we asked another food server if they could get David to our table so that we could discuss the amount, when he finally shows ups he asks, "so you don't like the dish because it costs $32.00"? My friend was going to pay even though he wasn't happy with his dinner, he was frustrated because he was told the price was something different than what was in the bill. David could give 2 shits. I am sure he thought we were snow birds and that would be that. WRONG. The whole attitude of this restaurant is "Oh well , we do not care, we have the reputation of being a great Italian restaurant , so whatever ".  There food is not that great. If you are not a regular, watch out. Never going there again! So rude!!!! Might I recommend Pasta Brioni.

CylpkLWRP8x4ef7d8tjqyg.text: I met an out-of-town friend at Uncle Sal's in the bar by his recommendation.  When we arrived, it was not busy.  Throughout our time at the bar, I was invisible.  I realized there were many "regulars" there as patrons knew others names from across the bar, as well as patrons knew the bartenders names without introduction.  I thought that as my glass was empty, the bartender(s) would ask if I would like another.  That never happened.  After waiting over 15-minutes for them to notice my empty glass, I pushed my empty glass up to the bartender.  Another 15-minutes later, I had to ask for another glass of wine.  I also had to ask for a glass if water!  When my food arrived, my green beans were cold.  My chicken was hot.  Not once was I asked how my meal was.  You only get one chance at a first impression - Uncle Sal's failed miserably.  There's too many placed in Scottsdale to nosh.  I won't be back at Uncle Sal's.

Fs-5nQpMe0n-3lZidtfLCQ.text: Nice local Italian place to eat with easy parking in a shopping center. We started with the caprese salad and I recommend it. Also came with artichokes. I also got a caesar salad, which came with my meal.  The salad had Parmesan cheese out of a shaker and turned me off right there. What kind of Italian place doesn't have freshly shaven Parmesan! My co worker got a meatball to try also and the sauce with it was decent, but the meat itself lacked flavor. For our main courses I got the lasagna and was happy with it. Good flavor and plenty to eat! He got the shrimp scampi and said it also tasted good. The waitstaff did a great job the entire time we were there also. Will I travel home wishing I could come back here. No. But will I come here again if I'm in Scottsdale craving Italian, yep.

AK3b-DVjvi7Uvr51yP_aVQ.text: This cute place is absolutely superb!!! I am so happy to have found it when I first moved to Arizona! It is a little establishment that you wouldn't normally give a second look at, but inside it is perfect! Quite, romantic and delicious to enjoy with friends!!

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

aKwO02VVJIynzv7P0HiwiQ.text: The best Italian Restaurant I have been too and I am from Chicago  The appetizer of portobello mushrooms with the wants and blue cheese you could have it as an entree with a Tuscany white. Advice??? Buy the bottle it's well worth the price point. I ordered the rack of lamb Marsala with broccoli as it melted in your mouth. The salad Caesar with so fabulous. I would rate the server 10 stars if I could. The wait staff was patient as I didn't know they closed at 2100 and let us finish our wine  and we closed them up with another couple at 2200. A must go to in Scottsdale

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Portobello mushrooms with walnuts and blue cheese
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best wine

6lRpnh31WFaIinXbl1xqiQ.text: We want to like Uncle Sal's more than we do...  But we found things to be uneven, with some dishes being both inspiringly delicious and also me'h, at the same time.    One example is their Chicken Saltimbocca($21.00).  The pasta served with it was way over cooked (almost mush), while the slices of prosciutto on the chicken were either thin, or thick and chewy.  The sauce, as others have noted is amazing.   Another example is their Chicken Parmigiana($18.00), which someone must of thought needed a cup of bitter marinara sauce on top (photo). We needed to scrap it off, just to get at the chicken. And yes, it came to a cup.   I could go on, but why..  Expect to pay $95, including taxes but before gratuities for three. Btw, don't even think of coming here without reservations.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Saltimbocca, $21.00
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Where&#39;s the Chicken Parmigiana?

WF4TwFUJG7vKNRV3YGtLRg.text: My first time here. These 5 stars are equal to me wanting to lick my plate. The Tortellini Alla Panna had bacon in it, ok!? Can't wait to back and try out their deserts. They have their own baker there!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tortellini Panna with tomato soup. Soooo very good.
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tortellini Alla Panna
