-wT3VvALtMUhmxXbpjR-7w.text: Delicious! Lobster Ravioli and Cannolis are what's on my mind!  The service is fantastic and the atmosphere is as well Saw a delicious meatball. I gotta get back and try one!

sl_zTGdJUSaYnyZPIEUZYg.text: The food was good, the staff was friendly and efficient and the venue was nice. It is a little out of the way from downtown, but that is fine.  I would really rate this 4.5 if I could. I can't exactly nail down what is keeping me from rating it a 5 except to say that something was off with the ambiance. It might has been the couple next to us who were on their first date through some type of service.  The guy was crashing and burning and the lady could not wait to get it done with and go home.  Awkward and we had a front row seat. The salad was fine, bread was very good and the meat ravioli was more than passable ( my  Grandparents made theirs by hand from scratch so that is a very high bar).  I had a wonderful chicken in white wine sauce with just the right amount of garlic.  They kept the iced tea full. It must have been the floor show that detracted from the evening.  I will have to try it again.

Sy50YQP_p-0eJhfOYg6ZXw.text: Was there last night.  Unfortunately I ordered the fish special, it wasn't too special.  The sauce was delicious but the fish was dried out and was even hard to cut with my knife.  The wait staff were excellent so I would definitely return.

MlnC7oMDqwxZ61TKhj0MYw.text: Wonderful food! Great staff l! They really worked as a team! I am very pleased with our dining choice tonight! I definitely recommend this place for some good Italian food!

ckUiNdqmaVikGma8hN-46Q.text: Woe take out pizza $16  great deal. Add a small extra non meat sauce and giardiniera on side, ADD $8 MORE. .  My mistake should have just ordered 2 different pizzas.   Nickle and dime Regulars is not a good thing.

a3Hn3cX9fSZQ3GDv_CkcWQ.text: Stopped in for a late lunch.  The place had obviously emptied out from the lunch crowd.  We were quickly seated and asked for the drink order which arrived promptly.  There is only a dinner menu from which to order lunch.  From other reviews it appears to an awesome dinner destination.  I would offer not so much for lunch.

WE8QhIxlSViz2_8Vbal0PA.text: First off, let me say that I really do enjoy Uncle Sal's. It's busy for a reason and that is because it has amazing food and a really comfortably, cozy atmosphere. Though located in a typical Arizona strip mall, walking in is like wandering into your Italian uncle's living room (or I would presume as I, sadly, don't have an Italian uncle). The best part about this uncle is that he makes some amazing dishes.  Having been a few times and snacked off companions' plates, I would recommend the veal and chicken dishes above everything else. I haven't had one that hasn't wowed, while the pasta and pizzas are just fine.  The thing about the place being crowded is that the wait staff gets overwhelmed. It can be hard to order anything after the food order is placed--if you want more wine, you might be out of luck. But I keep going back because it's that good!

DTqliI3qo7lEwPNaLibttg.text: This is my favorite Italian restaurant. It's the kind of restaurant that you would find in New York!!!  I loved this restaurant so much after eating there for lunch in 2004 that I had to move close by.  From the Bar Menu  The pork chops, steak, ground round with a veggie (green beans-sauteed in olive oil) the way I make them are great choices.  From the lunch and dinner menu's pork chop marsala, veal milanese.   Drinks, house wine variety, and the best Long Island Iced Teas!  Buon Appetito

iFTN7_y3hkhwYoqlRF5DeQ.text: This was the second time we have had lunch at Sals, and once again I was so impressed. The food is so delicious and let me tell you that Maryann behind the bar is just fabulous she knows what's she is doing and does it well. The food and Maryann is the reason we will be returning many more times

W3_j4kWUq995FUvulo0FNQ.text: Lunch portion of shrimp and scallops should be called shrimps and a scallop. All i got was one lousy half of a scallop and two shrimp. It looked like someone had eaten the other half of the scallop too. I get lunch portions are smaller but if you are going to serve me one scallop it better be a dang good big one! Otherwise it could have a great dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sad little half Shrimp &amp; Scallops Antoinette

hnG-7s65S-QGdM89MvA0nQ.text: Luv it, everyone does. I love the bar menu. Everything is fantastic and a very laid back comfortable customer base. Great job!

67JYtdSzy6SaopjY5qtuvA.text: The food is good the waitress Toni is a jerk! Don't know why she has to be rude to people who are trying to enjoy a meal and a good time.

yWyGMkSGUBdXmWEFEAKg3Q.text: I was very upset with the service and food I received here. It took 40 minutes for our appetizers to come out as the server laughed explaining she didn't cook the food. My salad was a tiny bed of lettuce, one tomato, and a few slices of onion. I asked for an order of shrimp for my salad and record four pieces of rubbery shrimp and was charged 18 dollars total for this. It was disgusting and I would personally never come back here. The way everything was handled was disappointing.

kg0zOKlz7_deJU-ssgEDvQ.text: Awesome experience. The house salad or soup comes with your entree. Both of us were extremely happy with the food and the experience. The environment is reminiscent of an old Chicago place. Didn't have dessert but the tiramisu looked incredible - they only had 2 pieces left and it was 5:30!  Watch out for the spice on the garlic bread. It has a bite to it!

-d-BQdkb8bpgDJdhfXfghA.text: Pleasantly surprised, iconic Italian restaurant and atmosphere, great food , right in Scottsdale

t6YbR-cimsPStWkhHiK-JQ.text: This was an amazing experience! The patio is great, the atmosphere is lively and welcoming and makes you feel like part of an Italian family! All of the food was delicious, from the bread to the appetizers to the main courses to desert. All 5 people loved everything. Our server was very nice and made us feel welcome even though we ended up being the last people there. I would highly recommend to anyone and go back in a heartbeat!

N6-ZZOV45C7jy4Rv6-iW1A.text: Having a date and we had a great evening! The food was great and the service was good. I will be coming back !

j0oiZ-FqqgBE4vYYSdPwIw.text: What a lovely surprise. Almost felt like I was in a Chicago Italian family restaurant. Decor is authentic, bar is very friendly, great patio....and the food!!!  House soup (tonight vege and sausage) was dreamy, chicken saltimboca was very flavorful and the portion so large I brought half home. I wish they allowed separate checks but other than that inconvenience, it was a 5 star evening for four gals.

bTaeVv0_T-lX_jrIWit1rg.text: Was in the area (not our usual stomping grounds) and wanted Italian. Checked Yelp for a locally owned option and stumped across this place. Food and service were excellent! Also generous portions and the same price (or less) than the chain restaurants down the street. I highly recommend it! But we came in before 5 pm on a Saturday and it was already busy. Probably best to get a reservation on the weekend.

tSG0QktzrcrymnZ0f8TyjQ.text: Uncle Sals in my absolute favorite Italian restaurant in the valley. My boyfriend and I come here at least once a month/get takeout and are never disappointed. I love that it's not a chain and the service is great. The garlic bread is amazing, the salad dressings are homemade and I haven't found one dish I don't like. The chicken piccata, eggplant, baked ziti and lobster ravioli are dishes we constantly repeat. Splurge on the chocolate cake for dessert, I promise you won't be disappointed!

sSsYo0EHbqkKEh5vTMmY9A.text: I had eaten here with a friend a few weeks ago. We sat at the bar to order drinks and food. I ordered their penne pasta dish with a side salad. the salad was ordinary. Nothing special about it. I personally thought a cheap bag of lettuce at the grocery store would be better. their bread served with the salad is a cheap loaf with butter. The penne pasta dish was subpar. I couldn't understand how others would say how great their pasta dishes are when it was a heap of penne pasta with baked melted cheese on top. I could easily do this at home with jarred sauce and that would have been better. Seriously, save your money. Also, the drinks made there, were gawd awful.

f4kyLJf8V3-XK7yM5O67Vw.text: What a shame!!!  My girlfriend and I really kinda liked this place.  The bar reminded me of lounges back home and the food was good and well priced.  So we brought my good friend along last night so that he could enjoy it too.  We'd talked about taking him here for awhile and seeing as we'd just watched our beloved Cubbies make it to the series it seemed like a nice atmosphere for dinner.  Problem is...my friend is 95% blind.  Last year we went to Guide Dogs of the Desert in Palm Springs after a many year wait to get his trained service dog Nike.  Nike had undergone about 30 months of training to be a guide dog and has accompanied my friend nightly for the past 18 months to many many restaurants and other establishments.  Until Uncle Sals last night.  We were swiftly told that Nike was not welcome in the large round bar area.  Naturally we presumed that this employee was not aware of the Americans with Disabilities Act and didn't realize that service animals and their owners cannot be discriminated against.    We hadn't come to Uncle Sals to sit outside or elsewhere.  We wanted to enjoy the lounge and order dinner there.  But the bartender was quick to acknowledge this "rule" and wouldn't serve us despite our insistance that this was not appropriate.  We were so shocked.  And when they out and out refused service, my blind friend called the police who arrived shortly thereafter.  And they were amazing.  Long and short is that the restaurant has the right to refuse service for any reason in Arizona.  It could be because you're black or gay or have long hair or maybe because you're straight.  Any reason at all.  And they were choosing to refuse us service at their bar area under the guise that it was because of this well behaved and trained service animal.   A dog who had the harness on and was working.  An English Black Lab who guided my friend in and then laid by his side as he is trained to do without making a peep.  A well trained working service animal who was on the job.  Working harder than the guys behind the bar or the hostess at the door.  Shame on you guys.  I've spent good money there in the past and have told too many people about your restaurant.  But not nearly as many as I will now.    The police were great.  They all but acknowledged that you guys were dicks.  They laughed with us and spent a good 15 minutes just basically being "good guys" and suggested with a wink that Carlsbad Cavern is a much better place for dinner anyways.  They knew that we were right and you guys were creeps.    Goodbye Uncle Sal.  You don't deserve my business.

Hgg_AxU30eWSq0Z-khxCpQ.text: It was super busy on a Friday night. We did not have reservations though we were invited to sit on the patio without a wait, so we did. Service was prompt and friendly. Food was excellent. We will definitely be back. Thank you!

jzyqqAgQmwb3hsPZyxcUVw.text: Nice place, but I just went in with some friends. We sat at the bar. I went to the bathroom and the bartender tossed my drink. I then actually had to ask for a replacement. When the food came, the New York strip was so dry that it got stuck in my friends throat. None of the servers or bartenders checked back in with us to see how it was. As we went to pay our check we were charged 400 dollars more than expected and when this was brought to their attention, they grabbed the ticket and never apologized. Probably won't go back here again.

xj7czcW83qjQ5qJ-sdOgJw.text: I'm super disappointed by this place. I go to Side Door Corner Store (owned by the same people and share a kitchen) and love it. I've been meaning to try Uncle Sal's because I always hear great things about their food.  I came here last night for dinner with a group of girls and it's obvious we were out of place - everyone in the joint belonged in the geriatric department...not that I'm hating on it. Great food is great food and I don't care who eats where but if you're looking for a posh happenin spot to dine, this wouldn't exactly have the best vibes.   I think the biggest disappointment was the service. Though I'm sure she is nice lady, I felt like maybe she was overwhelmed because she seemed confused on just about everything. They were out of a tortellini dish and that's what my friend wanted to order so it's not rocket science that if you're out of one stuffed pasta, just replace it with another. My friend asked for the ravioli instead...shouldn't be that hard. The server acted like we were speaking martian. My friend was the first to order and as that whole bit was going down, I looked around at the rest of the table and you could just see the look of frustration on everyone's face...like for fuck's sake, this server is gonna be the death us. Bear in mind, many of us have worked in the industry so we know our shit and aren't usually overly critical. The check comes out and they charged my friends so much extra - like if you get a Caesar salad vs the house salad with your entree, there's an upcharge. Don't you think as a server, you would say something to your guest as a warning? She couldn't remember which wines we were drinking...it was just a clusterfuck and totally ruined the dining experience.   I ordered the steamed mussels and a side of the meatballs. The meatballs were cold...but the sauce was hot and the dish was hot. IDK if they just warmed up my food in the microwave or what, I didn't speak up because the server was already on my nerves and I didn't want to have to interact with her any more than necessary.   Another annoying thing is they don't do separate checks - the vibe when I saw that on the menu screaming at me was irritating. I get it. Split checks are so annoying, but guess what - so is your antiquated order taking system. She must not have a POS system to ring up on because the check came out and it was on the old school hand written checks. Seems like the restaurant owners aren't looking to get up with technology, but it's effecting the service and that needs to change ASAP.   Other than my meatballs being cold, the food is great which is why they get 2 stars. I really want to give it 3 but I don't think I'll come back unless I'm sitting at the bar, there are just other Italian options out there where service and food make for a better overall dining experience. Sorry Sal. Not into it.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kind of aggressive. I feel like I&#39;m being scolded. Not good for groups I guess.

F5DOdGTUtovKO7e9moPIhw.text: It's time I updated my last review. My last review centered around their fettuccine Alfredo. Well, I waited a long time to try this restaurant again but I'm glad I gave them a second, and third chance.   After taking a long hiatus , I was craving a good dish of fettuccine Alfredo but wanted it close to home with take out. So, I decided to give Uncle Sal's another opportunity.  Then, I waited and ordered again to ensure they would be consistent with the taste of the dish. Oh Boy!! YUM Yum Yumm Yummy!! Just finished my latest take out order and and happy as a clam, on fettuccine Alfaro!

KjKDXvRfxSoqJYayBJ_UTQ.text: My family and I have been coming to Uncle Sal's for 10 plus years. It is a tradition on my mother and aunt's birthday to lunch here every year. They were sat at a table for 4 in the bar area because my husband was to meet us. He was caught up at work and ended up not being able to join. The woman tending bar yelled at us and told us we had to move from the table because we were no longer a party of 4. The majority of her bar and all of the dining area was empty so it made absolutely no sense that she would be kicking out 3 paying customers from her section. She made a huge scene when I asked to speak to her manager who was not there and told us if she was us she would just leave and proceeded to get her regulars at the bar to chime in and insult us as well. It was the most ridiculous and insulting experience I've ever had in my 36 years of life! She completely ruined an annual tradition which had in the past always been a pleasant experience. I have worked in the service industry for several years and I've never seen anything so uncalled for. Don't EVER dine here if you expect to be treated like a human being let alone a customer.

2NNnhb2GIihmcnFKaujF3g.text: I have eaten at Uncle Sal's many times over the years.  I have always ordered one of the veal dishes and all have been delicious.  Last night, because I am experiencing a tooth problem, I ordered spaghetti and meatballs.  What a disappointment.  What Italian restaurant would serve over-cooked water-logged noodles that have no flavor whatsoever?  And, the noodles were served lukewarm!  The taste of the meatballs was mediocre at best.  Beware if you order this dish.  I would have sent my dish back except we were treating friends from out of town and they were all enjoying veal dishes that they gave rave reviews.  I didn't want to spoil their evening.   I will return to this restaurant but never again order spaghetti and meatballs!

0wibCUPFZw8BDb-81A_GRw.text: Soooo. I am I the only one that  has noticed that the prices went up , (which I understand)  and the portions are smaller ??? .... I have been going to Sals for years 20+... ordered the same thing I always do ... chicken and mushrooms off the bar menu .. the portion is 1/3 of what it used to be ... we used to be able to split it . I was told that they started using better Chicken .. that's why the amounts we different ...thought it was just a bad night , went again and had same experience ... :((

ILViZ9b_cyIFW-KtT5pFKw.text: First time visit. Sitting in the bar area and you get a special bar only menu. Great selection including steak at fantastic prices ($11 for a steak dinner).  Adequate parking, fast service and pleasant employees. We will be back!

byaYF6q2gi7JQPqovZbQCQ.text: I mean, wow. This place is a little hidden gem. It was our first time trying Uncle Sal's and we were delighted by the casual atmosphere, the great service and the amazing food. We started with the stuffed mushroom and then one of us got the soup, the other got a salad. For dinner I ordered the chicken piccata (delicious) and my hubby had the lobster ravioli (which he said was "bomb"). By the time our food came, we scarcely had room to eat it. We took home leftovers which we enjoyed for lunch the day following! We will definitely be back and next time we'll take it easy on the sharable portions of appetizers and soup/salad so that we make it all the way to dessert!

PFZesish-lLkygrkXTmQ2A.text: My sister and I decided to choose Uncle Sal's Restaurant based on the sheer fact that it smelled so good outsidebut  unfortunately, it was not the best decision. The salad was overly dressed with ranch and our dish was just mediocre. We asked for angel hair pasta and got spaghetti instead and when we told our waitress she didn't apologize for the mistake nor did she offer to do anything to fix it. We had to ask for a side of angel hair by ourselves which came loaded with butter and completely ruined our dish. Also, the pasta that did come with our dish was room temp. Our waitress is also a reason we wouldnt return.She was short with us and impatient and kept passing our table by over and over again.  The good parts about the restaurant would be that the portions are large and splittable and the chicken and veggies did have a lot of flavor.

02XSrwttZwyhZ5q7_hFrPQ.text: From the wine, to the service to food, this place is OG Italian. If you are ready for some carb-loading this is the place.

p9mRfbujJTYp4Yao0g4lMg.text: This is a neighborhood gem. Family-owned, old-school Italian...we haven'thad a bad meal here yet. Great calzones, chicken marsala, and fsntastic tiramisu. Great service and a cozy atmosphere. Their bar next door, The Side Door, is a great find. Love this place.

Ok1qewCu2coVQo5THpWzsA.text: Uncle Sal's is delicious and has a nice atmosphere.  The host and bus staff are wonderful.  Scott was the rudest waiter I have ever had.  We came in for a birthday dinner and we are a polite bunch; we say thank you and try to be pleasant.  Scott never said you are welcome--he was snotty and spent most of the dinner chatting up the host who was clearly his boss.  This guy was awful.  When I started to be rude back to him, suddenly it was like he remembered what his job was and he started be obsequious.  It really ruined the dinner.  I hope that management reads this and addresses the issue.  If we return we will make sure Scott isn't our waiter.

kYSfrDQ_qZlD7m0khg7WpA.text: great, family owned place that feels like the kind of italian joint that is made with love.   Food options are very good with traditional italian dishes and unique entrees that can't be found elsewhere.

DAS8EbROitEkD9b3sQ47Sw.text: I was craving some Italian food in a casual setting and browsing this Uncle Sal's Yelp entry yielded terms like "old school," and "basic."  I was definitely jonesing for some "old school" Italian food (I'm assuming this meant old school 70's 80's Americana old school).  Anyway, the second I stepped in this place I had a good feeling about it.  With each progressive course, from getting my drink frequently refilled, to the garlic bread, and the ridiculously basic soup/salad, I was liking this place more and more.  Unfortunately, the Lady wasn't feeling that well and we got our entrees to go and ate the rest in the hotel room and the next morning.  Regardless of sitting in some aluminum containers and not going through any reheating, the food was still great.    This isn't the best uh.... "American Italian" that you'll ever have, but it's pretty damned good and it totally hit the spot.  Dishes we've had:  Stuffed Mushrooms - drowning in alfredo sauce, with some sort of... pepperoni breadcrumb filling?  This was quite delicious.  Clams Oreganada - sure this dish is ridiculously simple and easy to make, but that doesn't keep it from being freaking delicious.  The Lady's first thing when opening the menu was "you're getting the clams, aren't you."  Salad - You know when you've lived in St. Louis for too long when you're like "damnit, I forgot to ask them to hold the CHEESE!"  and then be like "oh ok... it's just mozzarella..."  Cream of Mushroom Soup - mmmm...  Veal Saltimbocca - pretty decent  Rack of Lamb Marsala - This was excellent.  It was even good at room temp the next morning.

bQMSNolUGYKs5cIzK-ITtg.text: Hadn't been here for a couple of years since I used to have my office practically next door. Had forgotten how good it was, and especially the garlic bread always brought for free at the beginning. Came with my wife, daughter and her boyfriend for his pre-triathalon pasta. Two huge chicken dished and two calamari Fra Diablos later, we were stuffed. One note - the Fra Diablo was too mild for my, and even my daughter's taste. I should have realized when I saw the much older clientele, typical of the neighborhood. Easily solved upon ordering. And the prices were incredibly fair, $110, with 3 glasses of wine, tax and tip for the four of us.

7jpNclMGpfGKEDG9Z46Liw.text: Good service, but the food is average. Had the gnocchi which came with a salad. Not bad for both, but unremarkable. Same goes for the complimentary garlic bread, which was decent though partly burnt. My family seems to enjoy this place more than I do, for what that's worth.

SQfrn8twUa7RzhsUMcp-yQ.text: I am not going to complain about the food... I have been coming here off and on for 20 something years...  I am VERY disappointed about my service last night... My friend  (who just had major knee surgery and one of her first outings in 48 days) and I arrived at 4:30-4:45... yes we did not have reservations,.. my bad.. we wanted to have a drink in the bar before dinner... the bar was packed and we saw no handicap access so the not so polite hostess sat us at a table..I asked for a table up front so my friend did not have far to go on her walker.. but was told no those were for reservations. She sat us in the back.. we each ordered a drink and just relaxing..after about 15 min we started to feel a little presured to order our meal.. the waiter then came over and told us he "got yelled at" for not taking our order.. most likley by that little bitch at the front desk.. we ordered our meal and a bottle of wine.. we finished our meal but still had wine.. again we began to feel pressured to leave.. the bar was not an option due to my friend's disability.. Long story short... aprox less then 90 min, $130.00 later we were out of there... very disapointed

MmFqPU8a61PtwR2dUDXCyQ.text: I went to Uncle Sal's for the first time the other night and would definitely go back.  My friends and I ate at the bar, and the selection on the bar menu alone met all of our needs. The bartender was very attentive and our glasses were never empty. The food was good. I got the grilled chicken with the sauteed mushrooms and really enjoyed it. My friends enjoyed their steak and scallops as well. But by far, I have to say the tiramisu was amazing! I would go back for the tiramisu alone. It was creamy and light- just perfect!  Also, I found the other customers at the bar to be really friendly. We were interested in trying the pizza, and the people next to us shared one of their slices with us! Can't say that happens very often.  I'm from the East Coast, and have had a hard time finding good Italian places here in Phoenix. But I'll say, Uncle Sal's reminds me of a great Italian place back home  in NJ called Goodfellas... and the next time my parents come out here to visit, Uncle Sal's will definitely be one of our stops!

LDSGK67PaypcWIqI4PzsKw.text: A very inadequate meal and expensive for the low quality food you get.  Ordered the veal sorrentino and it was not enjoyable to eat.  Very dry, tough...just gross.  Caesar salad was also disgusting and unpleasant, saturated in dressing.  I did like the atmosphere, laid back and comfortable.  Knowing that Pasta Brioni is down the street, I won't go back.

x2bM0s76uaHO5qaM-BycKA.text: I have never had a bad meal at Uncle Sal's. This is the type of italian place that has you unbuttoning your pants at the end of your meal AND taking left overs home! Great wine selection too!

ZBQilEH1j93qgyWxVD5rNw.text: I wrote a review on Sunday and now it's gone ? It was about their very, very poor service. Where do the reviews go that are up on the Yelp website and then disappear from the businesses page one is reviewing?

u9fC6d_gtZH4Vj90aEhqLQ.text: I decided to check this place out simply because it was close to my hotel and looked nice from the outside. I ordered Linguine w/White Clam Sauce and was very content. Even the garlic bread was delicious.  The service: not so great. I was seated outside and had to wait a very long time just for my server to take my order. After I received my food, she was still inattentive.

tSpaVUhwOjOK1lVlCm9Z1Q.text: I went to Uncle Sals Side Door Corner Store for lunch one Friday, and I loved it.  I was very impressed with the selection of food, as well as the prices.  I had the Italian beef sandwich with some cheese on top.  I have not had a decent Italian beef sandwich since I moved from the Midwest until I went to this place.  If you're looking for Italian beef, this is the place.  Its not a fancy place, rather a hole-in-the-wall location with a very comfortable atmosphere.

ZpQ3y-L8DFzG794sFJzJNg.text: I do not understand some of these reviews. I eat out in fine restaurants a lot here and many other cities throughout the US and I LOVE Uncle Sal's. The marinara sauce is one of my favorites...the pork chop is excellent...the short ribs are divine...and the staff are so friendly and helpful. Love it.  If you waited almost an hour at any restaurant without raising hell...I recommend you man up. I would not do that. I highly recommend this restaurant.

cR4Ieyb6kPOCHhU3SB3V6g.text: This has got to be the best italian food in all of Arizona.  The baked clams, which I have not had in 15 years, were fantastic.  Veal picata to die for.  Very friendly staff, excellent service. Too bad I live in San Diego becuase I could see myself going there at least once a week.  Just fabulous!

klmjHOQNqn3MCJtribb87Q.text: I have lived nearby for the past 5 years and had no desire to go to this establishment partially because of the fact that it seemed a bit bland but also because the strip mall it's in (stuck between an Office Max and a UPS store, isn't the most pleasant to visit or enjoy a meal). That being said I was a fool I'll admit.  At the urging of my girlfriend to try something new, I finally accepted to go. It was for whatever reason very buys for a Tuesday, something I really can't complain about because a lot of what makes a restaurant one in which I want to return is the atmosphere, preferably not dread and you being the only one(s) eating there. I was taken aback by the fact that when you enter the restaurant you've basically entered  the geriatric society of Scottsdale. But the crowd is vibrant and there is definitely almost a "neighborhood hangout" feel which is extremely rare to find in Scottsdale From the conversations overheard I'd be cool with having any of them as grandparents.The decor felt no so much Mediterranean or Italian as it did that of a country club or vessel but it was still homey atmosphere and well done.  As for the food, I had the tortellini alla panna and my girlfriend got the lasagna. I've never been a big fan of restaurant lasagna to be honest (other than in Europe) and this dish was pretty good. I have to give a big thumbs up to the side salad. Delicious basically.   The service was perfect, the atmosphere despite (yes you can hate on me) the fact that we were half the age of everyone there was really pleasant. Definitely felt like Cheers but with great food.

g0YHdMtQQyoRdtmXeAL57A.text: Iv been here a few time this is an old school mediocre food Italian restaurant service is fair interior is actually cool.

EKxQmNMUOb-O4X0wWPbWHA.text: I loved Uncle Sal's!  I was visiting and rented a condo down the street.  Everywhere I went people recommended it.  We sat in the bar and the staff was awesome, the wine was great, the food was delicious and affordable.  About a week later we went to The Side Door, a little pub attached to Uncle Sal's and same owner.  I had an excellent Chicago hot dog and my friend had the best mac and cheese.  Then we went into Uncle Sal's and had tiramasu for desert.  SO good!

lv8_Bz2TnUN0_N7CJOj6_g.text: we had the happy hour steak dinner for 10 dollars. its a really pretty place inside, popular place also

cdfza6NMoUvflPWNK1I7Zw.text: Sat at the bar and ordered off it's menu, had the braised short ribs and they were a home run! Ordered the side of pasta and a side salad, which were both just ok. The ribs, however, were done to perfection and while at first it seemed like a small portion, I was getting full by the second rib. Had two glasses of Rutherford Hill Merlot and bread, so with the tip it came to just over $40. I never saw the restaurant, so I can't comment on it. I would go back again.

iuppTPTgZZPd5LFfsPbyvQ.text: My husband and I have been searching for a nice Italian spot in az and I think we found one!! Great place!

2Xci_t1PqMlD9hNH56dLWg.text: I'm here at least once a week and the food is awesome but the atmosphere is why I go back it's like a perfect neighborhood bar with the greatest staff Johnny is the bomb

xAxlU3jyAi50EsECD__YOw.text: I've been in this place several times and it's one of my favorites for several reasons.  The prices for what you get are great, nice ambiance and good servings.  Tip: They have special prices at the bar, and it's a great place to sit for parties of 1-3.  We had the short rib (bar portion) and stuffed mushrooms to share. Nothing not to  L-O-V-E of this dishes. The mushrooms are in a thick cheese sauce and the brisket in a juice that you can soak the garlic bread to reach a food nirvana.   I also ordered the file (11 oz) with gorgonzola sauce and fries. WOW. Seriously 5 people around me were drooling and asking me how it was. The guy next to me said that he would order that next week.  But be careful, the servings are pretty generous. I ended up leaving like 1/4 of the filet.  I strongly recommend to order several dishes to share everything, you know what they say, right? "Sharing is caring".  Again, don't expect a fancy pretentious place or up-scale restaurant. But the food quality, servings and price point are unbeatable.   If I have to complain about something, I believe the restrooms need to be updated.   Cheers.  PS This place was part owned by Sammy "the bull" Gravano's wive back in the day, which gives it the feeling of the Italian joint of the movies.

Y9JpVh0gYFjy6ze7f26uXw.text: Just had lunch there.  We were seated right away and given water right away but after that, it seems like we were forgotten.  It's no wonder - it seems there was only one waitress doing all the work.  She was very attentive when she actually had time for us.  I don't "blame" her one bit - for a place as popular as Uncle Sal's, it seems management should be aware of how many servers they need on staff.  I dunno - maybe somebody called in sick.  At any rate - I got the chicken Scarpariello and it was outstanding.  Wonderful flavor, expertly cooked.  The "joint" was quaint and neighborly - I bet it has a great vibe at night.  The decor was so very 30 years ago - which was awesome.  It reminds me of the little places where the husband and wife are in the back cooking, all the kids are servers and the old grandma who only speaks Italian is in back stirring a pot of gravy.  Sigh... memories...  Only people who truly appreciate what it means to eat at a family restaurant will "get" this place.  It's sad that so many people hold Olive Garden or some other God-awful chain in such high regard as to grade everyone else according to that standard.    Good job, Uncle Sal's - you impressed me!

H4MIq8sBa4xWDsGWs9PlQg.text: I am Italian and I NEVER go to Italian restaurants because they're never better then what I make at home. However, Uncle Sal's is PHENOMENAL. The gentleman on the phone was so wonderful when I called and helped me create the pizza I wanted. The pizza itself was TO DIE FOR! The crust was so fresh, the cheese was perfection and all the toppings were awesome.  I honestly could go on forever about this place. I even called to thank them personally for such a lovely experience. Everything about this experience was what great customer service and great food should be.

L1LsmQ3oqNV4qbtjbO8akQ.text: Been here twice. First time was really good except they had redo my pizza.   Second time, not so good. Pizza was comparable to Dominos.   I will say the Cadillac Margaritas were kick butt.

UkFgwsw0DavN1PQyZQRnzQ.text: I was recently in Uncle Sal's for Happy Hour and was so pleasantly surprised by the cozy/warm atmosphere in the bar.  Shame on me for deglecting this spot, I just don't go out that often any more.  Their extensive & award winning wine list is a big attraction along with a healthy pour of wine AND all the friendly ladies working the bar.  I didn't eat this trip but made a reservation in September for my High School bi-monthly get together with the girls.  However, I've had pizza & caesar salads at the Side Door and have always been pleased!

o3SWcNdzFLVPNl-Opg_bfA.text: Went here about a month ago.  I had their Egg Plant Parmesan.  The food was very good.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The decor is a little old and the food was a little pricey for what you got.

gyxhe-GnDPSNFLX2y6Ui7w.text: Went based on a recommendation and well....  I wasn't impressed.  First, it was so dark in there that it was hard to tell how clean the place was.  The iced tea was too strong.  Our server couldn't tell me what was in the stuffed mushrooms.  The garlic bread was very garlicky and my chicken Marsala actually had piccata sauce on it.  It came with green beans and onions.  They should have left out the onions.  There was so much butter on them that it ruined the piccata sauce, which was tasty even though it was not what I ordered.  The salad had one, yes one, cherry tomato.  Could they spare it?  And they were stingy with the spaghetti too.  Hubby's sausage and peppers were average.  We took a piece of cheesecake home and it was awful!  It tasted like it sat in the refrigerator uncovered so it absorbed all of the other odors and the crust was burnt.  Sorry Uncle Sal's just was not up to par.

q0py0oVVJm0ZRevFKD0Eng.text: One of my lunchtime favorites -- a great bar menu under $10 (steak, shrimp, Italian sausage, etc) with good quality food and prompt service.   Fun place to have drinks at happy hour. Plus, they have a nice traditional dining room for dinner.   The bar area is always DARK (how it should be).

p5lF_g0--pm0XQ6clfa7pA.text: Uncle Sal's was recommended by a friend. Being raised in New York City (and having an Italian grandmother), I love Italian food.  Four of us went on the busiest night  of the week, the Saturday before Easter Sunday. The food was impeccable. My cioppino was more than almost anyone could eat, the seafood was excellent. My friends' entrees were lasagna (meat), gnocchi and lobster ravioli. All were superb. We shared 2 orders of the Mozarella Caprese. The tomatoes were soft enough to be ripe and the cheese was melted perfectly. Caesar salads were had by all. My only small nitpick was that anchovies had to be specified, they aren't automatic. The carafe of red vino di casa was fine.  The service was excellent. The waitstaff was there for us when we needed them without being intrusive.   Excellent food. This restaurant wouldn't be out of place in Little Italy in NYC, the North End of Boston or Federal Hill in Providence.

JRAYEAJLVMptLSygI0OiHQ.text: This is the second restaurant that we tried here in AZ and I must admit that it is perfect! I am not dissatisfied one bit. This place is really good and great customer service! I hate to admit it but the lasagna here is about 3% better then my moms, and nothing beats her food!

QUR3yH9C2AtAhGWHqyakaw.text: Terrific local Italian with all the traditional favorites ... and always some inspired specials.  Start off with the fresh garlic bread........The service is always stellar--welcoming, friendly, but still professional... good wine list with surprisingly low prices (at least on the bottle I ordered....I know how much it costs in the liquor store!). Great place for kids....

tJI7BxBjxDNTO1LRqPSKmA.text: Amazing food. Awful, awful service.   The garlic bread...very good. Softer than I expected, which was nice. I also just wasn't expecting garlic bread. So it was a nice surprise.   Escargot - I was the only one at the table (of 10) to eat it. They were great! Served bubbling hot, not rubbery at all, delicious sauce. I kept the dish to dip bread into just because of the sauce.   Veal scarpariello - amazing. Everything tasted fantastic. Ok, the carrots that were on the side were a bit plain and could have been softer, but the veal itself and the sauce it was in, and the mushrooms and pasta...I left nothing on my plate.  My husband got the same and also had the same impression.   Creme brulee - fantastic. Tasted great, good texture. Pleasantly surprised.  My husband got the tiramisu and said it was great.   So why the 3 stars when the food was so amazing? Because of the terrible service.  1 - we got water. Great. But our server *never* asked us if we wanted anything else. When my husband finally stopped him to ask for a glass for my father in law, a coke for myself and other drinks, our server looked very inconvenienced by it.  2 - didn't get to order appetizers. You see I got escargot? I ordered that with my meal. Our server never asked about appetizers and went straight to meals. Also, my husband was walking with our daughter when the ordering was starting and needed an extra minute. Our server wanted to start with him. When asked if he could start with someone else's order, our server protested, but eventually did move on to the next person. You'd think starting at the next person was asking him to cut off his hand.  3 - empty glasses everywhere! Never got or was offered a refill on my drink. Or anyone else's. When my father stopped our server well after our meal was over and asked if I could get a coke, our server said I had never ordered one. Well of course I hadn't...I never had a chance to! 4 - offering dessert seemed a complete afterthought.   Will I recommend this place to anyone else? Conditionally. I'll make sure to tell them that the food was very good, but not to go if they want attentive service, are on any kind of time constraint, expect refills on their drinks, or are at all shy about getting a server's attention.

J54soKuPYFTpnO6x7Ux_Hg.text: We took my mom here for her birthday tonight and we really, really enjoyed it. The place was very clean, nice looking and super friendly, professional service (thanks Nick!!!). Alot of guests seemed like they knew each other and the staff, so it had a very homey and welcoming feel. They had an extensive wine list, too bad they didn't have a Moscato (my new favorite), but we ordered the Riesling instead, which was still wonderful. I had the Chicken Saltimboca, mom had the braised beef and her husband had the Eggplant Rollintini. Everything was very tasty. Not greasy, heavy and over salted. Just real flavors of all the food. They also bring out the best garlic bread, I must have ate 8 pieces! The cannoli was made exactly how it should be made and the tartufo was excellent along with an Illy espresso. YUM!! What a very pleasant dining and food experience. I will definitely be back!

Yj1Hd22ZK5YPz2jLoB1FDA.text: Amazing old school Italian with phenomenal service. I do recommend reservations! We went early and got in. Great wine list. Great salad. Awesome entrees.

gh-kbj8znCCPkK7Ayr1Yvw.text: Super friendly wait staff. The inside is dimly lit around the bar and it gives for a private and warm environment. Classic Italian food and decent craft beer selection. All around great place to eat after 18 holes at continental.

Si1xawCTBHgb_a49aC-GGQ.text: Been here a couple of times for "occasion" dinners and I have never been disappointed.   Yes, I am your typical "yelp" elitist. I don't enjoy McDonalds, Applebees or Olive Garden. Uncle Sal's is a legit spot for a nice dinner.  As soon as you walk in, you are treated to a nice, quiet, classy place. It's so "NOT SCOTTSDALE"....so if you are looking for a scene, go elsewhere.   This is where you take someone special for their birthday, or your parents when they come visit. The type of place where you WANT to engage in a conversation.   The server is very friendly....and even remembers you if you come back.  The menu has something for EVERYONE, vegetarians, pescatarians, and carnivores alike.  The wine list is quite good (with awards from Wine Spectator), and a cozy bar as well.  There are only 15 or so tables, so if you want a table, call ahead for a reservation. It will help.  You'll like this spot....but don't come here expecting Culinary Dropout, or Sapporo type of a vibe. It's an old school, quiet type of place. Enjoy!

5v3j5F-Ce6DmQh9i40wzhg.text: This place is amazing!  I go there a couple times a month and the bar area is the best.  Steak and salad for $11?  Get the bar menu and its worth it.  The bartenders are great as well and give healthy wine pours.

qws9TzP7HfrDCnHd4xV1Bg.text: Horrible horrible service!!! Excellent food!!!! We were sat at 7:45 and didn't even get our food until like 9pm!!! Our server was a damn squirrel, she would ask if we needed anything and then before we could answer would just walk off our yell at a table or server across the way, she was very brisk and very random! Gratuity is added on after 6 people we had 7 so I guess she felt she could just do whatever and we could wait however long. Bidder would come up and just start clearing everything very gruffly, banging plates and dishes!! Great food though but be prepared to sit forever and at that point don't really care the food was great!

M3W0FsJVxuN6MasPYyK5jA.text: This is a great place with food at a great price unfortunately the hillbillies from the Midwest just don't get it

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

GRLgJsfBP6fX_km4Ocvu0A.text: My family and I ate there for the first time Saturday, December 16. We sat outside in the covered and heated patio but we were in the corner and it still got chilly. The crabcakes were not impressive at all. The chicken marsala was bland although we did enjoy their cioppino and braised beef short ribs. Service was just OK. I felt like it took a long time and it definitely attracted an older crowd. I'm in my 50s and felt too young. If we go back, I will try to sit in the main restaurant because I think it would be a much better experience.

dsouH7bxCFXbeY0Lg83qCA.text: Inedible. My three friends and I did not eat the chicken parmigiana or fettuccine alfredo. The green beans are canned. The chicken cutlet was soggy, rubbery, and watery. It seemed as if it was freezer burned and nuked in a microwave. The fettuccine alfredo sauce was so watered down, it tasted like raw noodles. I have never seen a restaurant serve such low quality, dog food, to everyone at the table. Paid $25 dollars for a meal I did not eat. Will never go back.

SuW6NkbKUGMHZfNCu_FlFQ.text: Absolutely delicious!  The service was wonderful too! I had the filet Gorgonzola.  So good and so much flavor.  If you love Gorgonzola I highly recommend this.  The other person in the party had a veal dish and loved it too.  Our waiter was great and very attentive.  Highly recommend..

NuUzPStIzsBtfYVgLjMAFQ.text: Food was delicious! There were some draw backs keeping it from being higher. First, we couldn't split the check into the three parties. Second, the waiter couldn't offer suggestions bc he didn't eat red sauce or much of the food offered there. This usually wouldn't be a big deal but the place offers a very authentic menu and should be presented in such a way. Also around the 6pm the restaurant became very warm. The restaurant was full but still.

WRn5xGmKPe9QAntBnd6qDg.text: Awesome, make reservations. Four of us went for dinner and argued who had the best choice. Nobody would share.

MVn87hnjmrQcgwHa4__pGQ.text: Been talking about going here for months, since I live right down the street, but I'm kicking myself for not coming in sooner. Finally went last night for dinner and had a 5 star experience, truly. Wait staff was friendly, all food ordered was beyond delicious.    Started with a bottle of cabernet, had the Calamari and shrimp appetizer which was top 3 I've ever had. Garlic bread came out with the wine, delectable... then our entrees. My man ordered the Veal Saltimbucca and I ordered the Tortellini Alla Panna , both out of this world and we took the leftovers home.   I cannot wait to go back. Would give this place 100 starts if I could.

wV6bkhTpWwuIkCbHqBWHQQ.text: My first thought for dinner when I want to steer clear of downtown Scottsdale and stay old-school + neighborhood but I've become progressively disappointed with the food. Last meal of spaghetti and meatballs were bricks of bland meatballs and spaghetti marinara over cooked and swimming in bowl of excess water as if sloppily/missed drained. To their credit, hubby says chicken and veal dishes are the way to go at Sal's.

o_IfqIu8mQTawiNT3y7yAQ.text: Uncle Sals has an old school New York feel and the food is amazing and at affordable prices. The bar is busy just about all 7 days of the week. Staff is very friendly and you may even strike up a conversation with one of the locals.   5 stars and highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

4Tz8_7crNRsfFlRQvlTDmw.text: We recently caught wind of Uncle Sal's, so decided to check it out a little over a week ago.  It was packed when we arrived, so we found a nice table at the bar.  The bartenders were friendly, professional and so efficient.  The atmosphere was lively and filled with locals.  We shared an order of the tasty meatballs and a caesar salad to start.  I enjoyed the penne a la vodka and my husband enjoyed the lasagna. Delicious, simple food that doesn't try to hard - a nice change of pace!

oEXX1ph5QQ8yPPQTbWO1zQ.text: Honestly a really disappointing dinner. To start we had made reservations... thank goodness. Place was so busy, but service was awful. Our waitress had about 5 tables we watched her walking to. Waiting way to long for bread made my family and I ready to order appetizers. We requested the stuffed mushroom and also asked for a small dish to dip the bread into with Alfredo. We were then informed that the food is basically made ahead of time and sounds like they ship in frozen food and just warm it. You would never believe it. Having to practically beg our waitress for bread and a refill for drinks. So frustrating. We then called another girl over and when our waitress saw she proceeded to get frustrated, even though we had asked 10 minutes prior. Our appetizers took way to long and the food was done by the time the APPETIZER came out. One of the dishes we ordered we asked for no chicken... GUESS WHAT. BIG CHUNKS OF CHICKEN. horrible horrible service when it was basically is  one big complaint and our waitress not caring and saying "happy birthday" to my grandfather when he got the chicken he specifically asked 4 times to not have. The manager looking carelessly and never even asked how we were doing.

idR5B4qficfZw5bSCIE5EA.text: Holy crap the food is bad. I didn't even think it was possible to make food that was as bad as this was, but now I have proof that it can be done. This is supposed to be some ridiculously good authentic Italian restaurant that draws in celebrity assholes like Harvey Weinstein, but we ordered food from here on door dash and it was utterly flavorless, dry, and inedible. I immediately grabbed the salt shaker because apparently Uncle Sal doesn't believe in salt, and my boyfriend said "you too"? He had already doused his food in salt as well. Even after salting it, I just could not eat it. I think I ate two bites and gave the rest to the dogs. I ordered the lasagna, and I make a vegan lasagna that is far superior to the garbage lasagna they are putting out and having the audacity to charge SEVENTEEN dollars for. I would not call it bad, it was just plain gross. I see some reviews here that make no sense to me. Have these people eaten food before? Are we talking about the SAME RESTAURANT? Do they need a tongue transplant? My boyfriends food was also terrible and we both ended up eating Cheetos. We were beyond disappointed because not only is it WAY over priced, but we also paid a rather large delivery fee plus tip. We used to get food from here over 5 years ago, and it was really good, but since then things have taken a serious turn for the worst. Expensive lesson learned. Order from sauce. The food is excellent and so are the prices. No, no, no, no, no. Just no.

eZ4Fv6a0QepxLPpITIl5uA.text: Always great food, service and pricing. The crowd is a bit older but very loyal patrons.

7dLO9Eamh1ded3_gpE5WsA.text: Expect to wait for your food. This place is NOT good for children under 10. No kids menu.

zhAg-0C_XwG_NhrOY9V-UQ.text: Have tried just about everything on the menu and have never been disappointed. Lobster ravioli is my favorite dish.

RsZzj2x88g1RlbGL_rF2MQ.text: Uncle Sal's is perfect combination of great food, great value, kind staff, & friendly, neighborhood bar. Multiple meals, including pizza, pasta, & salads. All worth repeating. If you need a "go to place", this is it. Appropriately busy...so consider planning ahead.

KKJm_VJ6ESJYSuMeB5mVNA.text: Amazing little authentic Italian restaurant! I can honestly say one of the best Veal dishes I ever had. It's always busy and I've had excellent food and service each time I've visited. I highly recommend this little wonderful place!

WUN8W2OW5YULOKunO3_zgQ.text: This was hands down one of the best Italian restaurants I have been to in Arizona. The atmosphere was beautiful the service was great. Some of the people I was with were a bit complicated, but the manager and the servers were so wonderful and nice. Everything we ordered, down to the salad, was delicious. I can't say enough great things about this place. I highly recommend it!!

rj531mlRybM-lo8NKnPsxg.text: Yum!!! I've been wanting to try it but have always been skeptical when driving by.  Figured it must be good though for being around so long!!    This place is fabulous!! My new go-to for some good ole fashioned Italian! Great wine list, amazing food, and best melt in your mouth garlic bread!! Can't wait to go back.    Arrived about 8:30 on a Sat evening (middle of summer). Bar was still full but not packed, and the restaurant was about a qtr full. Perfect ambiance for a casual later dinner.  Only sad that I've lived here 13 yrs and am just now trying it.

F4Grk0tB0fzudT2RBkaWkQ.text: The four stars is for the food only. Do not go to this restaurant if you have a party of more than four with separate checks. We had eight. They do not handle separate checks you figure it out yourself. They add a 19% gratuity. When you figure it out they then have trouble ringing it in one by one. Other than that we all enjoyed our meals and would come back in a smaller party.

qXkV1AuByfd3YDvVLxsSdQ.text: We finally got seated and I went to open my menu and a cockroach comes crawling out! It fell into my lap making me jump up and then we killed it on the floor. The waitress came up and picked it up and didn't say anything else about it. The manager Sheldon never came over to say anything about that. Even after we said something to the hostesses she just told us Merry Christmas and walked away. The manager walked by our table 10 times and never said anything to us. We walked right by Sheldon on our way out and he still didn't say anything! My family and I will never be coming back to this place. Also going to report this to the health department.

jsiDmqxGsRbfhogMmwjaRQ.text: Love Uncle Sal's.  The food is amazing.  We get the veal parm and I know my husband eats something, but I'm so engrossed in my own meal that I pay little attention.   Make reservations because the place gets packed on busy nights.  Open seating at the bar but it is seldom actually "open"

g0jIEsulYP-8wydCX2Y6IQ.text: Zuppa de Pesce - Pasta ok, seafood tired, tough, tasteless. Chicken Marsala - Sauce was way too sweet. Linguini and Clam - Overpowered by oregano.  Ciao, Uncle Sal.

Kcb0Iz1UQi69DYCpH1OsRg.text: The food- AMAZING! NO Complaints.  The service- awful, just awful!!! Looking at you Johnny.   Came here tonight for the first time with my aunt, I live a bloack away, so it is very convenient. We sat in the bar area. We ordered our own entrees which included sides. We ordered one drink each, but the server seemed irritated we didn't want to order more drinks. But since we were both driving, we did not want to put ourselves at risk. He kept giving us the feeling as though he was irritated at us, like when I asked for water, he was visibly annoyed. We order our food, and when he brought our food, didn't even acknowledge us, or ask if we needed anything which, we did! He didn't give us utensils, or makes sure anything else we need will be met. I went up to the bar, ask for utensils, so that I can begin my meal.   We had to wait 15 minutes with dirty plates on the table before he cleared them, and then he left and did not give me a chance to ask for the bill. Another 10 minutes passes, and finally I do, and he again doesn't acknowledge, so I asked again, to which he sternly said that he heard me.. ok like you didn't say anything, it's loud at dinner time.. I was just making sure because you have not checked up on us and we don't want to just sit here all night. Bill arrives, and heres the best part! He charged for extra things which were not ordered. For example, he charged for salads, but neither my aunt or I got a salad, just the sides that were included in the entrees.. He asked if the bill was ready and I asked if he could break it down? He became argumentative and said what is there to break down? I said well what is this charge? Pointing to a random number he wrote down in the middle of the check, he said that it was salad, I said ok,, but we didn't order salads, he said yeah they are on side, you did. I said, no, that was included.. on their menu, it clearly states is included into the entree. He was very pissed, and I was not going to argue with him any more.   He tried pulling the old server trick, adding and uncharging to the bill, padding it a little more, well it didn't work. He got caught.  Again- great food, so good, like reallllyyyy good! But when servers try to cheat the system, thats just wrong.. and not worth going back to.

2dvYRPwkMblqBOP_a89pJA.text: Uncle Sal's has been a neighborhood favorite 25 years. The cozy & comfortable dining room is perfect for an occasion. You will leave with satisfied tastebuds and VERY full tummies!   We always start with a fabulous bottle of wine {...last night we had the Coppola Cab & it was amazing!} and their Frito Misto {fried calamari & shrimp} that is served with with their homemade marinara sauce.   For the entree, I LOVE their Scallops Piccatta. It is so buttery and delicious. Comfort food at its finest, that's for sure! It comes with your choice of a house salad or their soup of the day. I always get the house salad with their homemade Italian dressing. If you're looking to dine at a cozy Italian neighborhood favorite, I would recommend this restaurant in a heartbeat!   Side Note: You probably want to plan on heading home to watch a movie and relax after dinner because you WILL be in a food coma!!

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Uncle Sal&#39;s Red Snapper Special was $25. So fresh and delicious!
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Uncle Sal&#39;s Scallops Piccatta is out of this world!
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This Coppola Cabernet from Uncle Sal&#39;s was amazing.

9cjF-i74tR--cgcAQrRt5w.text: Dined here on a Monday night. Group of six. We had a reservation, so seating was immediate. Very friendly and attentive staff. I personally had the shrimp scampi. The food quality and freshness was superior. Excellent md plentiful selection of wines. For dessert, I tried both the Tiramisu and Creme Brulee. Both were delicious and fresh. The tiramisu may actually be the best I've ever had. Accessible parking. Clean restaurant. Would 100% recommend..

A-RSIO15OC3edFKrNNO2LQ.text: Oh how I love Uncle Sal's!!!  Just had the lost awesome lasagna lunch with salad and homemade Italian dressing and garlic bread.    When I could not finish it all, leftovers boxed up with fresh bread so I could have dinner because my kitchen is being demo'ed due to a water leak.

q0x05PY-c6ayJRZGXmXyYg.text: I love this Restaurant. Every dish is made to order despite what others have said. Service is slower because each server has about 5-7 tables at a time; it's takes time to serve that many people at once. I have never been disappointed with the food or the courtesy of our servers.  Always look forward to coming back!

AINO0ieOnWhoGZOWNDpSgA.text: We hadn't been here for a few years and were reminded of it by loyal customers who have a place near us.  They are regulars and told me how great their meal had been a few days before.  We showed up with no reservation early on a Sunday evening.  We sat on the patio which was great!  I had clam pasta which wasn't as good as I remembered from an earlier visit.  My brother had chicken parmigiana which he loved.  My wife had prawns and lemons and caper sauce on linguine which she loved.  I loved the manhattans. Service was excellent: hostess was friendly and helpful.  Waiter was friendly and gave good suggestions plus good manhattans. We need to return soon.

BMqmVEXb9rVDpfQe07Dlhw.text: The waitress was horrible. I may have given it another try if it weren't for her snarky/bitchy attitude.  Note to owner: Your staff represents YOUR brand AND she was awful! I suspect you know who she is - blonde waitresses (mid-forties) outside patio. I get everyone has a bad day, but come on.  The hostesss wasn't the friendliest either. You may want to invest in some secret shoppers.   The food was not as good as folks are claiming it to be.  Overcooked seafood and overly buttered/oiled. Pasta was also overcooked as well. We asked 4 x for different drink - which never came.   I suggest Christo's if you want truly great Italian food..  Sue rocks it!

zVjLaFWW74c0y0zsFcqpLQ.text: Went tonight for the first time ever. Was surprised how crowded it was, especially in the bar where we found a couple of bar stools due to a nice couple moving over one spot for us. The bartender, Toni, greeted us and quickly brought us a couple of nicely-poured glasses of wine. The bar had a very nice energy to it, all of the help were busting their rear end to give very good service.  My wife's lasagna was excellent, a nice-sized portion. I had the Italian sausage with mushrooms and peppers. It was excellent, very nice flavor.   No happy hour, but overall the prices are fair, especially on the bar menu. Three TV's showing different games, but not many people (an older crowd) seemed to care.   We would give Uncle Sal's 6 stars if we could, just because of the friendly, rapid, always looking out for customers needing a refill, service of Toni, our bartender. She was funny and has built up a very good rapport with some obvious faithful diners.   We really enjoyed Uncle Sal's and will definitely be going back to say hello to Toni and enjoy some more food and wine.

IZlpWjhtDGhP4Hqthc9xig.text: Hidden gem! Been in the city for quite a bit and just found this gem. Had the Penne with Meatballs and marinara. It was fantastic. I will be coming back with the family for sure.   Make sure you get the salad with the Italian dressing. It was delicious as well.

xHd45EE6DHQhMVAkks5bGQ.text: I gave this place a 3 instead of a 4 bevause of thd excessive saltiness in the Lobster Ravioli as well as the Tortolino soup and the fact the Tiramisu was not done properly. The ravioli also only came with 3 ravioli. 3! Overall flavor was good. But the saltiness made it too much to bear.

dNqxpNyWEWljQs78wUdyGA.text: Had a nice dinner. My husband loved it. Me personally.. eh. Veal Parmesan was alright.   But in all honesty I wouldn't crave it

vxd2mbhXtIA7C7B0DzqGCQ.text: This was my 3rd visit to Uncle Sal's.  This time I had the Alfredo Fettucini with chicken and broccoli.  It was perfect.  The service was extremely attentive and the busser cleaned the table off as soon as the salad was done or drinks were empty. Very efficient! My disappointment came with dessert.  I ordered the creme brulee again, hoping it would be better than the last time.  It wasn't.  The dessert chef needs to learn how to make a proper custard. It should be creamy and set and chilled before the sugar is put on top and carmelized. Just like last time, underneath the beautifully carmelized sugar was the consistency of soft whipped cream, very runny. The flavor was good, but it was not custard.  Until the dessert chef gets it right, it should be off the menu.  I would have given five stars if it weren't for the creme brulee fail. Uncle Sal's is one of my favorite restaurants, but I will try the cannoli next time, as one of my dining partners said it was phenomenal.

sSG2sQ1nbN7Fm0CM7blD9A.text: We went to Uncle Sal's for the first time as a family last night. Cute little place on the inside. We were seated outside, not by choice... the table sloped and the outdoor patio chairs were uncomfortable. My husband had the Chicken Parmigiana, he loved it. One of my kids ordered the Cannelloni, he also loved it. My daughter had the tortellini alla panna, but the prosciutto was missing. She said it was still good but was disappointed about the prosciutto. My youngest ordered the ravioli and I had the lasagna. Honestly the flavor of my lasagna was amazing but it was served to me warm, not hot like it just got out of the oven. That was the same thing wrong with the ravioli it was barely warm. Again the flavor was amazing, my son liked it, but it just wasn't hot when served.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

PjXrrpe4mymvnDlcD_du0A.text: I really want to give this place 5 stars based on food alone but man oh man the service hasnt been great the last two times. The waiter disappears a lot and when another server ran our credit card, we sat for an extra 20 minutes enjoying the last of our champagne and he never once came by to see if we needed anything else or so we could thank him.  Anyway.. the food- to die for!! Start with their house salad and you wont be disappointed. I always get the chicken saltimbocca and it's the best chicken dish i've had anywhere. I could drink the sauce it comes with!  Even when we move out to Gilbert, this will be our go-to spot for Italian food :) just hope we get a different server.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Literally the best salad
Photo of Uncle Sal's Italian Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Saltimbocca. My obsession!

Geh1kEuMu-u7CtSSNaJS6g.text: Been here many times and it's a wonderful pace for real Italian food. Amazing seafood, tasty veal, pastas and deserts. The bar area is large and generally if you sit down you will make a few friends quickly.   The management is very nice and the staff seems well informed and trained.   Great place to go with a group or on a date night!

275USLBIzMOvpkMVYSYfeQ.text: We love Uncle Sal's! The wine list and generous pours always start dinner off right. They seem to pride themselves on top notch service even on hectic nights. The food is amazing and the price point is perfect for what you get. We love taking out of town guests here and Uncle Sal's never disappoints. This family owned and operated establishment is delightful. Make reservations on the weekends or plan to wait for a bar seat -- it's quite popular.

_fycsdZKh7QABL2vt0PA1w.text: Ate dinner at the bar. The bar menu is different than the dining room menu. The selections covered all tastes. I got the NY steak. Cooked to perfection. The staff was great. The generation gap was pretty big. I was the youngest in the room, so I knew I made a wise choice stopping. My gf got the wings, and she loved them too.

FJL2oKmk7HeuDQPb2nAS5w.text: Read a few reviews re the attitude of the bartender on Sundays. I agree he is very rude & surly. Although it took me 5 minutes to realize this since he was busy talking to friends while I waited to order. Asked the hostess to speak with a manager & was advised to call him Mon-Fri during biz hours. Kind of like dealing with a bank & not a place for enjoying food & refreshments.  Still haven't tried their food or drink & never will as too many good places in Scottsdale that don't express the attitude of this joint. Could say more, but why bother!!  I give them no stars.

_4nc7OUrwzPm6LSCWbeJhA.text: Really impressed. Lunch menu is almost too reasonably priced. Started with perfect garlic bread. Crisp edge but soft inside. Minestrone or salad come with dinner, both delicious. We got baked ziti, shrimp fettucini alfredo, tortellini al panna, saltimboca. All of it was great. All were great. Got lemon cheesecake creme brule and the hot brownie and vanilla. Last one won the table but all were great. Will come again, great service.

XdXJV_jvROBE3gtGlYyfXQ.text: Another bad  Italian take out story. Eggplant Parm and spaghetti was anything but that. I received a very small portion of eggplant but it was the lack of spaghetti that upset me. Two small bites smothered in sauce. For $16 i would think they could have spared a little bit more spaghetti. Called to complain but they said.the.manager left for the day despite the fact that they just opened. They lied and did not care. Avoid this cheap tasteless restaurant. Just another rip off joint.

4pfF8ss1hlAv1WpSwHGxBQ.text: This little place was great! I wouldn't expect so much out of a little hidden restaurant. The service was great and the food was amazing and didn't break the bank. Definitely recommend.

CYZJIpWxuHfQxG8RaFhgbQ.text: I love this place! Don't be fooled because it's in a strip mall. The food is amazing and the ambiance is really cool. If there's less than four of you, I recommend sitting in the bar because there's an additional menu with great options at cheaper prices. If you love eggplant as much as i do, I highly recommend the eggplant rollatini. It's awesome!

JUeZR5CHHOaMbnfDvbt9Sg.text: Warm and cozy dinning experience. The food was fantastic. I ordered the chicken parm as I always do anytime I go to any Italian restaurant. Coming from the east coast I am very picky about how they prepare and make it. Uncle sal's did a fantastic job and our waitress was great.

tGuglt9enbBk1i0XyC37SA.text: This place is just okay.  I admit that I am picky about Italian food, but I really thought the good was boring, and slightly overpriced for what it was.  I do like the interior vibe of the place-- homey and not overly pretentious-- and our server was nice enough.

n0uz7kjr8QDiD_87wvGLpw.text: Uncle Sal's is a neighborhood favorite. The cozy & comfortable dining room is perfect for any occasion. This place has great comfort food. We've had many dishes over the years and can't complain about any of them. Its good food.

zBpbSVcLep6lR7z8mb_CYg.text: Great place to eat, took my love on a date here and the food hit the spot. The Fettuccine Alfredo was good and her Chicken Parm looked yummy

fFoTYvm15ek_a62FRzDtmQ.text: This place is great. Everyone there was nice and accommodating. Very lovely place to have dinner on a special occasion. Fillet mignon is delicate and delicious. It was the mother's day special they had for lunch when I was there. Definitely worth the pricey special.

3MvoJVdmJzZtB3GW_OY2dQ.text: The bar menu is great. I had the shrimp, my friend had the scallops. They came with a side order as well and we both had the pasta. Both were great. They serve a big glass of wine! I will definitely go back to try other dishes on the menu.

RzuN2kav7D-B6E5RTV8FKw.text: Can I jus say everyone is so friendly here? I'm not sure of its family owned but it has the feeling of well-to-do that comes with pride in a business.  Our waitress was odd. But that's nothing new because I can think of one place I have been recently where the wait staff didn't do something strange. She recommended about 7 different things when I asked...which always frustrates me cause I don't that many. I do believe I said between chicken and the specials and she started talking about seafood. Meh.  They start you off with garlic bread, which is cool! But not the exact flavor my mouth desires of such treasures. Bummer.  Decent caesar, which has been hard to come by recently, annnd the penne bake. Oh my good. Cheese. More cheese. Gooey cheese. Broiled cheese. Ricotta cheese. Yes. My company said it was "okay"...he doesn't like cheese so a) I don't trust him anyways and b) his opinion is irrelevant.  If you read my review on the blind pig (which I don't think you did but they are the same owners so this feels repetitive) the short rib is great. But they put it over plain pasta. So weird. Beef broth, shredded like beef and spaghetti. Hehhhh. Good flavor though! Again...the people were so friendly! Anyways...go and support local business. Worth it.

TaIfNuIX1ra3P3L6WSsQZg.text: I kept hearing about this place and finally stopped in for dinner.  My only regret is waiting so long.  A comfortable and unassuming place where our experience started with a warm greeting and was followed by excellent service through the entire meal.  I'm a little picky about my veal parmesan but also wanted to try the house sauce.  Our server hooked us up with a extra bowl for dipping with the wonderful bread.  We sat on the patio and being located in a strip mall, you need to understand there is retail shopping traffic nearly arms length away.   Next time which will be soon I'll sit inside.

HEug8KtjH-qydCGH68fd5Q.text: Best service I've had at a restaurant in a long time. Our server was friendly, attentive and knowledgeable. The bussers never let our water glasses empty and the atmosphere was fantastic. Bread came out hot, salads were far beyond what you would expect and our entrees were delicious. The tiramisu is the best I've ever had and was too big for me to finish on my own. Prices were just what you'd expect, nothing unusual but more than you'd spend at a Chiles. We will certainly be back and will likely eat here for our anniversary.

oshrII8C1iwW0PAW9OZ2KA.text: Food is excellent. We sat at the bar for dinner. Big mistake. Service was terrible. Had the only guy behind the bar serving us. And he could have cared less. Will overlook the bad service, cause the place is great.

XIWFw0LUH2ZeQ2j-L7z83A.text: Food was good. The place was packed when we went. Good for adults, not very kid friendly. There's no kids menu. Luckily my daughter loves meatballs, we just got her a side of them. I will definitely try this place again.

VM4B4kh30gBEPDqJgnbxfQ.text: Really enjoy coming here for a nice but very fair priced italian dinner. Love to sit at the bar (when there is an open seat). Even though I'm in my mid-twenties and the bar crowd is a bit older I just really enjoy the atmosphere! I've always loved the food and the bar menu prices are such a deal! Always have great specials..usually seafood from what I've gathered. I can never have a meal here without enjoying their house salad and the garlic bread too!

JN8QDbi-5_rZ84X9w-1i0Q.text: Such mixed reviews.... I had to go, my NY Italian food needs in tow. It is so hard to get anything even close to authentic Italian in this desert....well, I really enjoyed everrything, my guests were gushing. Of course I had to try the hot wings, cuz I always do. They were excellent, no complaints, nice buffalo sauce and perfectly cooked. No, they really do not go with Italian food, but I went to college near Buffalo so I am addicted. We sampled a nice selection. The seafood dishes were good, Fra Diavolo sauce was right on, shrimp a bit chewy. The bar menu had a sausage and pepper entree that brought me back to the boardwalk. Of course, it didn't have that Newark bread we all love, but it was delicious. Their marinara was cooked down and flavorful, deep and dark. Some places seem to pour it our of the can. And meals come with salad!! AND GARLIC BREAD! Good, toasted garlic bread with flavor!! Drinks were great, wait staff was great, nice vibe. A bit of an older crowd, but that's the sign of a great Italian joint, right? I didn't get to try the Marsala...but the chopped steak smothered with onions was a crowd fave. So I vote thumbs up. I will be back. Oh, and happy hour specials, too.

tzJSOhC0vtsTx_lo5U5SJw.text: Two words: Eggplant. Rollatini. I get this every time (with a Cesar salad) because it is perfect and scrumptious. They make their own Caesar dressing, and it is a creamy and absurdly delicious recipe.  I actually buy it from the restaurant to take home; they will sell the dressing in a soup container for five dollars. As for the eggplant, the real star of this dish is actually the ricotta filling, which is a delicious ricotta with Italian herbs stuffed into perfectly cooked eggplant and topped with homemade marinara. I have also had the pizza here, and perhaps it's because I'm from New Jersey and/or a bit of a pizza snob, but I only thought it was Ok... nothing to write home about. The mediocre pizza aside, the eggplant, Caesar salad/dressing, and the garlic bread are all delectable, mouthwatering foods you will love.

Cg9h-8P6E4OGE1jDnv7VXg.text: Still a fan, but maybe not as much since my last visit.  Rather than ordering the Italian staples of pasta, chicken or pizza, I had the scallops scampi.  Scallops were a little overcooked and the sauce was just not right IMO.  The husband had rack of lamb.  He was not impressed either.  It was smothered in mushrooms-CANNED mushrooms.  I didn't believe until I tasted for myself.    If they were not from a can, then the Green Giant works in the kitchen.  Major points off with me.  Service could have been better as well.  We did try the smoked salmon bruschetta and thought it was very good.  We'll just stick with the basics next time.  Still four stars with pasta and pizza for me.

oDSTXRvs0T4KGmjcmPuF5w.text: GREAT food.  one of BEST veal dishes I've ever had AND reasonable prices.  Small family atmosphere but due to limited space, better make reservations.  Food like mama used to make.  Will be coming back here again and again.

IuHnjLMflZFoOpO8OVPDuA.text: Love Uncle Sal's! The staff is awesome especially Liz and Gage. I have only been in the bar but the prices on the bar menu are excellent and so is the ambiance! Thank you Liz and Gage for the excellent service!!

vUpepZZCFocgiHkNFw4JCA.text: Nice Italian restaurant in a strip mall. Once inside, you forget that you're in Arizona.  The food was average, but service impeccable. In fact, I was beyond disappointed in the flavor of the food as I had heard so many positive comments on this restaurant.   The escargot appetizer was the best of everything we tried. Dipping the tasty garlic bread in the hot butter sauce is a great way to clean up the appetizer. Every other food item just seemed to be missing something. The house salad with blue cheese was okay. Very mild tasting. Youbarely taste the dressing and the mozzarella garnered more of the attention. The salad definitely could have used some blue cheese crumbles. The crab bisque had a decent flavor, but you could tell fake crab was used. The chicken, veal and spinach cannelloni was far too mushy and needed a little more meatiness to it. The Veal Mario was very flavorful with the sun dried tomatoes, but the meat was overcooked. The Shrimp and Scallop Antoinette had the best combination of flavors of all the dishes. Shrimp a little overdone, but scallops were cooked perfect, as was the pasta. Great dish! The meatball side dish we shared as a table (you get two) were dry and had no flavor. I expected a lot more from meatballs from a True Italian restaurant.   The service was incredible with very knowledgeable and friendly staff. They always had water glasses filled and the waiter (Nick) timed and served the different courses of the meal perfectly. We never felt rushed or like we we're waiting too long for the next item.   While the flavor of the food was not at the level I expected, Uncles Sal's is worth a try. I'll be back as the service was great, and maybe the cooks were just having an off night!
